Tested all fail safe valves & lines to 250/4;500 psi. Function tested BOPs on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. All testes were done against 22" casing. Tested auto & manual IBOP valves to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each. Tagged top of cement at 9;170' with mill assembly and pumped 75 bbls of seawater with red dye; followed by 75 bbls of 11.6 ppg CaCl2. Started displacing hole with 10.5 ppg SBM. Drilled cement from 9;170' to 9;178'. Pumped slug & POOH from 9;179' to 934'. Re-tested upper & lower inner kill valves and lines to 250/3;500 psi for 5 min each with 10.5 ppg SBM. TIH to 9;179' & set wear bushing.
TIH & drilled cement & float equipment from 9;179' to 9;242'. Washed & reamed to 9;290' & drilled 10' of new formation to 9;300'. Performed FIT; 982 psi = 12.46 ppg EMW. Continued drilling to 10;558'. Drilled from 10;558' to 11;735' with Geo-pilot. Drilled from 11;735' to 12;063'. Flow checked well & pumped slug. POOH with Geo-pilot assembly due to problems steering Geo-pilot. RIH with BHA #5 to 11;980' and washed to bottom at 12;063'. Drilled from 12;063' to 15;274'. Increased mud weight to 10.8 ppg at 16;300' and continued drilling to 16;588'.
Note: At 16:05 hrs on July 17; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. John McCarroll with the Houma MMS to test the upper and lower inner kill valves and lines to 3;500 psi with 10.5 ppg mud.

Drilled from 16;588' to  17;582'. Circulated bottoms up to 22" casing shoe. Function tested BOPs on blue pod from the rig floor and the yellow pod from the toolpusher's panel. Short tripped to 16;630'. TIH and drilled ahead to 17;718'. Began backreaming; string torqued up and could not work pipe.  Pumped 75 bbls fresh water and spotted at bit.  TIH to 17;582' and drilled to 17;718'. Pipe became stuck 2' off bottom. Spotted 75 bbls of fresh water at BHA. Still not able to work pipe. Found problems with top drive and repaired same. Worked pipe free and circulated water out of hole. Caught and separated water from system. Backreamed from 17;718' to 17;492'. Drilled new hole from 17;718 to 18;155'.  Continued to drill from 18;155' to 18;293'.  While drilling to 18;295' pipe stalled due to torque and pipe became stuck. Pumped 10 bbls pre-mix; 500 bbls fresh water; and 10 bbls pre-mix. Spotted same with 50 bbls of water around BHA.  After total of 189 bbls of water; pipe became free. 
Circulated 500 bbls of water out. Reamed from 18;265' to 18;295'. Flow checked well and POOH to 17;585'. Flow checked again; pumped slug and POOH.  RIH with 18 x 22" bit stand. RIH with 9-1/2" drill collars. Made up test plug stand and RIH on 27 lb/ft drillpipe to 6;443'. Troubleshot communication problems with BOP control system.  Slipped and cut 119' of 2" drillpipe. Closed upper shear rams. Locked out connector. Re-booted BOP MUX control system. Program came back up and operating normal. RIH with test plug; landed in wellhead at 6;693'. Tested all BOP components on 6-5/8" drillpipe to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min each. Function tested on yellow pod from rig floor and on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. All tests good and BOP components functioning at 100%.  Unseated plug; pumped slug and POOH.  RIH with 18" x 22" drilling assembly to 18;260'.  Washed to bottom and started drilling 18" x 22" hole. Drilled from 18;295' to 18;486'.
At 18;486'; the BHA twisted off; lost 30;000 lbs weight and 3;000 psi pump pressure.  Circulated bottoms up and flow checked well. Pumped slug and POOH to wellhead at 6;944'.  Top of fish depth: 18;169'.  RIH with wear sleeve adaptor on MPT tool.  Latched into wear sleeve at 6;930'.  Sheared out wear sleeve and pulled up past choke line.  Pumped slug and started POOH. Made up fishing assembly and ran in the hole.
Latched and pulled fish off bottom with no overpull.  Pulled fish out of the hole wet.  Racked back BHA and top drive system.  Made up new 18" x 22" drilling assembly and tripped back into the hole.

Made up drilling assembly and tripped in the hole to 18;365'. Washed and reamed from 18;365' to 18;486'.  Drilled from 18;486' to 18;693'. MWD quit working; troubleshot tools. At 20:20 hrs on July 31; 2003 Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. Brad Hunter with Houma MMS to drill to 23;000' without taking directional surveys; provided that we survey any missing portions on the next trip in the hole. Drilled from 18;693' to 18;804'. Drilled out of the salt formation at 18;794' MD; (18;754' TVD).  Drilled from 18;804' to 19;175'. Decision was made to pull out of hole and pick up new LWD (for real-time data acquisition for pore pressure prediction and geological correlation). Tripped out of the hole with drilling assembly.
Tripped in the hole with new bottom hole assembly to 18;912'. Reamed and washed from 18;912'.  Re-logged hole section from 18;970' to 19;030'.  Continued washing and reaming to 19;175'. Drilled from 19;175' to 19;375'. Drilled from 19;375' to 20;371' with 85-120 RPM and 10-20;000 lbs weight on bit. Drilled from 20;371' to 20;542'.  While drilling at 20;542' the MWD/LWD tool failed. Decision was made to continue drilling without real-time logging data.  Drilled from 20;542' to 20;680'.  While drilling at 20;680'; lost 50;000 lbs of hookload weight and pump pressure went from 5000 psi to 3150 psi.  Drilling assembly twisted off in the bottom hole assembly.  Pumped 80 bbl super sweep and circulated bottoms up. Flow checked the well and tripped out of the hole to 8;319'. Function tested BOPE with blue pod from Toolpusher's panel; then from the rig floor with the yellow pod. 
 Continued to trip out of the hole.  Found that the bottom hole assembly twisted off in the box of the 7th joint of 6-5/8" HWDP on top of the 8-1/4" drill collars.  The top of the fish is at 20;133.40'.  The length of fish that was left in the hole is 546.60'. Slipped and cut drill line.  Serviced rig. Made up Dril-Quip Multi-purpose tool with emergency wear sleeve retrieval tool. Tripped in the hole with Dril-Quip wear sleeve retrieving tool and engaged wear sleeve at 6;930'. Overpulled 80;000 lbs and retrieved sleeve. Slugged drill pipe and tripped out of the hole with the wear sleeve. Picked up fishing bottom hole assembly with 17-1/2" cut lip guide and overshot dressed with an 8-1/4" grapple and pack-off.  Tripped in the hole to the top of the fish at 20;133'. Broke circulation to clear overshot of cuttings at 60 spm (1;300 psi initial pressure); then pressure dropped to 560 psi. Picked up and increased the pump strokes to 200 spm (2;200 psi) and worked overshot over fish and engaged grapple.  Worked pipe until fish was off bottom with no drag. Checked flow and slugged pipe. Tripped out of the hole with the fish.
Tripped in the hole with 17.5" bit and 21-3/4" Enlarge While Drilling (EWD) bottom hole assembly to 7;015'. Attempted to test MWD and did not get detection.  Changed modes and varied pump rates and still did not get detection. Tripped out of the hole from 7;015' to 5;768'.  Pumped 25 bbl sweep and flushed MWD tools.  Circulated at 900 gpm with signal detected.  Tripped in the hole to 9;242' and tested MWD at 900 gpm. Tripped in the hole to 20;500'. Brought mud pumps up to 900 gpm; MWD tools pulsed at 900 gpm with 85% signal strength.  Signal strength weakened as pump speed increased to 1;250 gpm.  Slowed pumps down to 900 gpm and signal strength was regained. Logged with MWD/LWD from 20;500' to 20;680' at 160 feet per hour and circulated at 900 gpm while Sperry troubleshot logging tools.
Continued to trouble shoot MWD/LWD after logging hole section and changed mud pump configuration to check for interference.  Signal strength weakened when increasing mud pumps from 900 gpm to 1;250 gpm (drilling rate).  Decision was made to drill at 1;250 gpm without real-time logging data and to slow pump rate to 900 gpm for suvey data when required.  Drilled from 20;680' to 20;707' with 15-25;000 lbs bit weight; 95 RPM; and 26-35;000 ft-lbs of torque using a 21-3/4" Tri-Max EWD reamer and 17-1/2" PDC bit.

8-5-03 - Finish P/U 9 5/8" liner; Baker liner hanger & ZXP liner top packer; R/D Casing tools; TIH slowly to 10445' w/full returns; C & C mud; Drop setting ball; & set hanger @ 6578'; Release from same; Set down w/50K; R/U Howco lines; Pump 40 bbl spacer; Mix & pump 1264 sks (294 bbls) of 17.0 ppg Premium cmt; Displace w/112 bbls of mud; Latch dart; Displace w/266 bbls of mud; Did not bump plug; Floats holding; P/U & set Baker liner top packer w/100k; Test TOL to 1500 psi; OK; P/U & circulate out Cement; Dumped cement & contaminated mud returns; Pump slug; POOH to L/D setting tool.  8-6-03 - POOH; L/D liner running tool; Test BOP stack to 250 psi & 6000 psi; All test OK; Repair top drive compensator; P/U 8 1/2" bit; MWD & directional BHA; TIH to TOL; C & C mud; Drill packoff bushing; TIH; Tag cmt stringer @ 10240'; C & C mud; R/U & test csg to 2000 psi for 30 minutes; OK; W & R to 10305'; Tag wiper plug; Drill plug; & firm cmt to LC @ 10350'.  8-7-03 - Drill float equipment; firm cmt & 10' of new hole to 10460'; C & C mud; FIT csg shoe @ 10445' to 1250 psi (18.5 ppg EMW); Drill & survey w/mud motor & MWD f/10460' to 11255'; Raise MW to 16.4 ppg.  8-8-03 - Drill f/11255' to 11430'; Circulate bottoms up; POOH to 10440' for wiper trip; Numerous tight spots; Worked through same; OK; Service top drive; TIH to 11430' w/no problems; Drill; slide & survey w/mud motor & MWD to 11870'. ART: drilling @ 11;996'.  8-09-03 Drill; slide & survey w/MWD f/11870' to 11996'; Circulate bottoms up; POOH for NB; Change out mud motor & MWD; TIH to 10;445'; Service top drive; TIH to 11996'; No problems; Drill; slide & survey to 12150'. ART: Drilling @ 12;372'.  8-10-03 - Drill; slide & survey w/mud motor & MWD f/12150' to 13121'; Circulate out; Max gas - 566 units w/mud cut to 15.8 ppg; Drill f/13121' to 13153'.  8-11-03 - Drill f/13153' to 13215'; hole packing off; raise MW; pump out of hole to shoe; TIH & ream 13105'-13215'. Raise MW to 17.2; made 5 stand short trip; ream to btm; CBU; POOH to log.

Reamed with 20" Rhino Reamer from 21;140' to 21;539'. Swivel packing started leaking; changed out same and tested to 5;000 psi with rig pump. Continued to ream from 21;539' to 21;656'. Had pressure loss while pumping; pressure dropped to 4;400 psi. Checked surface equipment. Pumped 80 bbls of 13.0 ppg super sweep and circulated bottoms up. Checked flow; pumped slug and POOH. Found box on 10' pony drill collar failed. Left bit; float sub; and pony collar in the hole. Made up fishing assembly and began TIH. TIH with 16" cut lip guide; spiral grapple; and mill control to 6;971'. Slipped and cut drill line. Continued TIH to 16;950'. Changed out pressure transducer on drawworks motor. TIH to 21;730' and broke circulation. Continued TIH to 22;770'. Attempted to work over fish. Worked down to 22;786'. Swivel packing went out when we started circulating. Flow checked; pumped slug and POOH from 22;786' to 2;364'. Retrieved 100% of fish. POOH with fish from 2;364'.
Made up BHA assembly. Latched bit; bit sub; and Smith 20" Rhino Reamer and RIH. TIH with Rhino Reamer to 21;350'. Opened Rhino Reamer at 21;350' and re-reamed hole from 21;350' to 21;620'. Only underguage section was from 21;535' to 21;550'; saw increased torque through this interval. Continued re-reaming from 21;620' to 21;656'. Reamed 17-1/2" hole from 21;656' to 22;064'. Lost torque; gradually lost 300 psi from 08:30 hrs. to 12:30 hrs. Checked surface equipment and slacked off without rotating; no resistance indicated that Rhino Reamer was not opening. Pumped slug and POOH to 275'.  TIH with Rhino Reamer to 21;750' and reamed a 17-1/2" hole to 20" from 21;750' to 22;495'. Currently underreaming at 22;606'.

Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
Continued underreaming 17-1/2" to 20" hole from 22;495' to 22;788'. Stopped at 22;770' due to stalling of drill string. Attempted to wash to bottom; could not wash past 22;788'. Spotted 100 bbls. of 16.2 ppg mud at 22;788' and pulled up to 22;640'. Pumped 125 bbls of Super Sweep. Circulated sweep out until hole was clean. Pumped slug and POOH from 22;600' to 19;928'. Continued POOH; retrieved wear bushing at wellhead. Finished POOH. Rigged up Schlumberger and ran Caliper/GR log from 22;597' to 18;500'. Pulled up to 9;450'. Caliper logged the 22" casing up to the wellhead. Rigged down Schlumberger. Picked up Dril-Quip jet sub and RIH to 8;988'. Washed 16" adapter and POOH. Washed wellhead and BOP stack on trip out. POOH with jet sub. Slipped and cut 238' of drill line. Held safety meeting. Ran shoe track assembly from derrick. Continued running 16" casing. Ran 12 stands of 16" casing from the derrick. Troubleshot Pipe Laydown System (PLS); re-booted computer system and re-indexed PLS; Pipe Racking System (PRS) and mousehole. Finished runnning 16"; 97 lb/ft; HC P-110; HD-L casing from 6;318' to 13;669'. Made up and ran 16" casing hanger and 																		
running tool. Ran 16" casing on 6-5/8" 50 lb/ft drillpipe from 13;669' to 15;863'. Swapped over to elevator inserts for 6-7/8" drillpipe. Continued running 16" casing on 6-7/8" drillpipe from 15;863' to 19;239'. Washed 16" hanger with choke and kill lines while running through BOP stack. Continued running 16" casing to 22;554'. Landed 16" in 16" x 22" profile at 8;988'. Tagged profile 23' high due to pipe stretch. Held safety meeting and rigged down elevators; bails; and flow back tool. Rigged up top drive and made up cement stand. Tested lines to 4;000 psi. Pumped 200 bbls of 12.5 ppg Dual Purpose Spacer. Dropped bottom dart. Cemented 16" casing with 876 bbls (3;464 sxs) Class H lead cement; mixed at 14.5 ppg (1.42 cu. ft/sx yield) with 7.01 gps seawater; 0.07% EZ-Flow; 10 gphs Halad 334EXP; 4 gphs WG-17EXP; 7 gphs SCR-100L. Followed with 224 bbls (1;136 sxs) of Class H tail cement; mixed at 16.2 ppg (1.10 cu. ft/sx yield) with 4.66 gps seawater; 0.07% EZ-Flow; 12 gphs Halad 344EXP and 6 gphs SCR-100L. Dropped top dart. Pumped 10 bbls of 12.5 ppg Dual Spacer.
 															Displaced with 3;072 bbls of 10.8 ppg mud with rig pumps at 20 bpm with full returns and no losses. Did not bump plug. WOC.                                                                              Laid down cement head. Picked up landing string to neutral point. Rotated landing string and observed landing string drop 10". Continued to WOC while boosting riser. Broke circulation. Tested choke line to 3;500 psi. Attempted to test and energize 16" seal
assembly. Pressured up to 2;500 psi. Pressure bled off to 1;800 psi in 5 min. Pressured up to 3;100 psi. Pressure bled back to 1;800 psi in 10 min. Picked up out of casing hanger. Circulated bottoms up to BOP. Pumped slug. POOH from 8;985' to 2;350'. Tested choke manifold to 250/4;500 psi. Continued POOH to surface with running tool. TIH with a jet sub and test plug. Function tested all shear rams on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. Performed casing test below stack to 610 psi to verify 22" casing integrity. Tested BOPE on yellow pod from the rig floor. Tested annular; upper; and middle pipe rams; and all fail safe valves with 6-5/8" drillpipe and both auto and manual IBOPs on the top drive to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min. each. Tested spare 6-5/8" TIW and 6-5/8" IBOP valves to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min. each. Tested middle pipe rams with 6-5/8" drillpipe to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min. each with the yellow pod from the rig floor. Tripped out of the hole from 7;355' to 384'. Note: Function tested diverter sequence from the rig floor panel.Function tested upper; middle; and lower shear rams with yellow pod from the rig floor panel.
TIH with mill and flush assembly to 8;985'. Established pump rates of 35 bpm at 2;300 psi and washed liner top. Circulated bottoms up to above BOPs. Checked for flow and tripped out of the hole with mill and flush assembly. Performed casing test below blind rams. Pumped at 3/4 bpm. Pressure broke over at 1;680 psi. Pumped 2 additional bbls and pressure stayed at 1;680 psi. Pressure held constant for 6 min.; then dropped to 1;000 psi. in less than 1 min. Pressure slowly dropped to 750 psi. in 20 min. Pressure dropped to 620 psi. in 60 min. Performed injection test at 1 bpm - 900 psi; 2 bpm - 1;000 psi; 2.5 bpm - 1;080 psi. TIH with 16" RTTS tool to 4;541'. 
Note: Received verbal approval from  Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office to extend the 22" casing test by 48 hours. Approval was granted at 10:15 hours on August 21; 2003. New test date will be August 25th.

Continued TIH with 16" RTTS to 8;985' (top of the 16" liner). Attempted to work RTTS through liner top; worked reverse torque down drill string & sat weight on tool to push through the liner top with no success. Checked well for flow; slugged pipe; and tripped out of the hole with RTTS tool. Picked up 14-3/8" stabilizer and placed under 16" RTTS & TIH (mule shoe at 10;110').  Stabilizer allowed RTTS to enter liner top with no drag. Set 16" RTTS tool at 9;022'.  Tested 16" casing to 3;100 psi and charted for 30 min. Closed annular; established injection rate of 4 bpm at 1;140 psi mud pumps. Shut mud pumps down and prseeure dropped to 800 psi.  Bled pressure off & opened annular.  Tripped out of the hole to 8;900'. Held pre-job safety meeting. Pumped 80 bbls surfactant fresh water; 0.4 gal/bbl surfactant AB; & 0.3 gal/bbl Sem8.
Pumped 65 bbls dual purpose spacer mixed with fresh water & 0.9 gal/bbl Sem8; weighted to 13.5 ppg.  Closed annular & mixed & pumped 200 bbls (1;040 sxs) of premium cement mixed with .07 EZ-Flo & 36 gphs liquid CaCl weighted to 16.4 ppg; mixed with seawater.  Displaced cement in the squeeze position with 10 bbls of 13.5 ppg weighted dual spacer; 6 bbls seawater; and 274 bbls of 10.8 ppg SBM.  Final squeeze pressure was 140 psi at 2 bpm.  Cement was in place at 19:00 hrs. WOC.  Opened well & monitored losses. Started circulating at 3 bpm with no losses.  Circulated bottoms up above BOP stack; staged pumps up to 22 bpm; 1;020 psi; no mud losses.  Checked for flow; slugged pipe and tripped out of the hole. WOC and TIH with 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" drilling assembly to 6;738'.
Tested 16" liner top against lower shear rams to 3;100 psi for 30 min.  Tested casing shear rams and upper shear rams to 250/3;100 psi for 5 min each.  TIH from 6;738' to 10;600' with drilling assembly. Washed through liner top from 8;887' to 9;021'.  Continued to TIH from 10;600' to 22;030'.  Washed and reamed from 22;030' to 22;040'. Performed well control drill; took choke line friction pressures.  Drilled top plug and cement from 22;040' to 22;049'. Continued drilling from 22;049' to 22;305'. Tagged bottom plug at 22;305'.  Drilled bottom plug and float collar from 22;305' to 22;309'.  Drilled cement from 22;309' to 22;532'.  Drilled float shoe from 22;532' to 22;534'.  Drilled cment from 22;534' to 22;550' and reamed open hole from 22;500' to 22;571'.  Verified formation exposure with MWD/LWD.  Circulated bottoms up above BOP stack and performed FIT.  Pressured up to 2;208 psi. with 10.8 ppg SBM (12.67 ppg EMW at surface; PWD = 13.17 ppg EMW downhole). 
Washed and reamed open hole from 22;571' to 22;297'. Drilled from 22;927' to 23;089'.  Lost pulser and real time data logging at 02:10 hrs at a depth of 23;040'.  Could not regain signal. Continued drilling to 23;089'. Flow checked well; slugged pipe; and tripped out of the hole. Started BOP function test when BHA was above the stack. TIH with 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" bicenter bit and BHA to 8;240'.  Installed wear sleeve in wellhead at 6;930'.  Function tested BOPE with yellow pod from the rig floor; then with the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel.  Finished TIH to 22;988'. Washed and reamed from 22;988' to 23;089'. Drilled from 23;089' to 23;277' with mud motor.  Increased mud weight from 10.8 ppg. to 11.1 ppg.
Drilled from 23;277' to 23;804' with mud motor; 0-10;000 lbs weight on bit; 60 RPM; and surface torque of 40-43;000 ft-lbs.  Increased mud weight from 11.1 ppg to 11.4 ppg at 23;560'.  Increased mud weight from 11.4 ppg to 11.7 ppg at 23;670'.  Added 4 ppb of TorqueSlide (graphite) with no noticeable improvement in torque.
Note: At 11:30 hrs. on August 30; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. Bryan Domangue; Houma MMS District Office; to drill out of the 16" casing shoe; verify that we are out of cement and in formation; and then test the casing shoe there; rather than drill to 22;937' (383' below the 16" shoe).

Drilled from 23;804' to 23;815' with mud motor. While drilling at 23;815'; a loss of 400 psi pump pressure occurred along with a loss of 10;000 ft-lbs of top drive torque. Penetration rates stopped. Picked up and attempted to drill - no success. Circulated botrtoms up; mud weight in & out was 11.7 ppg. No indication of influx. Tripped out of the hole.  Left 29' of mud motor & bit in the hole.  Assisted aft with making up 11-3/4" overshot dressed with 9-5/8" grapple; bumper jar; and oil jar.  TIH with fishing assembly to 23;700'.  Tagged fish with 20;000 lbs down and had a pressure increase of 150 psi.  Released torque and picked up; no indication of fish.  Slacked back off and set 55;000 lbs down on the fish and got 300 psi pressure increase.  Released torque and picked up 985;000 lbs pick-up weight.  Bumped fish with bumper jars and 60;000 lbs down 3 times to make sure fish was swallowed.  Checked with pump; 100 spm (1;900 psi).  Mud weight in equaled mud weight out. No indication of influx.
Pumped slug; checked flow; and tripped out of the hole. Did not recover fish. Scarring on the 9-5/8" grapple indicated that the fish was in the overshot up to the stop at the top sub. The packoff was missing; and the shear disc was not ruptured.  Broke overshot down and redressed with 9-1/2" grapple; added upper extention sub.  Made up BHA and TIH.  Tagged fish without rotating with 8;000 lbs and had 200 psi increase while pumping 131 spm = 1;800 psi.  Bumped down on fish with bumper jars 2 times using 60;000 lbs; 90 spm = 1;650 psi. Put 140;000 lbs down on fish & pumped slug. Checked well for flow & tripped out of the hole. Tripped out of the hole with fishing assembly from 5;670'. Recovered motor and bit.
Made up 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" drilling assembly & TIH to 23;512'. Washed & reamed from 23;512' to 23;815'. Drilled from 23;815' to 23;860' with mud motor.  Increased mud weight from 11.7 to 11.9 at 23;817'. Continued drilling to 24;277'.  Increased mud weight from 11.9 ppg to 12.1 ppg at 24;220'.  Circulated at 24;277' due to 300 units of background gas; mud weight in was 12.1 and was cut to 11.4 at shaker.  Decision was made to stop drilling and raise mud weight from 12.1 ppg to 12.4 ppg to trip out of the hole.  Began circulating 12.4 ppg mud at midnight. Performed swab test; no gain observed in the trip tank. Circulated bottoms up. Gas dropped from 60 units to 37 units. Monitored well for flow; slugged pipe; & tripped out of the hole from 24;277' to 22;178'.  Flow checked well again. Continued tripping out of the hole to 15;045'. Picked up test plug & TIH to 6;930'. Landed test plug in wear sleeve; bit depth was 21;974'. Tested BOPE from the blue pod on the rig floor. Tested annular; upper & middle pipe rams; & all fail safe valves with 6-5/8" drillpipe & both auto & manual IBOPs on top drive to 250/4;500 psi low/high for 5 min each. 
Function tested with yellow pod from the toolpusher's panel. Function tested diverter sequence. Unseated plug & tripped out of the hole. While tripping; tested choke manifold & spare valves to 250/4;500 psi low/high for 5 min each test. POOH with test plug. TIH with 17-1/4" drilling assembly to 24;277'. Pumped 85 bbls of Barolift sweep. Spotted 20 bbls of 16.2 ppg mud on bottom. Pulled above 16.2 ppg mud and continued to circulate. Flow checked; pumped slug; and pulled out of the hole to 100'.

Finished POOH. Rigged up Schlumberger & picked up caliper tool. RIH & ran caliper log from total depth to 16" casing shoe. POOH with logging tools. Made up washing assembly & TIH. Washed wellhead and hang-off profile. Began picking up 13-3/8" casing. RIH to 1;845'. Continued to run 13-3/8" x 13-5/8" casing from 1;845' to 17;021'. Ran a total of 2;499.37' of 13-3/8"; 72 ppf; HC Q-125; SLX casing; 2;733.21' of 13-5/8"; 88.2 ppf; HC Q-125; HDL casing; and 12;083.13' of 135/8"; 88.2 ppf; HC Q-125; SLX casing. Made up 13-5/8" casing hanger running tool. TIH with casing on landing string from 17;299' to 20;278'. TIH with 6-7/8" Oil & Gas Rental LAST landing string. Landed casing with shoe at 24;251' and hanger at 6;935'. Made up cement stand. Tested lines to 8;000 psi. Pumped (with rig pumps) 150 bbls of 14.0 ppg spacer with 30% returns. Started pumping at 105 gpm & pressure went to 1;350 psi before dropping abruptly to 950 psi and then leveling off; staged pumps up to 10 bpm--final pressure was 1;050 psi. Mixed & pumped 1;102 sxs (214 bbls) of 16.2 ppg premium cement mixed with .07% EZ-Flow + 12 gphs Halad 344 EXP + 11 gphs SCR 100L at yield of 1.09 cu. ft/sx.																		
Displaced cement at 11 bbls/min with 2;750 bbls of 12.8 ppg. Final circulating pressure was 1;200 psi; bumped the plug with 1;000 psi over that. Set the seal assembly & tested to 7;700 psi. Began testing annular to 250/7;000 psi. Tested with yellow pod from the toolpusher's office. Tested BOPE: upper & middle pipe rams; all fail safe valves & lines ( except bleed lines) to 250/7;700 psi for 5 min each test. Tested annular & fail safes on bleed line to 250/7;000 psi for 5 min on each test. Picked up above BOPs; checked for flow; and pumped slug. POOH from 6;816' to 104' with landing string. Well began flowing back at 0.5 bbls/min. Shut well in; pressure built up to 300 psi. Made up wear bushing assembly & RIH with same to 6;394'. Opened well on stripping tank. Bled back 1 bbl. Opened shear rams. Continued to RIH. Landed wear bushing at 6;934'. Pulled wear bushing running tool; indicators showed wear bushing was left in hole.																		
Continued to POOH with wear bushing running tool. Wear bushing came back with the tool. Inspected tool & wear bushing. None of the shear pins on the wear bushing were sheared. Replaced o-rings. Added 2 stands of HWDP under running tool. RIH with wear bushing to 5;341'. Finished TIH with wear bushing; boosted riser with 13.4 ppg mud. Landed wear bushing. Pulled past choke line with 1;200 psi. Indicators indicated wear bushing was set. Pumped slug & POOH. The wear bushing was still on the running tool. Tested casing to 4;300 psi for 30 min while POOH. Tested both seta of shear rams to 250/4;300 psi. Rigged up & tested Top Drive valves to 250/7;700 psi. Tested Kelly hose & swivel packing to 250/6;000 psi. Made up wear bushing running tool & TIH with same to 6;934'. Closed annular & pressured up with cement unit to 2;500 psi. to set wear bushing. Bled off pressure; opened well; and had 30;000 lb. shear out. Pumped slug & POOH. TIH with 12-1/4" HUghes MXC-1 to 9;091'. TIH to 23;734'. Washed & reamed from 23;734' to 24;010'. Drilled plugs; landing collar; shoe track; and rat hole to 24;277'. 																		
Circulated bottoms up to BOP stack. Flow checked well. Closed annular & located joint. Performed preliminary LOT with 12.7 ppg mud. LOT = 14.2 ppg EMW; 10 second casing shut in was 1;851 psi. No gas on bottoms up. Flow checked; pumps slug & POOH to 16;578'. Changed out ram guides and continued to POOH to 4;259'.

PAPERWORK REDUCTION ACT OF 1995 (PRA) STATEMENT: The PRA (44 U.S.C. 3501 et seq. Requires us to inform you that we collect this information to obtain knowledge of equipment and procedures to be used in drilling operations.  MMS uses the information to evaluate and approve or disapprove the adequacy of the equipment and/or procedures to safely perform the proposed drilling operations.  Responses are mandatory (43 U.S.C. 1334).  Proprietary data are covered under 30 CFR 250.196.  An agency may not conduct or sponsor; and a person is not required to respond to; a collection of information unless it displays a currently valid OMB Control number.  Public reporting burden for this form is estimated to average 1 hour per response; including the time for reviewing instructions; gathering and maintaining data; and completing and reviewing the form.  Direct comments regarding the burden estimate or any other aspect of this form to the Information Collection Clearance Officer; Mail Stop 4230; Minerals Management Service; 1849 C Street; NW; Washington; DC 20240.

POOH with 12-1/4" rock bit. Sperry Sun loaded sources in the BHA. TIH to 24;227'. Drilled from 24;277' to 24;287'. Circulated cuttings clear of BHA. Drilled from 25;220' to 25;543'. Picked up off bottom 30 ft. and function tested all BOP components from the toolpusher's panel on the blue pod and from the driller's panel on the yellow pod. Continued to POOH; downloaded radio active sources & drained motor. Inspected bit & passed to aft block for downloading. Tested all choke manifold valves; spare safety valves; & failsafes to 250/7;700 psi for 5 min. each. FInished testing BOPs; tested middle pipe rams with 6-5/8" to 250/7;700 psi. 																		
Function tested BOP from toolpusher's panel with yellow pod. Tripped out of the hole with test plug. Rigged up to run 11-3/4" casing. Ran 11-3/4"; 65 lb/ft; HC Q-125; Hydril SLX liner plus Baker liner hanger with ZXP packer. Picked up 6-5/8" drill pipe elevators & rigged up OES flowbacl tool & controls. Dropped dart & pumped 10 bbls. of 15.0 ppg dual spacer to release dart. Displaced cement with rig pumps at 10 bpm with 13.8 ppg SBM; dart sheared w/2;600 psi increase at 520 bbls. 																		
Landed plug w/3;550 psi & total displacement of 805 bbls of 13.8 ppg SBM. Cement was in place at 18:50 hrs. Bled off pressure & checked floats. Pressured up to 4;800 psi; liner hanger set. Attempted to pull out of liner top w/dual packoffs; pressured up to 4;000 psi several times. Worked packoffs out of liner at 23:30 hrs. Circulated bottoms up at 23;809'. Tripped out of hole from 23;809' w/liner running tool. Picked up 750 ton drilling bails & TIH w/10-5/8" drilling assembly to 6;444'. Tested liner top ZXP packer against lower shear rams to 250 psi for 5 min. and 2;500 psi for 30 min. Tested upper shear rams to 250/2;500 psi for 5 min. each. Continued TIH to 25;992' & tagged cement. Washed w/mud motor from 25;992' to 26;063' & tagged cement. Drilled cement w/mud motor from 26;063' to 26;197'. At 10:45 hrs. on September 26; 2003; Leah Bade received a verbal waiver from Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office to modify the upcoming BOP test. We may test the annular preventer against 5" drill pipe only; an annular test against 6-5/8" drill pipe will not be required.

Performed LOT with 13.8 ppg surface mud weight. LOT = 15.1 EMW. Drilled from 26;461' to 26;760' w/mud motor. Suspended drilling operations. Riser tensioners S-1 and S-2 seals completely blew out & tensioner P-2 was leaking. Running in manual mode to keep up w/Nitorgen demand. Circulated 15 mins. & flow checked well. Pumped slug & started tripping out of the hole to replace tensioners. Repaired tensioners. Pumped up complete system ; all tensioners holding 1;200 psi; but S-2 was still leaking fluid slowly due to rod being scored in seal area. The nitrogen generator was repaired & back on line at 100%. Decision was made to TIH & drill. Loaded sources in Sperry tools & TIH with 10-5/8" drilling assembly. TIH from 266' to 12;250'. Tested MWD & pumped 600 gpm. Changed transducers & received signal. Function tested BOPs with yellow pod from toolpusher's panel & with blue pod from rig floor. Continued TIH from 12;250' to 26;419'. Washed & reamed from 26;419' to 26;760'. Drilled from 26;760' to 26;764' w/mud motor.
Sperry's signal was too weak to detect; so pumps were slowed to 450 gpm & RPM to 80; & detection returned. Drilled from 26;764' to 26;946' at reduced pump rate of 480 gpm and 90 rpm (17'/hr) in order to get MWD to work real-time. The decision was made to increase pump rate & rotary speed to attain maximum penetration. Continued drilling to 27;272'; taking surveys w/400 gpm. Logged 3rd stand w/Sperry Sun from 27;145' to 27;272'. Continued drilling from 27;272' to 27;537'. Logged second stand from 27;402' to 27;531'. MWD/LWD signals were undetectable while drilling at 700 gpm & 125 rpm. Drilled from 27;537' to 27;990'. Note: MWD/LWD started logging at drilling parameters due to noise levels diminishing from 27;682' to 27;765'. Detection ceased when noise levels increased. Drilled from 27;990' to 28;171'. Logged w/MWD from 28;036' to 28;171'. Drilled from 28;171' to 28;297'. Logged w/MWD from 28;170' to 28;297'. Drilled from 28;297' to 28;427'. Troubleshot increase in pump pressure. Appeared to be a plugged nozzle. Continued to drill to 28;481'. Decision was made to POOH due to three plugged nozzles. Logged from 28;427' to 28;481' w/MWD while circulating bottoms up to POOH. Racked back one stand & logged from 28;297' to 28;427' w/MWD. Finished circulating bottoms up w/13.8 ppg mud. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 28;436' to 28;164'. Flow checked & POOH to 10;902'. Pumped slug at the shoe & performed maintenance on pipe rubbers.

POOH. Made up & RIH w/new 10-5/8" BHA. Made up BOP test plug with Nu-Tech 6-5/8" x 5" test joint. TIH & landed test plug in wellhead. Tested BOPs & related equipment. Tested on yellow pod from toolpusher's office.Tested annular to 250/7;000 psi & tested rams to 250/7;700 psi. Function tested on blue pod from the rig floor. POOH w/test plug. TIH with 10-5/8" drilling assembly to 28;407'. Washed & reamed from 28;407' to 28;481'. Could not get MWD working. Drilled from 28;481' to 28;531'. Attempted to get MWD working; attempt failed. Drilled from 28;531' to 29;066'. Circulated to separate drilled gas. Performed static influx test & circulated bottoms up. Pumped 80 bbls of super sweep & weighted well bore up to 14.0 ppg. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 29;050' to 27;765'. TIH from 27;765 to 29;050'. No drag. Pumped 80 bbls of super sweep & circulated bottoms up. Bottoms up showed no increase in water or decrease in water phase salinity. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 29;050' to 26;351'. Flow checked well; well was static.

Continued w/MDT logging. Logged a total of 79 attempted pressures; 49 were successful; 27 were tight; 2 seal failures; and 2 super charged points. Obtained 2 pump outs and samples from 26;702' & 27;521'. Used 4 sample bottles; 2 additional bottles were left. Continued w/MDT program. Attempted 114 pressure tests; 69 were successful; 40 were tight; 3 had seal failures; 2 were supercharged; had 3 pump out; and took 6 samples. Completed first MDT run. POOH. Function tested all fail safe valves from the toolpusher's office on the blue pod while POOH. Continued to POOH while function testing the annular; upper blind rams; middle blind rams; and lower blind rams on the blue pod from the toolpusher's office. Functioned all fail safe valves; annular; and all three blind shear rams on the yellow pod from the rig floor. RIH with OBMI/DSI/GR/ TO 28;150'. Logged up to 26;419'. POOH with OBMI/DSI. Flushed choke & kill lines. RIH w/MDT tools. Performed MDT logging; per program. Obtained 1 pump out sample at 26;639'. Attempted a total of 39 points; 11 were successful; 20 were tight; had 1 seal failure; 7 were aborted; 3 pump outs were done; & 10 samples were taken. At midnight; we pumped out at 28;030'. Obtained 2 samples. Released MDT probes & POOH w/MDT. Made up VSP tools & RIH. Made 4 stops at 8;700'; 18;800'; 23;250'; and 26;550'. Ran to 28;150'. Began logging up; obtaining VSP shot levels every 50' from 27;950' to 19;996' at midnight. Continued to take 50' VSP levels from 19;996' to 17;500'. Started taking 500' VSP levels from 17;500' to the wellhead. Picked up MDT (2 probes; pressure only). RIH to the shoe & stabilizer tool. Performed MDT. Attempted 32 stations; 13 were successful; 15 were tight; we had 3 seal failures; and 1 was super charged. Set down at 28;510' & pulled up to 18;000 lbs on the cable; the jars went off; and the tool was free. Set down at 28;710'. Deepest pressure was taken at 28;927'. POOH w/MDT tools. Changed out wireline spool to 446 KMXXS; tested mechanical coring tool. RIH w/MSCT & took 7 core samples starting at 28;070'; 28;068'; 28;049'; 28;030'; 27;815'; 27;814'; & 27;813'. Schlumberger dropped down 100' to 27;903' & was pulling up to set the tool at sample depth of 27;812'. While pulling up the wireline parted (between the capstan and the sheave under the rig floor). Rigged down Schlumberger.  	Ordered wireline fishing tools.	At 09:45 hrs. on October 16th; 2003; Leah Bade spoke with Brad Hunter; Houma District MMSOffice; and received a verbal extention of the BOP function test by 24 hrs. At 11:00 hrs on October 16; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Brad Hunter; Houma District MMS Office; to exclude the pipe ram tests from the required BOP function test. We will be required to function test the pipe rams the first time we have pipe across the stack. MMS came on board today; 10-16-03: Mr. Jerry Freeman. No incidents.

roll stop sub into wear bushing w/3 turns to the right; & torque increased to 1;500-1;900 ft/lb. Tripped out of the hole w/wireline fishing assembly using the compensator. Tested annular w/5" to 250/7;000 psi; lower pipe rams w/5" to 250/7;700 psi; upper & middle rams with 6-5/8" & 5" pipe sizes to 250/7;700 psi; choke manifold; all valves & spare valves to 250/7;700 psi. Function tested BOPE from toolpusher's panel w/yellow pod. Functioned upper; middle; & lower shear rams while POOH. Tripped out of the hole w/test plug. RIH w/USIT logging tool & began logging up at 23;742'. Continued running USIT log from 21;550' to 6;930'. Rigged down Schlumberger. Rigged up OES casing equipment to run 9-3/8" liner. Rigged down 9-3/8" casing equipment. Picked up Baker Oil Tools ZXP Flex Loc liner hanger. Rigged up flow back tool dressed for 6-5/8" drillpipe. Continued to TIH to 29;061' w/full returns. Held pre-job safety meeting. Rigged up Halliburton & broke circulation at 2 bpm. Tested lines to 5;000 psi. Displaced cement w/rig pumps & 14.0 ppg SBM. Pumped at 8 bpm; dart sheared at 529 bbls w/2;570 psi & bumped plug w/921 bbls; at a pressure of 3;000 psi. from 26;498' to 21;484' after spotting cement plug from 23;498' to 22;998'. Circulated bottoms up to top of the BOP stack to clear residual cement from the casing. POOH from 4;998' w/setting tool. Racked back top drive & rigged up floor to pull the BOP stack. Pulled out and laid down diverter. 01/17/2015: Identified source of leak for diverter pressure test as mud fill valve. Repaired mud fill valve and pressure tested diverter to 500 psi - good test. Performed flow and function test on diverter - good test. Rigged down riser running equipment.

Increase mud weight from 11.8 ppg to 12.0 ppg while drilling cement. Wash and ream rat hole to 23;548' and drill 10 ft of new formation from 23;548' to 23;558'. Pump sweep and circulate to 500' above BOPs.

03/24/2013: Troubleshoot and repair slip joint packer issue. Trip in the hole to 23;353'. Perform 16" casing shoe test; obtaining a 13.72 ppg EMW surface. Wash down from 23;354' to 23;558'. Drill 14-1/2" hole from 23;558' to 23;715'. Activate 16-1/2" Rhino-reamer. Back ream from a bit depth of 23;675' to 23;592'; placing reamer 10' below 16" shoe. Ream back to bottom and drill 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section to 23;736'. 

Note: Jim Burt (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) via after hours voicemail; informing him of a 5 bbl spill of 11.8 ppg SBM into the moonpool due to a mechanical failure.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) to drill the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section with a 0.4 ppg drilling margin.

03/25/2013: Drilling 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section from 23;736' to 24;580'.

03/26/2013: Drilling 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section from 24;580' to 25;600'. Weighting up as per schedule to 13.3 ppg.

03/27/2013: Drill from 25;614' to 26;658'. Observed losses at 12-15 bbls/hr. Circulated LCM pill sweeps. 20 bbl/hr losses after LCM sweep at half the drilling rate. 60 bbl/hr losses at drilling flow rate. Drill from 25;658' to 25;667' and circulate LCM sweep. While making a connection; observed 1.7 bbl gain - determined to be ballooning after flow check/swab test. Circulate LCM pill sweeps.

Note: Matthew Albers (CVX) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) to utilize the revised SureTec Software Version 2.4 conditions of approval.

03/28/2013: Circulate LCM sweep at 25;667'. Spot 650 bbls of Tiger Bullet LCM pill in open hole. Pump out of the hole while logging with MWD to 24;563'.

03/29/2013: Pump out of the hole while logging with MWD from 24;563' to 23;514'. R/U OES flow back tool and pump out of the hole from 23;514' to 16;672'. Function BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel; Blue pod. Function test diverter on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) of an 18 hr BSR Function Test extension.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) of a 72 hr BOP Pressure Test extension.

03/30/2013: Pump out of the hole from 16;672' to 9;602'. Continue POOH without pumping from 9;602' to 7;460'. Drop PBL activation ball and wash BOPs and wellhead. Pull out of the hole from 7;460' to 6;532'. Function BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod and rig down OES flow back tool. Slip and cut 149' of drill line. Service MDDM and traveling block assembly. Change out FWD drill line upper guide kite cable and roller.

03/31/2013: Continue to change out drill line kite and roller. Pump slug and POOH from 6;532' to surface. Rig up Frank's casing equipment and run 14" liner from surface to 268'.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received approval via email on 03/31/13 from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) for shallow setting of the 14" liner.

04/01/2013: Running 14" liner from 268' to 15;708'.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 04/01/13 for a 24 hour BOP Pressure Test extension.

04/02/2013: Run 14" liner to TD at 25;662' MD/ 25;002' TVD and cement 14" liner with zero returns. Pumped total of 971 cu ft of cement.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) for another 24 hour BOP Pressure Test extension on 04/02/13 at 16:13 hrs.

04/03/2013: Set Versaflex Hanger; verify hanger set with 100k overpull and release from same. Rig down lines and Cement Head; pump wiper ball and circulate and condition mud. POOH 5 stands; wait on weather and pressure test BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow pod.

04/04/2013: Pressure Test BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow pod; suspending testing operations as weather squalls pass through. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod.

04/05/2013: POOH with landing string and liner hanger setting tool. Pressure test casing against BSR to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes.

04/06/2013: Function tested BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Finish pressure test casing against BSR to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes. Rig up Schlumberger wireline and ran CBL and USIT log - determined TOC to be at 24;300' MD. Run Fas-drill on E-line; and was unable to get Fas-drill past top of 14" liner. POOH with Fas-drill.

04/07/2013: Pull out of the hole with FasDrill on E-line. Inspected FasDrill and 7 slip segments were lost in hole. Slip and cut drill line. Trip in hole with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly to above BOP. 

04/08/2013: Trip in hole with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly; wash through 14" top of liner at 22;833'; then continue to trip in hole to top of cement at ~25;313' MD. Circulate and condition mud and pull out of hole.

04/09/2013: Pull out of hole from with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly on 6-5/8" drill pipe from 22;896' to surface. Rig up Schlumberger E-line; make up and run in hole with 12" gauge ring and junk basket assembly. Tagged up the assembly and did not go past 24;315'. Pull out of hole with E-line and unable to pull past top of 14" liner.

04/10/2013: Continue to attempt to free gauge ring on Schlumberger E-Line. Burn E-Line at electrical control release device (ECRD); pull out of hole with E-Line. Functioned blind shear rams from Toolpusher's panel on Blue pod. Pick up and run in hole with overshot/grapple fishing assembly on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 7;717'. 

04/11/2013: Continue run in hole with 11-7/8" x 5-3/4" fishing assembly with 3-3/4" grapple and control and engage fish at 22;863'. Confirm fish on with pump out sub; burst disc in pump out sub and pull out of hole with fish to 47'. Functioned BOP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue pod.

04/12/2013: Lay out fish and fishing assembly. Slip and cut drill line. Trip in hole with reverse circulating basket and junk basket assembly from surface to 22;962'. Washed at 14" TOL. 

04/13/2013: Wash down from 25;216' and tag top of cement at 25;449' with 18k. Pull out of hole to surface. Break down reverse circulating sub and junk basket assembly. Make up FasDrill packer on drill pipe.

04/14/2013: Run in hole with FasDrill packer on 6-5/8" drill pipe from surface to 25;451' MD. Set FasDrill packer at 25;421' MD. Pressure test packer to 1;500 psi for 15 minutes. Rig down lines; pump slug and pull out of hole.

04/15/2013: Pull out of hole from 25;386' to 8;832'. Pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 13.3 ppg WBM to 250 psi low and 8;000 psi high and annular to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high with 13.3 ppg MW. All tests utilized IPT software from Driller's panel Blue pod.

04/16/2013: Finish pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 13.3 ppg WBM to 250/8;000 psi on BOP rams and 250/8;000 psi on annular. All tests utilized IPT software from Driller's panel Blue pod. Spot base oil and complete negative test of 1;870 psi on 14" liner top. POOH with MST. Slip and cut drill line. Begin planned Health Checks on MDDM. Function BOP from Driller's panel on Yellow pod. Function Diverter from Toolpusher's panel.

04/17/2013: Finish Health Checks and planned maintenance. R/U Frank's casing handling equipment. RIH with 13-3/4" tieback casing to 10;653'. Function BSR from Driller's panel on Yellow pod prior to crossing the BOP stack.

04/18/2013: Continue TIH with 13-3/4" tieback on 6-5/8" landing string from 10;653' and land out in 18-3/4" wellhead at 7;118'; tieback depth of 22;727' MD. 

04/19/2013: Rig up hydraulic and co-flex hoses to cement head. Land casing hanger in wellhead; maintain 100k of tension on landing string. Mix and pump 1050 cu ft of 14.2 ppg lead and 528 cu ft of 16.6 ppg tail cement slurries; displace same. Top plug did not bump. Check floats; holding; and wait on cement. ETA for cement cure is 14:30 hours on 04/20/13.

04/20/2013: Wait on cement until 14:30 hours. Spot base oil in kill line and riser/BOP. Make multiple attempts to set and test Drill-Quip seal assembly with no success. Begin u-tube base oil out of kill line and riser/BOP.

04/21/2013: U-tube base fluid out of riser and choke/kill/boost lines. Boost riser volume; 13.3 ppg returns. Flow check well; static. POOH with Drill-Quip casing hanger running tool. Begin TIH with Drill-Quip flush/mill assembly.

04/22/2013: Finish TIH with Drill-Quip flush-mill assembly. Circulate and condition mud. Flow check well - static. Complete flush-mill operation and POOH. TIH with seal setting assembly. Spot base fluid in riser and set seal assembly. Pressure up 4;280 psi and engage seal assembly in hanger; pressure test seal assembly 10;000 psi surface pressure. Displace base oil out of hole with 13.3 ppg SBM. Shear out of Drill-Quip running tool; and pressure test seals to 8;000 psi for 5 min. Begin POOH with seal setting assembly.

04/23/2013: TOH with Drill-Quip seal assembly running tool; slip and cut drill line; service rig and perform planned maintenance. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" BHA. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod. Function test Diverter from Driller's panel. Function BOP from Driller's panel on Blue pod.

Note: Mr. James Richard and Clinton Campo (BSEE Houma District Inspectors) arrived on board at 12:32 hours. Inspectors reviewed IADC reports and BOP test charts and procedures. Inspectors departed rig at 15:00 hours.

04/24/2013: TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" drilling assembly and Drill-Quip MPT with wear sleeve to 12;457' bit depth. Set wear sleeve at 7;117'. Flow check well - static. POOH with Drill-Quip MPT from 12;457' to 6;409' and lay out. Pressure test BSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod using 13.3 ppg SBM to 250/3;300 psi for 5 minutes each on chart. Establish operating parameters of Smith XC Reamer. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow pod. Perform planned maintenance. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" drilling assembly from 6;409' to 21;240'. Change out slip joint air packer inserts. 

Note: Chevron received written approval to modify the RPD from Bryan Domangue (BSEE Houma District) for setting the 14" liner 398' TVD higher than original plan.

04/25/2013: Record SCRs and CLFP; TIH to 21;508'; wash to TOC at 22;361'. Drill 13-3/4" tieback cement and float equipment from 22;361' to 22;722'. Wash and ream 22;722' to 22;770'. Drill cement from 22;770' to 22;830'. Wash through 14" liner top at 22;833 and continue wash down to 22;975'. Pump weighted sweep; circulate and condition hole.

04/26/2013: Circulate weighted sweep out of hole at 22;975'. TIH and tag FasDrill packer at 25;414'. Perform choke drill. Pressure test 14" x 13-3/4" casing to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes. Clear condensation from emergency generator switchboard. Drill FasDrill packer; cement and float equipment from 25;414' to 25;591'.

04/27/2013: Drill cement and 14" shoe at 25;622'. Clean out rathole to 25;667'. Drill 10' new formation to 25;677' MD. Sweep hole with high viscosity weighted sweep. Pump sweep to 500' above BOP. Perform FIT to 14.79 ppg EMW surface. Drill 12-1/4" hole to 25;789'. Pull back to 25;772' and activate Rhino reamer. Ream 10' and perform push/pull test 15k. Ream back to bottom at 25;789' with reamer arms open. Drill 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 25;789' to 25;880'.

04/28/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 25;880' to 26;805'. Close Rhino XC Reamer per Schlumberger procedure. Drill 12-1/4" hole from 26;805' to 26;903'.

04/29/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 26;903' to 27;391'. Flow check well and well was static. Sweep hole with 100 bbls 16.0 ppg Hi-Vis weighted sweep. Flow check well and well was static. TOH for BOP test from 27;391' to 15;894'.

04/30/2013: TOH from 15;894' to 13;357'. Function test diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Displace choke line; kill line; and BOP to 14.1 ppg WBM. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Pressure test BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 14.1 ppg WBM to 250 psi low and 8;000 psi high. Pressure test Annular to 250 psi low and 4250 psi high. All tests utilized IPT software from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod.

05/01/2013: Continue test BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 14.1 ppg WBM to 250/8;000 psi. Displace 14.1 WBM from choke line; kill line and BOP with 14.1 SBM. TOH from 13;050' to 6;538'. Perform flow check below BOP and well was static. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. Slip and cut drill line and service MDDM. TIH from 6;538' to 22;443'.

05/02/2013: TIH with drilling assembly from 22;443' to 27;157'. Wash from 27;157' to bottom at 27;391'. Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 27;391' to 28;014'.

05/03/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 28;014' to 28;980'.

05/04/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 28;980' to 29;325'. Pump 14.1 ppg Hi-Vis sweep and circulate out. Flow check well and well was static. Conduct static influx test. Pump 100 bbls 16.0 ppg weighted Hi-Vis sweep and circulate out. Weight up to 14.2 ppg and circulate due to increase in gas from static influx test.

05/05/2013: Circulate and raise mud weight from 14.1 ppg to 14.2 ppg. Flow check well and well was static. TOH from 29;325' to 28;045' with wet pipe to confirm correct displacement. Pump slug and TOH to 12;423'. Flow check well and well was static. Function diverter from Driller's panel. Function BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. TOH from 12;423' to 1;618'.

05/06/2013: TOH with drilling assembly. Hand off BHA to AFT rotary. Function test BSRs and CSRs. Rig up Schlumberger wireline and pick up run #1; ZAIT/HLDS/QCNT/ECS/HNGS/CMR. RIH and log per program.

05/07/2013: POOH with wireline run #1. Change out wireline spool. RIH with wireline run #2; NGI/XPT. Troubleshoot communication issues with NGI/XPT tool. POOH with wireline run #2. Lay out NGI tool and RIH with reconfigured wireline run #2 XPT. Begin taking pressure readings with XPT.

05/08/2013: Complete 5 pressure collections with Schlumberger XPT wireline assembly. XPT tool failure. POOH with XPT assembly. Lay out same and RIH with re-run of HLDS/QCN (Neutron-Density) wireline assembly. Complete Neutron-Density wireline run. RIH with re-run XPT assembly.

05/09/2013: Perform start up diagnostics of Schlumberger XPT wireline assembly. Take pressure samples 6-73 of 125.

05/10/2013: Finish taking pressure samples 74-125 of 125. POOH with XPT on Schlumberger wireline. Lay out XPT and P/U MDT wireline assembly. RIH with MDT.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received written approval via email for a 72 hour extension on the BOP and Diverter function tests from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District).

05/11/2013: POOH with MDT due to failed communication. Troubleshoot assembly and RIH with same. Take samples 1; 2; and 3 of 6 totals. Begin pressure sample #4 of 6.

05/12/2013: Complete taking pressure samples; currently 4 of 6 and POOH with the MDT wireline assembly. Function test BSRs/CSRs from the Driller's Panel on the Blue Pod. Lay down MDT and pick up the MSCT rotary sidewall coring assembly and change out the wireline spool for the MSCT run. RIH with the wireline MSCT assembly to 12;000'.

05/13/2013: RIH with Schlumberger wireline coring assembly and complete the depth correlation logs. Complete collection of cores 1-35 of 50. 

NOTE: On 05/13/2013; Bobby Nelson (BSEE) granted Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) a 72 hour extension for the BOP pressure test.

05/14/2013: Finish taking core samples; 35 of 50; and POOH with coring assembly. Rig down the wireline equipment and slip and cut drill line. R/U casing handling equipment and begin to RIH with 9-7/8" liner to 2;055'.

05/15/2013: Continue running in the hole with 9-7/8" liner from 2;055' to 4;058'; pick up the liner hanger; and continue running in to 25;625'. Function BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's Panel Yellow pod before crossing the stack; and function BOPs from the Driller's Panel Yellow pod; and function Diverter from the Toolpusher's Panel after the liner hanger was below the stack. ROV function lower pipe ram with hot stab.

05/16/2013: Continue to TIH with 9-7/8" liner from 25;625' to 29;298'. Make up cement head and yield ball through Allamon diverter tools. Wash down with 9-7/8" liner from 29;298' to 29;325' and tag bottom with 30k. P/U to liner setting depth at 29;320' MD/ 28;363' TVD. Begin circulating and conditioning the wellbore in preparation for cementing operations and observe an 8 bbl gain at the pits and shut-in well. Monitor SICP/SIDPP. Attempt to bleed off pressure incrementally to determine if gain was formation ballooning (45 bbls injected @ higher pump rate). No success as pressure returned after each bleed. Attempted to circulate influx out of wellbore with annular shut-in unsuccessfully. Unable to maintain constant drill pipe pressure without losing returns. Decision was made to proceed with pumping cement with annular closed bull-heading cement slurry down the drill pipe. Pump 112 bbls of 15.4 ppg spacer followed by 175 bbls of 16.6 ppg tail cement slurry. Begin displacing cement with rig pumps with 14.2 ppg SBM; annular closed and monitoring pressure on choke line as static line.

05/17/2013: Finish displacement of cement slurry with rig pumps. Pumped max displacement of 1;013 bbls without bumping plug. Bleed back 6.75 bbls to cement unit and observe floats holding. Wait on cement for 24 hrs prior to setting Versa-flex liner.

05/18/2013: Set and expand the Versa-flex liner hanger and circulate surface to surface volume through power choke with Annular closed. Sweep BOP stack via base oil placement in Kill line and allow fluid to U-tube after opening Annular. Begin flushing down Choke line and up Kill line through power choke.

NOTE: On 05/18/2013; Bobby Nelson (BSDEE) granted Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) written approval via email for a 48 hour extension on the BOP pressure test and to forgo the cement evaluation log on the 9-7/8" liner until completions.

05/19/2013: Completed flushing the choke and kill lines. Took 100 kips overpull to ensure hanger was set. Released Versa-Flex liner hanger setting tool from 25;213' and pulled out of hole to surface. Laid out Versa-Flex liner hanger setting tool. Pressure tested 9-7/8" liner to 1700 psi for 30 minutes and pressure tested blind shear rams to 250 psi low/1;700 psi for 5 minutes each. 

05/20/2013: Slip and cut drill line. RIH with the EZSV packer from surface to 12;280'. Closed annular and displaced the BOP stack from 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud to 14.2 ppg water based mud. Pressure tested BOP rams and associated valves at 250 psi low and at 8;000 psi high on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel Blue pod. Pressure tested annular bag and associated valves at 250 psi low and at 4;250 psi high on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe. 

05/21/2013: Completed BOP testing on the rams; annular bag and associated valves on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel Blue pod. Tripped in hole with the EZSV packer from 12;102' to 29;109'. Set the EZSV packer with top located at 29;091'. Closed annular bag and pressured tested backside to 1;700 psi and held test for 15 minutes with no pressure observed in drill pipe. Stung out of EZSV packer and circulated bottoms up.
	
05/22/2013: Continued to circulate bottoms up. Performed a negative test on the 9-7/8" liner top with 6.6 ppg base oil to riser margin with differential of 2300 psi. Displaced drill pipe from base oil to 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud. Performed flow check on trip tanks and well remained static. Functioned the BOPs from the Driller's panel from the Blue pod. Pumped slug and tripped out of hole with the EZSV running tool.

05/23/2013: Continued to trip out of hole with the EZSV packer running tool from 12;229' to surface. Performed planned maintenance. Make up and tripped in hole with Dril-Quip multi-purpose tool to retrieve wear bushing assembly. Retrieved the wear bushing and tripped out of hole.

05/24/2013: Tripped out of hole with wear bushing on Dril-Quip multi-purpose tool. Slip and cut drill line on forward side of rig floor. Rigged up casing handling tools and equipment to run 10-3/4" tieback. Picked up seal stem assembly. Function tested blind shear rams and casing shear rams from Driller's panel Yellow pod. Ran tieback from surface to 9;650'.

05/25/2013: Continued to run 10-3/4" tieback from 9;650' to 18;114'. Rigged down casing handling equipment and rigged up drill pipe handling tools. Ran the 10-3/4" tieback on 6-5/8" 50# landing string from 18;244' to 25;195'. Rigged down the OES flow back tool and made up the GSI cement stand. Broke circulation and established returns. Slacked off and soft land hanger in wellhead; seal stem depth 25;242'. Tested seals in polished bore receptacle to 1300 psi for 5 min.

05/26/2013: Rigged GSI cement head and slacked off stem seals into the polished bore receptacle and the hanger in order to confirm space out. Pulled out of polished bore receptacle and pumped lead cement of 3;639 cu ft and tail cement of 831 cu ft. Displaced cement with 8;647 cu ft 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud. There was no indication of bumping the plug. Stung into the lower polished bore receptacle and landed the hanger in the wellhead. Bled off pressure on the drill pipe and confirmed that the floats were holding. Released the running tool as per Dril-Quip procedure. Attempted to set and test the seal assembly; no test. Rigged down the cement hose/lines and pulled the running tool above the blowout preventer. Broke down the cement head and transferred the cement head to the aft side of the rig floor. Rigged down Frank's casing handling equipment. Rigged up the drilling bails and the BX elevators. Tripped out of hole with the hanger running tool.

05/27/2013: Tripped out of hole with the hanger running tool and transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Picked up the diverter sub and tripped in hole to 7;891' (mill/flush tool depth of 7;056'). Milled and flushed the hanger profile as per Dril-Quip procedure to 7;120'. Pumped a slug and tripped out of hole with mill and flush tool to be transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Make up SART with secondary seal assembly and tripped in hole to 7;902' (seal assembly depth at 7;062'). Landed running tool and tested to 9;600 psi for 5 min; good test. Tripped out of hole with SART to 2;568'. Held after action review with drilling crew "F" on running/cementing 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. 

05/28/2013: Held after action review with crew "A" on running/cementing 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. Tripped out of hole with Dril-Quip SART and transferred to aft side of the rig floor. Cleaned the rig floor and serviced the rig. Tripped in hole with the Dril-Quip lead impression tool. Landed the lead impression tool in the wellhead and obtained a lead impression of high pressure wellhead housing lockdown profile. Tripped out of hole with Dril-Quip lead impression tool and transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Made up the Dril-Quip LDS tool and tripped in hole. Made up a side entry stand and rigged up a cement hose and chicksans. Landed Dril-Quip LDS on shoulder profile of 10-3/4" casing hanger. Closed annular and pressured up backside to 1;000 psi for 5 min to confirm land out.  
	
05/29/2013: Pressure tested lockdown sleeve to 9;600 psi for 5 min; good test. TOH with LDS running tool to 8;867'. Function tested BOP on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Function tested the diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Continued TOH with LDS running tool and transfer to aft side of the rig floor. Continued to trip out of hole with 5-7/8" drill pipe and diverter sub to surface. Conducted an after action review on LIT and LDS runs. Slip and cut of 149' of drill line. Pressure tested the 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" tieback casing to 7600 psi for 30 minutes; good test. Function tested the blind shear rams and the casing shear rams from the Driller's panel; Blue pod. Picked up the EZSV and tripped in hole on 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" drill pipe to 8;124'. Made up the side entry sub stand and lowered the EZSV to a setting depth of 8;134'. Washed down the setting area from 8;145' to 8;130'.

05/30/2013: Set and tested the EZSV at 8;134' as per the Halliburton procedure. Tested EZSV to 1;000 psi for 15 min; good test. Mixed and pumped 25 bbls of 16.6 ppg and balanced plug 300' above the EZSV. Pulled back to 7;332' (approximately 500' above top of cement plug) and pumped a 6" nerf ball through the drill pipe. Picked up a side entry stand; perform negative test pumping 6.6 ppg base oil down drill pipe to 100 ft in excess of riser margin (2;250 psi); good test. Reversed out base oil and pulled to 7;210' and displaced the BOP and riser to seawater and spotted 8.6 ppg suspension fluid from 100' below high pressure wellhead to 7;117'. Tripped out of hole with the EZSV running tool from 7;210' to 4;156'. 

05/31/2013: TOH with the EZSV running. Rigged down the drilling bails from the MDDM and RU the MDDM to pull the riser. RU the riser gimble; the spider and the torque wrenches. Pulled and laid out the diverter. Picked up the landing joint to land and lock the slip joint in place. Unlatched from the BOP at 16:41 hrs. Pulled and transferred the riser weight to the MDDM. Moved 50' northwest of PS001 location. Split the SDC ring in moon pool and pulled and laid out the landing joint and 16' of a heavy wall pup. Rigged down the storm loops in the moon pool and pulled to the termination joints and rigged down the drape hoses. Pulled and laid out the slip joint.

06/01/2013: Pulled the riser termination joint/pup joint and laid out. Pulled the riser/blowout preventer from 6;869' to 1;544'.

06/02/2013: Continue pull riser/BOP from 1;544' to surface. Land BOP on beams and skid to BOP set back. Rig down riser handling equipment. Splash SSPT and run to 6;700'. Move rig from 500' NNW safe zone to 100' N of PS001. ROV pull trash cap; inspect and clean gasket profile. 

06/03/2013: Run SSPT on drill pipe. Land on PS001 HPWH. Confirm orientation at 182.3 deg. Lock connector and test gasket seal to 13;264 psi; good test. Run tree debris cap on subsea winch and deploy with ROV. ROV perform end of well bottom survey. Recover COMPATTs.

11/13/2014: Moved rig over wellhead. Landed and latched BOP to SPPT at 05:40 hrs. ROV verified latch indicator. P/U above PBR and pumped 1;107 bbls of packer fluid. Displaced string volume. Slack off with landing string and set string in slips in preparation of P/U Compensated Coil Tubing Lift Frame (CCTLF).

01/27/2015: R/D handling equipment. Changed out nitrogen lines for CCTLF. R/U to pick up CCTLF. Waited on new elevators. Installed elevators and picked up CCTLF.

Note: On 01/27/2015 @ 8:01 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to extend the casing test by a further 24 hours.

01/28/2015: Rigged up the CCTLF and performed startup checks. Rigged up bails and elevators to the bottom of the CCTLF; and laid out handling assembly. Rigged up slings to transfer SFT (Surface Flow Tree) from center mousehole to CCTLF. Troubleshoot and flushed hydraulic system on CCTLF.

Note: On 01/28/2015 @ 14:21 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson that once tubing hanger was landed; as per APM; no additional casing tests would be needed.

01/29/2015: Rigged up auxiliary HPU for CCTLF. Transferred SFT from center mousehole to CCTLF. Made up SFT to landing string. Installed torpedo packers. Landed and locked tubing hanger. Rigged up lines to SFT and test production equipment. Begin testing tubing hanger.

Note: On 01/29/2015 @ 13:56 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson; stating "no issue regarding the delay of casing testing until the point of landing the tubing hanger."

01/30/2015: Finished testing the tubing hanger. Pressure tested the SFT; landing string; and tubing - good test. Performed negative test on the SCSSV with 5;000 psi differential pressure - all tests good. Rigged up slickline equipment.

Note: On 01/30/2015 at 09:10 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson to continue with well operations per APM to suspend the well with the control system for energizing the flowline seals in block position. The integrity of the diverter system and full functionality of the diverter is still operational.

01/31/2015: Tested lubricator to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. Retrieved Isolation Sleeve with slickline. Laid out Isolation Sleeve. Made up Lower Crown Plug. Displaced landing string/kill line with 6.6 ppg base oil. Tested lubricator. RIH and set Lower Crown Plug. Pressure tested Lower Crown Plug to 10;400 psi from above for 15 minutes - test good. Pressure tested below Lower Crown Plug to 8;300 psi/ 15 minutes - test good. Pumped 13 fluid loss valve opening pressure cycles.

02/01/2015: Finished cycling fluid loss valve open. Bullheaded 50 bbls of base oil down kill line across SSPT and down the tubing. Closed SCSSV and Production Master Valve (PMV). Pumped 10 gal methanol through XT. Rigged up Upper Crown Plug (UCP) on slickline. RIH and installed UCP in setting profile. POOH with slickline. Tested top of UCP to 10;400 psi/ 15 minutes - good test. Tested between UCP and Lower Crown Plug (LCP) to 13;000 psi with Installation/Work Over Control System (IWOCS) - good test. Rigged down slickline equipment. Put trip tank online and observed lower diverter seal not holding. Inserted packing material between diverter and housing to form a seal.

02/02/2015: Attempted to repair leaking flowline seals on the diverter with no success. Scoped in and locked Compensated Coil Tubing Lift Frame (CCTLF) and engaged active heave. Closed annular and unlatched Tubing Hanger Running Tool (THRT). Displaced 6.6 ppg base oil out of landing string with 14.1 ppg CaBr2 by pumping down choke line and up landing string. Opened annular and pulled THRT above BOP. Wait on weather.

Note: On 02/02/2015 @ 10:09 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that Chevron plans to pull the diverter; repair; test and continue with well suspension.
 
02/03/2015: Wait on weather. Removed torpedo packers. Picked up to clear land and lock tool from BOP. Rigged down surface lines and broke out SFT from landing string. Transferred SFT to center mousehole. Rig down dolly; nitrogen/hydraulic hoses and electric line from CCTLF. Lay out CCTLF as per Transocean procedure. Transfer SFT to AFT rotary; rig up landing string handling equipment. Lay out SFT.

02/04/2015: Rigged up landing string handling equipment. POOH with landing string; removing cross coupling clamps. Filled up down boost line every 5 stands; keeping fluid level in riser ~10' below flow line.

Note: On 02/04/2015 @ 15:29 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to forgo further BOP testing/functioning due to well barriers currently in place.

02/05/2015: Continued POOH to surface with landing string and land and lock tool. Transferred land and lock to Aft rotary. Rigged down landing string handling equipment. Note: Functioned Upper and Lower Blind Shear rams on Yellow pod from Toolpusher's panel - good test. P/U diverter running tool; latched onto diverter and pulled same. Landed diverter out on gimbal. Rigged down diverter and transferred to main deck. P/U and installed new diverter. Function tested diverter. Tested flowline seals to 400 psi - good test. Began displacing riser with seawater.

02/06/2015: Finish displacing riser to seawater. Bled tubing x casing annulus to SW hydrostatic. Performed negative test on SCSSV - good test. Displaced choke and kill lines to seawater. R/U riser handling equipment; laid down diverter; and P/U landing joint. Recovered IWOCS Umbilical Termination Assembly (UTA). 

02/07/2015: Scoped in slip joint and lock. Unlatched BOP. Moved rig to DOZ ~1;000' from well. Tested choke and kill lines to 15;000 psi - good test. Removed SDC ring and secured in moonpool. Laid down landing joint and slip joint. Removed drape hoses and laid down termination joint. Began pulling LMRP/BOP on marine riser.

10/28/18   Rigged up temporary filters and pump spread. Pressure tested temporary equipment to 11;300 PSI. Shut-in well. Opened downhole chemical injection valve. Pumped Xylene pre-soak. Pumped Methanol buffer. Pumped umbilical volume of organic acid.

10/29/18   Stopped pumping and secured well for xylene soak period. Pumped acid package into well.

10/30/18   Pumped remainder of acid package into well. While pumping; cycled well open and closed to lift acid up well-bore. Pumped umbilical volume of preservation fluid to displace acid. Stopped for acid soak period.

10/31/18   Stopped for acid soak period and performed offline pump maintenance. Cleaned-up well to production facility. Pumped preservation fluid over-flush at max rate to displace any remaining acid from umbilical. Final Report.

Note: On 12/13/2016 at 10:01 hrs; Mr. Shane Young (Chevron) provided Mr. Josh Ladner and Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email with a 72-hour notice to begin BOP stump testing. Testing is scheduled to begin on December 16; 2016; utilizing IPT testing.

Note: On 12/14/2016; a clear bottom survey was performed by the ROV from Juan-C. Also; conducted pre-spud with Drill Crew A.

Note: On 12/15/2016; conducted pre-spud with Drill Crew F.

M/U Cam Actuated Drill Ahead (CADA) tool to BHA and lowered into the low pressure wellhead housing (LPWH). RIH with 36" conductor casing with 26" jetting assembly and CADA tool from surface to 2;022' in 8.6 ppg seawater.

Note: On 12/16/2016 at 15:13 hrs; Mr. Ian Nott (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Justin Ledet (BSEE) to proceed with the procedure through step 8; BOP latch-up.

12/17/2016: Continue RIH with 36" conductor casing with 26" jetting assembly and CADA tool from 2;022' to 6;577'. Transit rig to well center and contine RIH from 6;577' to 7;140' in 8.6 ppg seawater. Begin jetting from 7;140' to 7;453'; placing shoe at 7;452' MD/TVD. Allow 36" conductor to soak for 3 hours and perform slump test with 215 klbs down; confirmed no movement. Release from CADA tool and begin drilling 26" hole section from 7;453' to 7;653'.

12/18/2016: Drill 26" hole section with jetting BHA from 7;643' MD to 8;313' MD. Displace well from 8.6 ppg seawater to 11.0 ppg pump and dump (PAD) mud. Trip out of hole (TOH) with 26" jetting BHA from 8;313' MD to 6;845' MD. Retrieve cam actuated drill ahead (CADA) tool and continue TOH from 6;842' MD to surface with 26" jetting BHA. Trip in hole (TIH) with 26" directional BHA from surface to 523' MD.

12/19/2016: TIH with 26" directional BHA from 523' MD to 6;770' MD. Stab 26" bit into low pressure wellhead (LPWH) at 7;130' MD and continue TIH to 7;452' MD. Displace drill string volume from 8.6 ppg seawater to 10.1 MD ppg PAD mud. TIH with 26" directional BHA from 7;452' MD to 8;313' MD. Encountered WB_Flt_5 at 7;987' MD/TVD (estimated). Drill 26" hole section from 8;313' MD to 9;200' MD. 
  
12/20/2016: Drill 26" hole section from 9;200' MD to 10;026' MD with 10.1 ppg PAD mud.  

12/21/2016: Drill 26" hole section from 10;026' MD to section total depth (TD) of 10;560' MD/TVD with 10.1 ppg PAD mud. TOH with 26" directional BHA from 10;560' MD to 10;518' MD. Displace wellbore from 10.1 ppg PAD mud to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continue TOH with 26" directional BHA from 10;500' MD to 6;904' MD on main rotary. Move vessel to dropped object zone (DOZ). Pick up (P/U) 22" casing on auxillary rotary and TIH from surface to 1;578' MD. 

12/22/2016: RIH with 22" x 23" casing from 1;578' MD to 3;314' MD. Make up (M/U) high pressure wellhead (HPWH) and TIH from 3;314' MD to 3;385' MD. Run 5-7/8" inner string from surface to 3;164' MD. M/U mechanical rigid lockdown (MRLD) tool and TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 3;314' MD to 5;914' MD. 

12/23/2016: TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string to 7;125' MD. Stab 22" casing shoe into LPWH and slack off to 7;155' MD. Displace landing string; inner string; and casing from 8.6 ppg seawater to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continue TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 7;155' MD to 10;491' MD/TVD . Land and lock HPWH. Circulate 1.5x landing string; inner string; and casing volume to condition mud prior to cement job. Pump 100 bbls of 13.2 ppg spacer; 1;948 bbls (10;936 cu ft) of 13.8 ppg; Class H lead cement slurry; and 276 bbls (1;550 cu ft) of 16.2 ppg; Class H tail cement slurry. Displace cement with 302 bbls of 8.6 ppg seawater. Cement in place at the mudline (22:30 hrs) confirmed with 1;000 psi lift pressure. Confirm float holding. Preload HPWH to 2 MM ft/lbs. 

12/24/2016: TOH with landing string; MRLD; and inner string from 10;233' MD to 9;979' MD. Circulate 1.5x landing string and inner string volume. Continue TOH from 9;979' MD to 6;927' MD (200 ft above HPWH) on auxillary rotary. Move rig to DOZ. Troubleshoot / maintenance BOP for network connection issues.

Note: Mr. Jim Newby (Chevron) provided Mr. Josh Ladner (BSEE) via email on 12/26/2016 at 10:38 hours an update predicting planned initial BOP latch-up and testing on St. Malo PS002 to be 12/28/2016 at 17:00 hours.
  
12/27/2016: Continue to RIH with BOP/Riser from 5;009' MD to 6;985' MD. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Pressure test boost and rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes each - good tests. All pressure tests conducted utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater. P/U termination and landing joint. Move from safe handling zone (SHZ) to PS002 well center and confirm space out. Move out to SHZ. Begin installing drape hoses.

Note: Mr. Jim Newby provided Mr. Josh Ladner via email on 12/27/2016 at 10:38 hours an update predicting planned initial BOP latch-up and testing on St. Malo PS002 to be 12/28/2016 at 09:00 hours.

12/28/2016: Continue installing drape hoses to termination joint. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good tests. Lock tensioner ring to termination joint and release tensioner ring from diverter housing. Move to SM PS002 well center; land and latch BOP WellHead Connector at 18:30 hrs and perform slump test - good test. Performed weight down non-shear EDS - good test. Transfer riser weight from block to riser tensioners and scope out termination joint. Pressure test Wellhead Connector to 2;000 psi - good test. Pressure test 22" casing to 2;700 psi for 30 minutes with 8.6 ppg seawater; utilizing IPT SureTec - good test.

12/29/2016: Installed diverter and energized seals. Installed packer housing.  Performed full lift off emergency disconnect system (EDS). Performed diverter function test from Driller's panel - good test.

12/30/2016: Continue TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 648' MD to 7;714' MD in 8.6 ppg seawater. Landed Dril-Quip test plug in HPWH profile at 7;126' MD. Released from Nu-Tec Blind Shear Ram (BSR) test tool. Pulled above BOP. Performed acoustic function of upper blind shear rams (UBSRs); and pressure tested UBSRs and Wellhead Connector against Dril-Quip test plug to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Opened USBRs from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod. Functioned UBSRs in 42.86 seconds with 50.66 gals using ROV intervention capabilities - good test. Pressure tested UBSR to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Performed Autoshear/Deadman system test- good test. Functioned USBRs closed from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; and pressure tested UBSRs to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Functioned LSBRs from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; and pressure tested LSBRs to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Function tested BSRs from Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod - good test. M/U Nu-tec tool and pressure tested variable bore rams (VBRs) and failsafe valves from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Pressure test annulars from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; to 300 psi/ 6;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Function tested BOP rams and annulars on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod. Tested surface equipment to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. All pressure tests were conducted on 6-5/8" drill pipe utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater.
