Tripped out of the hole. Changed top drive saver sub. Tripped in the hole with core assembly #6 to 2;346'. 																		
"},{"   ":44,"WELL_NAME":"  001aaa","API12":608124000402,"WAR_START_DT":"2004-06-06","TEXT_REMARK":"Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
6/6/04 - Tripped in the hole from 2;346' to 27;930' with core assembly #6.  Washed from 27;930' to 28;066'.  Dropped ball and continued to wash from 28;066' to 28;080'. Picked up and circulated until pressure increase was observed when ball landed in the seat of the core barrel. Cored from 28;083' to 28;176'. Pumped out of the hole from 28;176' to 27;364'. Tripped out of the hole from 27;364' to 19;600'.																		
6/7/04 - Continued to trip out of the hole from 19;600' to 12;484'. Dropped dart to activate PBL sub and let gravitate while tripping. Tripped out of the hole from 12;484' to 6;943'. Tripped out of the hole from 6;943' following the recommended core pulling schedule. Note: Closed upper shear rams and monitored well on the blow out preventer gauge. Filled riser with 66 barrels of SBM after pulling bottom hole assembly. Full core recovery: 2-5/8" x 90.9' of core in the barrel. Tripped in the hole with the blow out preventer test plug. Tested blow out preventer with 4" and 6-5/8" pipe. Tested annular to 250/3;500 psi for 5 minutes each. All rams; valves; top drive and choke manifold to 250/7;500. Tripped out of the hole with the blow out preventer test plug from 7;113' to 1;639'. 																		
6/8/04 - Finished tripping out of the hole with the blow out preventer test plug and Nutec tool. Tripped in the hole with 6-1/8" drilling assembly to 13;315'. Shallow tested MWD tools. Tripped in the hole from 13;315' to  27;923'. Logged while washing and reaming from 27;923' to 28;176' at 60 feet per hour with Sperry Sun. Drilled from 28;176' to 28;458'. 																		
6/9/04 - Drilled 6-1/8" hole from 28;458' to 28;905'. Circulated and conditioned mud at 28;905'. Performed swab test; pumped 80 bbl super sweep with 1/4 lb. per bbl. of baralift; and circulated and conditioned mud to trip out of the hole to log. No gas from swab test. Pumped 10 stands out of the hole from 28;905' to 27;508'. Checked flow. No indication of influx. Pulled out of the hole from 27;508' to 24;793'. 																		
6/10/04 - Tripped out of the hole from 24;739'. Rigged up Schlumberger wireline unit. Ran in the hole with wireline run #1; HPOBMI-HPDSI-HTGC. Logged cased hole from 19;000' to 25;300' for cement bond quality check and logged down to 28;885'. 																		
6/11/04 - RIH with wireline run #2 QAIT-HPCMR-HLDS-QCNT-HAPS-HPECS-HNGS-IS JARS-ECRD HT head. Began down logging from casing shoe at 25;300'; experienced tool telemetry losses while logging down; continued down to 28;870' for log up. Tool failed again. Changed telemetry mode to T5 (smaller band width). Resumed logging w/triple combo. Up logged from 28;850' to 24;750'. Dropped down to 28;830' to log with HPCMR-HPECS (triple combo tools disabled). Logged up to 27;082'. Dropped down & repeat - logged 27;750' to 27;113'. Dropped down again & repeat logged from 28;493' to 27;894'. Then dropped down to 28;850' & logged to 27;100'. POOH. 																		
6/12/04 - Laid out Mega Combo: HAIT-HPCMR-HLDS-QCNT-HAPS-HPECS-HNGS-IS Jars-ECRD HT Head. Picked up run #3: MDT Hyd Probe-Probe-Hyd/LFA/PO/CFA/MRSC/MRSC/MRMS/HTCG/Jars/ECRD HT Head. Attempted 40 pressures by midnight; 14 OK. 23 tight; 2 supercharged; 1 aborted. Tried pumpout to detect fluid type at 27;927' and had to abort due to excess draw down. 																		
"},{"   ":45,"WELL_NAME":"  001aaa","API12":608124000402,"WAR_START_DT":"2004-06-13","TEXT_REMARK":"Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
6-13-04 - Logged w/MDT: 66 attempts; 40 tight; 25 pressures; 1 aborted. Continued acquiring formation pressure measurements w/wireline run #3 HPMDT/LA/MS/HTGC/ISJars/ECRD HT head. There were 18 successful Claiborne pressure measurement that fit the previously established Claiborne oil gradient line of the St. Malo Well. There were 22 successful Wilcox pressure measurements; however; they did  not fit the previously established St. Malo well oil gradient line. Dana Point Deep appears to have a similar Wilcox gradient; but is shifted by about 20 psi. At 14:45 hrs. Schlumberger's computer locked up & started experiencing low voltage problems. POOH w/wireline to 20;745'. The computer was re-booted & the tool started working. Decision was made to run back in the hole & continue the MDT log. 																		
6-14-04 - Pumped out & took sample at 28;321'. MDT stuck; worked wireline from 6;600 # to 18;000 # pull on line tension. Head tension at 4;400 # w/no change. MDT still stuck at 28;321' w/no movement. Decision was made to pump out & take sample. Took sample at 28;321'.																		
6-15-04 - MDT tool stuck at 28;321' WLM; slacked off to neutral tool weight of 13;500 # line pull; burned off ECRD w/Schlumberger & overpull wire to 18;400 #. Wire came free from MDT tool & started moving up the hole at 13;500 # of normal line tension. Continued to POOH. Cut 200' of .48 wireline & re-terminated rope socket on a new Schlumberger wireline head. Picked up VSI shuttles. Function tested upper & lower shear rams as well as casing shear while out of the hole. RIH w/Schlumberger VSI logging tools to 21;570'; performed tie in & calibrated the tools. Performed shaker test; test fired & turned the guns. At 10:00 hrs. Schlumberger lost signal to VSI; made several attempt to reboot & power up electronic cartridge w/no success. At 11:30 hrs performed emergency closure of the tool & started POOH with the VSI logging tool. POOH w/VSI logging tools. RIH w/VSI logging tools. Anchored guns at 20;773' (top of tool). Tested guns & started shooting. Completed final shot at 22:00 hrs. Unanchored shuttles & POOH. 																		
6-16-04 - Finished POOH w/VSI shuttles. RIH with 5-3/4" x 3-3/4" guide shoe & Bowen overshot dressed with 3-3/8" grapple to 14;971'. Function tested BOP's on blue pod from the rig floor and yellow pod from toolpusher's office. TIH from 14;971' to 28;100'. Began CBU at 28;100'. 																		
6-17-04 - POOH from 28;100' to casing shoe at 25;300'. TIH from casing shoe to 28;100'. Washed from 28;100' to 28;783'. Tagged top of fish at 28;783' swallowed same. POOH 10' w/70K lb drag over pick up weight before fish came free. POOH wet w/fish assembly from 28;789' to 21;002'. Flow checked  well at 7" liner shoe; well static. Continued POOH from 21;002' to 7;136'. POOH from 7;136' w/fish to surface; (full recovery of fish). Tested Schlumberger tools. Recovered fish from hole. Held pre-job safety meeting. Picked up & tested Schlumberger Mini-MDT tools. RIH with same.																		
6-18-04 - Schlumberger RIH w/Mini DST & set dual packers at 4 intervals & performed a pull down test between the packers at the following depths: 1st test - 27;367' - 27;370'. 2nd test - 27;392.5' - 27;395.5'. 3rd test - 28;136' - 28;139'. 4th test - 28;234' - 28;237'.																		
6-19-04 - Continued logging w/Schlumberger's Mini-DST tool attempted to set packers at 5th location. Top of packer at 27;534' & bottom at 27;537'; packer failed to pressure up. POOH w/Mini-DST tool to above 7" liner top to avoid swabbing; continued to POOH to surface. RIH w/Schlumberger Mini-DST #2 to 5;500'; pump module failed. POOH w/Mini-DST #2. RIH w/Schlumberger Mini-DST & logged same. Schlumberger attempted to set packers at 28;254' - 28;257'; packer failed to pressure up. Schlumberger pulled 17;500 line pull (5;000 lbs over normal) w/6;000 lbs head tension in an attempt to free tool. Schlumberger pulled out of open hole w/2;000 lbs extra drag. 																		
																		
At 14:30 hours; on Saturday June 12th; Samir Modi (Unocal Engineer) received verbal approval from Lesley Peterson (MMS Houma District Office) to delay function testing of pipe rams and annular until Tuesday June 15th. This allows time to discuss the matter further with John McCarroll (MMS Houma District Office) on his return to the office. Blind Shear rams and failsafes can be tested after completion of this MDT run.																		
Received written approval from Brad Hunter (MMS Houma District Office) for a waiver to delay BOP function test (due 6/14/04) until Saturday June 19th when logging operations are complete and PRS systems are repaired. 																		
At 13:15 hours; on 6/15/04; received a verbal approval from Brad Hunter (MMS Houma District Office) for a waiver of the shear ram/casing pressure  test due to the well being plugged and abandoned w/no further drilling required. 																		
"},{"   ":46,"WELL_NAME":"  001aaa","API12":608124000402,"WAR_START_DT":"2004-06-20","TEXT_REMARK":"Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
6-20-04 - Finished POOH w/Mini-DST run #2. Schlumberger went in the hole w/OBMI. TIH to 28;850' & logged up to 27;000'. Ran repeat log from 28;200' to 27;000'. POOH w/OBMI. Tested Mini-DST #3; Schlumberger went in the hole & performed Mini-DST from 27;322' to 27;325' w/set #1 & 28;526' to 28;529' w/set #2.																		
6-21-04 - Schlumberger attempted to work Mini-DST tool free. About an hour later tool freed up at 28;400'. Performed tie in log & set tool across 28;321' - 28;324'. Packer failed to pressure up. POOH w/Mini-DST from 28;324' to 28;120'. Continued to POOH from 28;120'. Rigged up pipe handling equipment. TIH w/test plug BHA to 886'; installed PS-30; and continued to TIH to 7;113'. Tested BOPs on yellow pod from rig floor. Tested annular to 250/3;500 psi; rams; safety valves; and choke manifold to 250/7;500 psi on 6-5/8" & 4" drill pipe. Functioned BOPs on blue pod from the toolpusher's office. POOH to 886'.																		
6-22-04 - POOH w/BOP test assembly. Racked back top drive. Rig on downtime. Rigged up wire line operations. Schlumberger RIH w/MDT to 28;500'. Schlumberger set probes 22 time from 28;590' to 27;353'. Retrieved 2 samples: 1st at 28;578' (1.4 mobility); 2 oil/filtrate samples 450 cc each. 2nd at 28;638' (2.4 mobility) 2 water samples 450 cc each. 																		
6-23-04 - Schlumberger retrieving samples at 28;638' w/MDT. POOH w/MDT from 28;638' to surface. Schlumberger RIH with MDT/Packers to 300'. Electronics failed; POOH w/tool. Changed out probe & RIH with MDT/Packers to 7" casing shoe at 25;300'; waited for 30 mins for tool to stabilize. Continued in the hole to 27;450'; tie-in & tested permeability at 6 depths from: 27;335' to 27;328' using MDT tool probe. Set packers in 1st Claiborne sample point of 27;370' (bottom packer depth) w/top packer at 27;367'. Collected 1 MPSR & 1 SPMC oil sample. Pumped additional 40 mins & took last 2 MPSR & last 2 SPMC samples. Pumped additional 15 mins; performed 30 min build-up. Deflated packers & waited 15 mins to allow packers to retract. Attempted to make tie in at 27;650'. Tied-in & set upper packer at 27;533' & lower packer at 27;536'. Inflated & started 1 hr pump out at 23:17 hrs.																		
6-24-04 - Started build-up test & packers failed. Made several attempts to inflate packers w/o success. POOH from 27;535'. Found both top & bottom packers on Mini-DST ruptured. Removed MPRS module; changed pump-out module; & replaced packers. RIH w/Schlumberger Mini-DST to 7" casing shoe at 25;300'; waited 30 mins for tool to stabilize. Continued in the hole to 27;700' & ran tie-in log. Set top packer at 27;533' & bottom packer at 27;536'. Started pump-out; after 45 mins had power failure on 50 volt power supply & lost telemetry tool. Packers deflated due to power loss problem.  POOH w/Mini-DST to surface. Laid out tool string. Schlumberger changed out wire line drum; re-terminated head; changed out sheaves & picked up MSCT. 																		
6-25-04 - RIH w/Schlumberger MSCT to 28;640'. Performed tie-in log & took 25 cores from 28;640' up to 28;129'. Pulled up to 28;100'. Worked MSCT from 28;100' up to 28;050'. Continued taking 25 cores from 27;932' to 27;342'. A total of 50 core samples taken. Boosted riser while RIH w/MSCT. POOH w/MSCT from 27;342' to surface. Removed inner barrel from MSCT. Recovered 50 cores; 45 full & 5 broken.																		
6-26-04 - Held think drill safety meeting. Rigged up OES 4-1/2" casing running equipment. TIH w/31 stands of 4-1/2"; 11.6 ppf; P-110 New Vam liner. Installed centralizers per program. Picked up Baker liner hanger. Ran 4-1/2" liner as follows: Weatherford Auto-Fill float shoe; Auto-Fill float collar; 93 joints of 4-1/2" casing; Cross over; Landing collar; Cross over; & Baker liner hanger w/ZXP packer. TIH w/liner on 4" drill pipe to 6;285'. Changed out bails to 750 ton; installed PS-30s; & 500 ton 5" drill pipe elevators. TIH from 6;285' to 12;243'. Changed PS 30s; elevators; & AR-3500 dies for 6-5/8" drill pipe. TIH w/liner from 12;243' to 28;726'. Broke circulation & activated floats to function conventionally. Washed from 28;726' to 28;891'. Established circulation rates & circulated bottom up while reciprocating pipe.																		
																		
Mr. J. Freeman; J. Cheramie; and K. Bouzigare from the MMS Houms District Office visited the rig. No incidents noted.																		
"},{"   ":47,"WELL_NAME":"  001aaa","API12":608124000402,"WAR_START_DT":"2004-06-27","TEXT_REMARK":"Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
6/27/04 - CBU. Reciprocated liner while circulating. Held pre-job safety meeting w/crew. Tested Halliburton lines to 5;000 psi. Rig pumped 100 bbls of 13.8 ppg tuned spacer. Halliburton mixed & pumped 235 bbls of "Premium" Joppa cement; 1;210 sxs; (1;319 cu. ft.) w/12 gphs Halad 344 + 20 gphs of SCR-100 + .07% EZ-Flo at 16.2 ppg; yield 1.09 cu. ft/sx; 4.53 gps mix water. Dropped dart & displaced cement w/511 bbls of mud. Closed annular preventer while pumping & bull headed an additional 121 bbls. Max casing pressure 1;065 psi while displacing cement. Bumped plug w/3;600 psi to set Baker liner hanger. Bled pressure off drill pipe to check floats - holding. Reciprocated liner while cementing. Bled casing pressure from 750 psi to zero & opened annular preventer. Well flowed back fluid. Released running tool from hanger. Picked up 9' & slacked off & tagged up 6' higher. Set down 60k to set ZXP packer. Well stopped flowing. Closed Hydril & Halliburton; tested 13-5/8"; 13-3/8"; 9-5/8";  7" casing; & ZXP packer to 1;500 psi for 15 mins. Pulled stinger & removed cement head stand. Top of 4-1/2" liner set at 24;844' & shoe at 28;891'. CBU at 24;834'. Flow checked well; static. Held pre-job safety meeting.																		
Tested lines to 3;000 psi. Pumped 25 bbls of 13.8 ppg tuned spacer. Mixed & pumped 26 bbls of "Premium" Joppa cement; 133 sxs (145 cu. ft.) + 12 gphs Halad 344 EXP + 20 gphs of SCR-100L + .07% EX-Flo at 16.2 ppg; yield 1.09 cu. ft/sx & 4.53 gps mix water. Displaced w/12 bbls of 13.8 tuned spacer behind & 612 bbls of 13.8 ppg SBM. Cement plug #1 inside 7" liner from 24;134' ti 24;834'. TOH from 24;830' to 23;026'. Held pre-job safety meeting. Tested lines to 3;000 psi. Pumped 40 bbls of 13.8 ppg tuned spacer. Halliburton mixed & pumped 22 bbls of "Premium" Joppa cement; 114 sxs (121 cu. ft.) + 8 gphs Halad 344 EXP + 6 gphs of SCR-100L + .07% EZ-Flo at 16.4 ppg; yield 1.06 cu. ft/sx & 4.33 gps mix water. Displaced w/8 bbls of 13.8 ppg tuned spacer behind & 569 bbls of 13.8 ppg SBM. Cement plug #2 across 7" liner top from 22;626' to 23;026'. POOH from 23;026' to 21;570'. Circulated 1-1/2 drill pipe; boosted riser. TOH from 21;570' to 17;707'. Held pre-job safety meeting. Tested lines to 3;000 psi. Pumped 30 bbls of 13.8 tuned spacer. Halliburton mixed & pumped 44 bbls of "Premium" Joppa cement; 228 sxs (249 cu. ft.) + 8 gphs Halad 344 EXP + 6 gphs SCR-100L + .07% EX-Flo at 16.4 ppg; yield 1.09  																		
cu. ft/sx & 4.33 gps mix water. Displaced w/10 bbls of 13.8 ppg tined spacer behind & 417 bbls of 13.8 ppg SBM. Cement plug #3 across 9-5/8" liner top from 17;307' to 17;707'. POOH from 17;707' to 17;000'. Circulated 1-1/2 tubing voulems. Flow checked & pumped slug. POOH from 17;000' to 15;334'.																		
6/28/04 - Functioned tested BOPE on blue pod from the rig floor & yellow pod from the tool pusher's panel. Functioned middle pipe rams; upper pipe rams; & annular on 6-5/8" drill pipe. All fail safe valves. TOH from 15;334' to 2;264'. Functioned upper shear rams; casing shear rams; & lower shear rams on yellow pod from the tool pusher's panel; & the blue pod from the driller's panel. Continued to TOH from 2;264' w/Baker liner running tool. POOH. TIH with 13-5/8" EZSV to 2;251'. Air transducer failed on fwd rotary. Changed out transducerto repair same. TIH from 2;251' to 8;100'. Rotated pipe 30 & set EZSV; sheared from tool. Picked up 10' above packer to extend stinger. Stung into EZSV; set down & tested same. Stung out of EZSV & picked up 10' to 8;090'. Halliburton broke circulation & tested EZSV against annular to 1;500 psi with 13.8 ppg mud. Opened annular & TOH from 8;100' to 6;720' while displacing kill line w/8.6 ppg seawater. Closed blind shear rams; performed negative pressure test; opened kill line filled w/seawater; well static. TIH from 6;720' to 8;100'. Pumped 100 bbls of brine spacer; displaced drill pipe; annulus; & riser w/seawater. Held pre-job safety meeting. Tested lined to 3;000 psi.																		
Halliburton mixed & pumped 74 bbls of "Premium" Jopps cement; 381 sxs (418 cu. ft.) + 53 gphs CaCl2 + .07% EZ-Flo at 16.4 ppg; yield 1.08 cu. ft/sx & 4.45 gps mix water. Displaced w/248 bbls of seawater. Cement plug #4 in 13-5/8' casing from 7;600' to 8;100'. TOH from 8;100' to 7;390'. TOH w/EZSV stinger from 7;390'. Boosted riser while POOH. 																		
6/29/04 - Pulled & laid down diverter. Unlatched BOPE with blue pod. Unlatched & removed SDC ring; rigged down mux cable sheaves; & laid down landing joint. Laid down heavy wall pup joint; slip joint; intermediate flex joint; termination joint & 5' pup joint. Pulled & laid down flotation riser from 91 to 73.																		
6/30/04 - Continued pulling riser joint 72 to 2. Rigged up & pulled BOPs into moonpool & landed BOPs on hang off beams. Pulled BOPs & landed out same on cart. Skidded BOPs to stowed position. Pulled hoses from moonpool & set sail at 24:00 hrs to Keathley Canyon 631 (Sardinia #1). Final Report.																		
"},{"   ":48,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-07-03","TEXT_REMARK":"ON LOCATION. ROV PERFORMED MMS SITE SURVEY. JETTED CASING. DRILL TO 9283'. PUMPED OUT OF HOLE. RUN 22" CASING. BEGAN TRIPPING OUT OF THE HOLE. WASHED AND REAMED. SPUDDED WELL 7-6-03."},{"   ":49,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-07-10","TEXT_REMARK":"Finished TIH with 22" casing to 9;242'. Landed & latched High Pressure Housing into Low Pressure Housing. Held pre-job safety meeting & rigged up to cement 22" casing. Pumped 80 bbls of 13.1 ppg dual spacer with rig pumps. Cemented 22" casing with lead cement ; 7;200 sxs premium + .07% EZ-FLO + 7 gphs ZoneSeal 2000 weighted to 16.4 ppg; yield 1.08 cu ft/sx; foamed weight 13.4 ppg; yield 1.37 cu ft/sx. Total of 1;385 bbls of slurry; foamed slurry total 1;757 bbls mixed with seawater. Nitrogen volume; 490;257 scf. Tail cement; 967 sxs premium + .07% EZ-FLO + 26 gphs CaCl2 + 12 gphs Halad 344 + 2 gphs D-Air; weighted to 16.2 ppg; yield 1.10 cu ft/sx. Total of 190 bbls of slurry mixed with seawater. Shoe cement; 149 sxs premium + .07% EZ-FLO + 26 gphs CaCl2 + 12 gphs Halad 344 + 2 gphs D-Air; weighted to 16.2 ppg; yield 1.10 cu ft/sx. Total of 29 bbls of slurry mixed with seawater. Displaced cement with 240 bbls of seawater. Tripped out of the hole.
Tested lines to 2;300 psi & tested 22" casing with cement unit to 1;000 psi for 30 min. Tripped out of the hole & started to secure rig due to Tropical Storm "Claudette". Waited on weather until 14:30 hrs. on 7/14/03. Rigged up to run BOP & riser. Tested BOP choke & kill lines to 250/10;000 psi. Tested boost line & rigid conduit to 250/5;000 psi with rig pump simultaneously. Each test held 5 min. on both high & low pressure. Ran riser joints 3 - 88. Picked up 40' & 10' pup joints. 
Tested choke & kill lines to 250/10;000 psi; tested rigid conduit & booster line to 5;000 psi. Landed BOP at 13:15 hrs. on yellow pod. Tested diverter with 50;000 lb overpull. Tested casing & upper blind shear rams to 250 psi low for 5 min. & 4;500 psi high for  30 min. (MMS test). Tested lower blind shear rams to 250 psi low for 5 min. and 4;500 psi high for 5 min. using the yellow pod. Function tested blind shear rams. RIH with 18-1/4" flat bottom mill & boot basket to 7;910'. Performed turn test while TIH. Tested choke manifold to 250 psi low & 4;500 psi high while TIH.
Note: At 17:45 hrs. on July 10; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. John McCarroll; Houma MMS; to test casing to 1;000 psi and abandon location without running BOPE or running in with a packer."},{"   ":50,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-07-17","TEXT_REMARK":"Continued running 18-1/4" milling assembly to 8;874'. Tested choke manifold valves and lines to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each test. Tested 2 spare TIW valves to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each. Tested annular on yellow pod from driller's panel to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each on 6-5/8" drillpipe. Tested upper & middle pipe rams to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each on 6-5/8" drillpipe. Tested all fail safe valves & lines to 250/4;500 psi. Function tested BOPs on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. All testes were done against 22" casing. Tested auto & manual IBOP valves to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min each. Tagged top of cement at 9;170' with mill assembly and pumped 75 bbls of seawater with red dye; followed by 75 bbls of 11.6 ppg CaCl2. Started displacing hole with 10.5 ppg SBM. Drilled cement from 9;170' to 9;178'. Pumped slug & POOH from 9;179' to 934'. Re-tested upper & lower inner kill valves and lines to 250/3;500 psi for 5 min each with 10.5 ppg SBM. TIH to 9;179' & set wear bushing.
TIH & drilled cement & float equipment from 9;179' to 9;242'. Washed & reamed to 9;290' & drilled 10' of new formation to 9;300'. Performed FIT; 982 psi = 12.46 ppg EMW. Continued drilling to 10;558'. Drilled from 10;558' to 11;735' with Geo-pilot. Drilled from 11;735' to 12;063'. Flow checked well & pumped slug. POOH with Geo-pilot assembly due to problems steering Geo-pilot. RIH with BHA #5 to 11;980' and washed to bottom at 12;063'. Drilled from 12;063' to 15;274'. Increased mud weight to 10.8 ppg at 16;300' and continued drilling to 16;588'.
Note: At 16:05 hrs on July 17; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. John McCarroll with the Houma MMS to test the upper and lower inner kill valves and lines to 3;500 psi with 10.5 ppg mud."},{"   ":51,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-07-24","TEXT_REMARK":"Drilled from 16;588' to  17;582'. Circulated bottoms up to 22" casing shoe. Function tested BOPs on blue pod from the rig floor and the yellow pod from the toolpusher's panel. Short tripped to 16;630'. TIH and drilled ahead to 17;718'. Began backreaming; string torqued up and could not work pipe.  Pumped 75 bbls fresh water and spotted at bit.  TIH to 17;582' and drilled to 17;718'. Pipe became stuck 2' off bottom. Spotted 75 bbls of fresh water at BHA. Still not able to work pipe. Found problems with top drive and repaired same. Worked pipe free and circulated water out of hole. Caught and separated water from system. Backreamed from 17;718' to 17;492'. Drilled new hole from 17;718 to 18;155'.  Continued to drill from 18;155' to 18;293'.  While drilling to 18;295' pipe stalled due to torque and pipe became stuck. Pumped 10 bbls pre-mix; 500 bbls fresh water; and 10 bbls pre-mix. Spotted same with 50 bbls of water around BHA.  After total of 189 bbls of water; pipe became free. 
Circulated 500 bbls of water out. Reamed from 18;265' to 18;295'. Flow checked well and POOH to 17;585'. Flow checked again; pumped slug and POOH.  RIH with 18 x 22" bit stand. RIH with 9-1/2" drill collars. Made up test plug stand and RIH on 27 lb/ft drillpipe to 6;443'. Troubleshot communication problems with BOP control system.  Slipped and cut 119' of 2" drillpipe. Closed upper shear rams. Locked out connector. Re-booted BOP MUX control system. Program came back up and operating normal. RIH with test plug; landed in wellhead at 6;693'. Tested all BOP components on 6-5/8" drillpipe to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min each. Function tested on yellow pod from rig floor and on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. All tests good and BOP components functioning at 100%.  Unseated plug; pumped slug and POOH.  RIH with 18" x 22" drilling assembly to 18;260'.  Washed to bottom and started drilling 18" x 22" hole. Drilled from 18;295' to 18;486'.
At 18;486'; the BHA twisted off; lost 30;000 lbs weight and 3;000 psi pump pressure.  Circulated bottoms up and flow checked well. Pumped slug and POOH to wellhead at 6;944'.  Top of fish depth: 18;169'.  RIH with wear sleeve adaptor on MPT tool.  Latched into wear sleeve at 6;930'.  Sheared out wear sleeve and pulled up past choke line.  Pumped slug and started POOH. Made up fishing assembly and ran in the hole.
Latched and pulled fish off bottom with no overpull.  Pulled fish out of the hole wet.  Racked back BHA and top drive system.  Made up new 18" x 22" drilling assembly and tripped back into the hole."},{"   ":52,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-07-31","TEXT_REMARK":"Made up drilling assembly and tripped in the hole to 18;365'. Washed and reamed from 18;365' to 18;486'.  Drilled from 18;486' to 18;693'. MWD quit working; troubleshot tools. At 20:20 hrs on July 31; 2003 Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. Brad Hunter with Houma MMS to drill to 23;000' without taking directional surveys; provided that we survey any missing portions on the next trip in the hole. Drilled from 18;693' to 18;804'. Drilled out of the salt formation at 18;794' MD; (18;754' TVD).  Drilled from 18;804' to 19;175'. Decision was made to pull out of hole and pick up new LWD (for real-time data acquisition for pore pressure prediction and geological correlation). Tripped out of the hole with drilling assembly.
Tripped in the hole with new bottom hole assembly to 18;912'. Reamed and washed from 18;912'.  Re-logged hole section from 18;970' to 19;030'.  Continued washing and reaming to 19;175'. Drilled from 19;175' to 19;375'. Drilled from 19;375' to 20;371' with 85-120 RPM and 10-20;000 lbs weight on bit. Drilled from 20;371' to 20;542'.  While drilling at 20;542' the MWD/LWD tool failed. Decision was made to continue drilling without real-time logging data.  Drilled from 20;542' to 20;680'.  While drilling at 20;680'; lost 50;000 lbs of hookload weight and pump pressure went from 5000 psi to 3150 psi.  Drilling assembly twisted off in the bottom hole assembly.  Pumped 80 bbl super sweep and circulated bottoms up. Flow checked the well and tripped out of the hole to 8;319'. Function tested BOPE with blue pod from Toolpusher's panel; then from the rig floor with the yellow pod. 
 Continued to trip out of the hole.  Found that the bottom hole assembly twisted off in the box of the 7th joint of 6-5/8" HWDP on top of the 8-1/4" drill collars.  The top of the fish is at 20;133.40'.  The length of fish that was left in the hole is 546.60'. Slipped and cut drill line.  Serviced rig. Made up Dril-Quip Multi-purpose tool with emergency wear sleeve retrieval tool. Tripped in the hole with Dril-Quip wear sleeve retrieving tool and engaged wear sleeve at 6;930'. Overpulled 80;000 lbs and retrieved sleeve. Slugged drill pipe and tripped out of the hole with the wear sleeve. Picked up fishing bottom hole assembly with 17-1/2" cut lip guide and overshot dressed with an 8-1/4" grapple and pack-off.  Tripped in the hole to the top of the fish at 20;133'. Broke circulation to clear overshot of cuttings at 60 spm (1;300 psi initial pressure); then pressure dropped to 560 psi. Picked up and increased the pump strokes to 200 spm (2;200 psi) and worked overshot over fish and engaged grapple.  Worked pipe until fish was off bottom with no drag. Checked flow and slugged pipe. Tripped out of the hole with the fish.
Tripped in the hole with 17.5" bit and 21-3/4" Enlarge While Drilling (EWD) bottom hole assembly to 7;015'. Attempted to test MWD and did not get detection.  Changed modes and varied pump rates and still did not get detection. Tripped out of the hole from 7;015' to 5;768'.  Pumped 25 bbl sweep and flushed MWD tools.  Circulated at 900 gpm with signal detected.  Tripped in the hole to 9;242' and tested MWD at 900 gpm. Tripped in the hole to 20;500'. Brought mud pumps up to 900 gpm; MWD tools pulsed at 900 gpm with 85% signal strength.  Signal strength weakened as pump speed increased to 1;250 gpm.  Slowed pumps down to 900 gpm and signal strength was regained. Logged with MWD/LWD from 20;500' to 20;680' at 160 feet per hour and circulated at 900 gpm while Sperry troubleshot logging tools.
Continued to trouble shoot MWD/LWD after logging hole section and changed mud pump configuration to check for interference.  Signal strength weakened when increasing mud pumps from 900 gpm to 1;250 gpm (drilling rate).  Decision was made to drill at 1;250 gpm without real-time logging data and to slow pump rate to 900 gpm for suvey data when required.  Drilled from 20;680' to 20;707' with 15-25;000 lbs bit weight; 95 RPM; and 26-35;000 ft-lbs of torque using a 21-3/4" Tri-Max EWD reamer and 17-1/2" PDC bit."},{"   ":53,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-08-07","TEXT_REMARK":"8-5-03 - Finish P/U 9 5/8" liner; Baker liner hanger & ZXP liner top packer; R/D Casing tools; TIH slowly to 10445' w/full returns; C & C mud; Drop setting ball; & set hanger @ 6578'; Release from same; Set down w/50K; R/U Howco lines; Pump 40 bbl spacer; Mix & pump 1264 sks (294 bbls) of 17.0 ppg Premium cmt; Displace w/112 bbls of mud; Latch dart; Displace w/266 bbls of mud; Did not bump plug; Floats holding; P/U & set Baker liner top packer w/100k; Test TOL to 1500 psi; OK; P/U & circulate out Cement; Dumped cement & contaminated mud returns; Pump slug; POOH to L/D setting tool.  8-6-03 - POOH; L/D liner running tool; Test BOP stack to 250 psi & 6000 psi; All test OK; Repair top drive compensator; P/U 8 1/2" bit; MWD & directional BHA; TIH to TOL; C & C mud; Drill packoff bushing; TIH; Tag cmt stringer @ 10240'; C & C mud; R/U & test csg to 2000 psi for 30 minutes; OK; W & R to 10305'; Tag wiper plug; Drill plug; & firm cmt to LC @ 10350'.  8-7-03 - Drill float equipment; firm cmt & 10' of new hole to 10460'; C & C mud; FIT csg shoe @ 10445' to 1250 psi (18.5 ppg EMW); Drill & survey w/mud motor & MWD f/10460' to 11255'; Raise MW to 16.4 ppg.  8-8-03 - Drill f/11255' to 11430'; Circulate bottoms up; POOH to 10440' for wiper trip; Numerous tight spots; Worked through same; OK; Service top drive; TIH to 11430' w/no problems; Drill; slide & survey w/mud motor & MWD to 11870'. ART: drilling @ 11;996'.  8-09-03 Drill; slide & survey w/MWD f/11870' to 11996'; Circulate bottoms up; POOH for NB; Change out mud motor & MWD; TIH to 10;445'; Service top drive; TIH to 11996'; No problems; Drill; slide & survey to 12150'. ART: Drilling @ 12;372'.  8-10-03 - Drill; slide & survey w/mud motor & MWD f/12150' to 13121'; Circulate out; Max gas - 566 units w/mud cut to 15.8 ppg; Drill f/13121' to 13153'.  8-11-03 - Drill f/13153' to 13215'; hole packing off; raise MW; pump out of hole to shoe; TIH & ream 13105'-13215'. Raise MW to 17.2; made 5 stand short trip; ream to btm; CBU; POOH to log."},{"   ":54,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-08-14","TEXT_REMARK":"Reamed with 20" Rhino Reamer from 21;140' to 21;539'. Swivel packing started leaking; changed out same and tested to 5;000 psi with rig pump. Continued to ream from 21;539' to 21;656'. Had pressure loss while pumping; pressure dropped to 4;400 psi. Checked surface equipment. Pumped 80 bbls of 13.0 ppg super sweep and circulated bottoms up. Checked flow; pumped slug and POOH. Found box on 10' pony drill collar failed. Left bit; float sub; and pony collar in the hole. Made up fishing assembly and began TIH. TIH with 16" cut lip guide; spiral grapple; and mill control to 6;971'. Slipped and cut drill line. Continued TIH to 16;950'. Changed out pressure transducer on drawworks motor. TIH to 21;730' and broke circulation. Continued TIH to 22;770'. Attempted to work over fish. Worked down to 22;786'. Swivel packing went out when we started circulating. Flow checked; pumped slug and POOH from 22;786' to 2;364'. Retrieved 100% of fish. POOH with fish from 2;364'.
Made up BHA assembly. Latched bit; bit sub; and Smith 20" Rhino Reamer and RIH. TIH with Rhino Reamer to 21;350'. Opened Rhino Reamer at 21;350' and re-reamed hole from 21;350' to 21;620'. Only underguage section was from 21;535' to 21;550'; saw increased torque through this interval. Continued re-reaming from 21;620' to 21;656'. Reamed 17-1/2" hole from 21;656' to 22;064'. Lost torque; gradually lost 300 psi from 08:30 hrs. to 12:30 hrs. Checked surface equipment and slacked off without rotating; no resistance indicated that Rhino Reamer was not opening. Pumped slug and POOH to 275'.  TIH with Rhino Reamer to 21;750' and reamed a 17-1/2" hole to 20" from 21;750' to 22;495'. Currently underreaming at 22;606'."},{"   ":55,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-08-21","TEXT_REMARK":"Provide a daily summary of well activities.																		
Continued underreaming 17-1/2" to 20" hole from 22;495' to 22;788'. Stopped at 22;770' due to stalling of drill string. Attempted to wash to bottom; could not wash past 22;788'. Spotted 100 bbls. of 16.2 ppg mud at 22;788' and pulled up to 22;640'. Pumped 125 bbls of Super Sweep. Circulated sweep out until hole was clean. Pumped slug and POOH from 22;600' to 19;928'. Continued POOH; retrieved wear bushing at wellhead. Finished POOH. Rigged up Schlumberger and ran Caliper/GR log from 22;597' to 18;500'. Pulled up to 9;450'. Caliper logged the 22" casing up to the wellhead. Rigged down Schlumberger. Picked up Dril-Quip jet sub and RIH to 8;988'. Washed 16" adapter and POOH. Washed wellhead and BOP stack on trip out. POOH with jet sub. Slipped and cut 238' of drill line. Held safety meeting. Ran shoe track assembly from derrick. Continued running 16" casing. Ran 12 stands of 16" casing from the derrick. Troubleshot Pipe Laydown System (PLS); re-booted computer system and re-indexed PLS; Pipe Racking System (PRS) and mousehole. Finished runnning 16"; 97 lb/ft; HC P-110; HD-L casing from 6;318' to 13;669'. Made up and ran 16" casing hanger and 																		
running tool. Ran 16" casing on 6-5/8" 50 lb/ft drillpipe from 13;669' to 15;863'. Swapped over to elevator inserts for 6-7/8" drillpipe. Continued running 16" casing on 6-7/8" drillpipe from 15;863' to 19;239'. Washed 16" hanger with choke and kill lines while running through BOP stack. Continued running 16" casing to 22;554'. Landed 16" in 16" x 22" profile at 8;988'. Tagged profile 23' high due to pipe stretch. Held safety meeting and rigged down elevators; bails; and flow back tool. Rigged up top drive and made up cement stand. Tested lines to 4;000 psi. Pumped 200 bbls of 12.5 ppg Dual Purpose Spacer. Dropped bottom dart. Cemented 16" casing with 876 bbls (3;464 sxs) Class H lead cement; mixed at 14.5 ppg (1.42 cu. ft/sx yield) with 7.01 gps seawater; 0.07% EZ-Flow; 10 gphs Halad 334EXP; 4 gphs WG-17EXP; 7 gphs SCR-100L. Followed with 224 bbls (1;136 sxs) of Class H tail cement; mixed at 16.2 ppg (1.10 cu. ft/sx yield) with 4.66 gps seawater; 0.07% EZ-Flow; 12 gphs Halad 344EXP and 6 gphs SCR-100L. Dropped top dart. Pumped 10 bbls of 12.5 ppg Dual Spacer.
 															Displaced with 3;072 bbls of 10.8 ppg mud with rig pumps at 20 bpm with full returns and no losses. Did not bump plug. WOC.                                                                              Laid down cement head. Picked up landing string to neutral point. Rotated landing string and observed landing string drop 10". Continued to WOC while boosting riser. Broke circulation. Tested choke line to 3;500 psi. Attempted to test and energize 16" seal
assembly. Pressured up to 2;500 psi. Pressure bled off to 1;800 psi in 5 min. Pressured up to 3;100 psi. Pressure bled back to 1;800 psi in 10 min. Picked up out of casing hanger. Circulated bottoms up to BOP. Pumped slug. POOH from 8;985' to 2;350'. Tested choke manifold to 250/4;500 psi. Continued POOH to surface with running tool. TIH with a jet sub and test plug. Function tested all shear rams on the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel. Performed casing test below stack to 610 psi to verify 22" casing integrity. Tested BOPE on yellow pod from the rig floor. Tested annular; upper; and middle pipe rams; and all fail safe valves with 6-5/8" drillpipe and both auto and manual IBOPs on the top drive to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min. each. Tested spare 6-5/8" TIW and 6-5/8" IBOP valves to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high for 5 min. each. Tested middle pipe rams with 6-5/8" drillpipe to 250/4;500 psi for 5 min. each with the yellow pod from the rig floor. Tripped out of the hole from 7;355' to 384'. Note: Function tested diverter sequence from the rig floor panel.Function tested upper; middle; and lower shear rams with yellow pod from the rig floor panel.
TIH with mill and flush assembly to 8;985'. Established pump rates of 35 bpm at 2;300 psi and washed liner top. Circulated bottoms up to above BOPs. Checked for flow and tripped out of the hole with mill and flush assembly. Performed casing test below blind rams. Pumped at 3/4 bpm. Pressure broke over at 1;680 psi. Pumped 2 additional bbls and pressure stayed at 1;680 psi. Pressure held constant for 6 min.; then dropped to 1;000 psi. in less than 1 min. Pressure slowly dropped to 750 psi. in 20 min. Pressure dropped to 620 psi. in 60 min. Performed injection test at 1 bpm - 900 psi; 2 bpm - 1;000 psi; 2.5 bpm - 1;080 psi. TIH with 16" RTTS tool to 4;541'. 
Note: Received verbal approval from  Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office to extend the 22" casing test by 48 hours. Approval was granted at 10:15 hours on August 21; 2003. New test date will be August 25th.			
"},{"   ":56,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-08-28","TEXT_REMARK":"Continued TIH with 16" RTTS to 8;985' (top of the 16" liner). Attempted to work RTTS through liner top; worked reverse torque down drill string & sat weight on tool to push through the liner top with no success. Checked well for flow; slugged pipe; and tripped out of the hole with RTTS tool. Picked up 14-3/8" stabilizer and placed under 16" RTTS & TIH (mule shoe at 10;110').  Stabilizer allowed RTTS to enter liner top with no drag. Set 16" RTTS tool at 9;022'.  Tested 16" casing to 3;100 psi and charted for 30 min. Closed annular; established injection rate of 4 bpm at 1;140 psi mud pumps. Shut mud pumps down and prseeure dropped to 800 psi.  Bled pressure off & opened annular.  Tripped out of the hole to 8;900'. Held pre-job safety meeting. Pumped 80 bbls surfactant fresh water; 0.4 gal/bbl surfactant AB; & 0.3 gal/bbl Sem8.
Pumped 65 bbls dual purpose spacer mixed with fresh water & 0.9 gal/bbl Sem8; weighted to 13.5 ppg.  Closed annular & mixed & pumped 200 bbls (1;040 sxs) of premium cement mixed with .07 EZ-Flo & 36 gphs liquid CaCl weighted to 16.4 ppg; mixed with seawater.  Displaced cement in the squeeze position with 10 bbls of 13.5 ppg weighted dual spacer; 6 bbls seawater; and 274 bbls of 10.8 ppg SBM.  Final squeeze pressure was 140 psi at 2 bpm.  Cement was in place at 19:00 hrs. WOC.  Opened well & monitored losses. Started circulating at 3 bpm with no losses.  Circulated bottoms up above BOP stack; staged pumps up to 22 bpm; 1;020 psi; no mud losses.  Checked for flow; slugged pipe and tripped out of the hole. WOC and TIH with 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" drilling assembly to 6;738'.
Tested 16" liner top against lower shear rams to 3;100 psi for 30 min.  Tested casing shear rams and upper shear rams to 250/3;100 psi for 5 min each.  TIH from 6;738' to 10;600' with drilling assembly. Washed through liner top from 8;887' to 9;021'.  Continued to TIH from 10;600' to 22;030'.  Washed and reamed from 22;030' to 22;040'. Performed well control drill; took choke line friction pressures.  Drilled top plug and cement from 22;040' to 22;049'. Continued drilling from 22;049' to 22;305'. Tagged bottom plug at 22;305'.  Drilled bottom plug and float collar from 22;305' to 22;309'.  Drilled cement from 22;309' to 22;532'.  Drilled float shoe from 22;532' to 22;534'.  Drilled cment from 22;534' to 22;550' and reamed open hole from 22;500' to 22;571'.  Verified formation exposure with MWD/LWD.  Circulated bottoms up above BOP stack and performed FIT.  Pressured up to 2;208 psi. with 10.8 ppg SBM (12.67 ppg EMW at surface; PWD = 13.17 ppg EMW downhole). 
Washed and reamed open hole from 22;571' to 22;297'. Drilled from 22;927' to 23;089'.  Lost pulser and real time data logging at 02:10 hrs at a depth of 23;040'.  Could not regain signal. Continued drilling to 23;089'. Flow checked well; slugged pipe; and tripped out of the hole. Started BOP function test when BHA was above the stack. TIH with 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" bicenter bit and BHA to 8;240'.  Installed wear sleeve in wellhead at 6;930'.  Function tested BOPE with yellow pod from the rig floor; then with the blue pod from the toolpusher's panel.  Finished TIH to 22;988'. Washed and reamed from 22;988' to 23;089'. Drilled from 23;089' to 23;277' with mud motor.  Increased mud weight from 10.8 ppg. to 11.1 ppg.
Drilled from 23;277' to 23;804' with mud motor; 0-10;000 lbs weight on bit; 60 RPM; and surface torque of 40-43;000 ft-lbs.  Increased mud weight from 11.1 ppg to 11.4 ppg at 23;560'.  Increased mud weight from 11.4 ppg to 11.7 ppg at 23;670'.  Added 4 ppb of TorqueSlide (graphite) with no noticeable improvement in torque.
Note: At 11:30 hrs. on August 30; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. Bryan Domangue; Houma MMS District Office; to drill out of the 16" casing shoe; verify that we are out of cement and in formation; and then test the casing shoe there; rather than drill to 22;937' (383' below the 16" shoe)."},{"   ":57,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-09-04","TEXT_REMARK":"Drilled from 23;804' to 23;815' with mud motor. While drilling at 23;815'; a loss of 400 psi pump pressure occurred along with a loss of 10;000 ft-lbs of top drive torque. Penetration rates stopped. Picked up and attempted to drill - no success. Circulated botrtoms up; mud weight in & out was 11.7 ppg. No indication of influx. Tripped out of the hole.  Left 29' of mud motor & bit in the hole.  Assisted aft with making up 11-3/4" overshot dressed with 9-5/8" grapple; bumper jar; and oil jar.  TIH with fishing assembly to 23;700'.  Tagged fish with 20;000 lbs down and had a pressure increase of 150 psi.  Released torque and picked up; no indication of fish.  Slacked back off and set 55;000 lbs down on the fish and got 300 psi pressure increase.  Released torque and picked up 985;000 lbs pick-up weight.  Bumped fish with bumper jars and 60;000 lbs down 3 times to make sure fish was swallowed.  Checked with pump; 100 spm (1;900 psi).  Mud weight in equaled mud weight out. No indication of influx.
Pumped slug; checked flow; and tripped out of the hole. Did not recover fish. Scarring on the 9-5/8" grapple indicated that the fish was in the overshot up to the stop at the top sub. The packoff was missing; and the shear disc was not ruptured.  Broke overshot down and redressed with 9-1/2" grapple; added upper extention sub.  Made up BHA and TIH.  Tagged fish without rotating with 8;000 lbs and had 200 psi increase while pumping 131 spm = 1;800 psi.  Bumped down on fish with bumper jars 2 times using 60;000 lbs; 90 spm = 1;650 psi. Put 140;000 lbs down on fish & pumped slug. Checked well for flow & tripped out of the hole. Tripped out of the hole with fishing assembly from 5;670'. Recovered motor and bit.
Made up 14-1/2" x 17-1/4" drilling assembly & TIH to 23;512'. Washed & reamed from 23;512' to 23;815'. Drilled from 23;815' to 23;860' with mud motor.  Increased mud weight from 11.7 to 11.9 at 23;817'. Continued drilling to 24;277'.  Increased mud weight from 11.9 ppg to 12.1 ppg at 24;220'.  Circulated at 24;277' due to 300 units of background gas; mud weight in was 12.1 and was cut to 11.4 at shaker.  Decision was made to stop drilling and raise mud weight from 12.1 ppg to 12.4 ppg to trip out of the hole.  Began circulating 12.4 ppg mud at midnight. Performed swab test; no gain observed in the trip tank. Circulated bottoms up. Gas dropped from 60 units to 37 units. Monitored well for flow; slugged pipe; & tripped out of the hole from 24;277' to 22;178'.  Flow checked well again. Continued tripping out of the hole to 15;045'. Picked up test plug & TIH to 6;930'. Landed test plug in wear sleeve; bit depth was 21;974'. Tested BOPE from the blue pod on the rig floor. Tested annular; upper & middle pipe rams; & all fail safe valves with 6-5/8" drillpipe & both auto & manual IBOPs on top drive to 250/4;500 psi low/high for 5 min each. 
Function tested with yellow pod from the toolpusher's panel. Function tested diverter sequence. Unseated plug & tripped out of the hole. While tripping; tested choke manifold & spare valves to 250/4;500 psi low/high for 5 min each test. POOH with test plug. TIH with 17-1/4" drilling assembly to 24;277'. Pumped 85 bbls of Barolift sweep. Spotted 20 bbls of 16.2 ppg mud on bottom. Pulled above 16.2 ppg mud and continued to circulate. Flow checked; pumped slug; and pulled out of the hole to 100'."},{"   ":58,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-09-11","TEXT_REMARK":"																		
Finished POOH. Rigged up Schlumberger & picked up caliper tool. RIH & ran caliper log from total depth to 16" casing shoe. POOH with logging tools. Made up washing assembly & TIH. Washed wellhead and hang-off profile. Began picking up 13-3/8" casing. RIH to 1;845'. Continued to run 13-3/8" x 13-5/8" casing from 1;845' to 17;021'. Ran a total of 2;499.37' of 13-3/8"; 72 ppf; HC Q-125; SLX casing; 2;733.21' of 13-5/8"; 88.2 ppf; HC Q-125; HDL casing; and 12;083.13' of 135/8"; 88.2 ppf; HC Q-125; SLX casing. Made up 13-5/8" casing hanger running tool. TIH with casing on landing string from 17;299' to 20;278'. TIH with 6-7/8" Oil & Gas Rental LAST landing string. Landed casing with shoe at 24;251' and hanger at 6;935'. Made up cement stand. Tested lines to 8;000 psi. Pumped (with rig pumps) 150 bbls of 14.0 ppg spacer with 30% returns. Started pumping at 105 gpm & pressure went to 1;350 psi before dropping abruptly to 950 psi and then leveling off; staged pumps up to 10 bpm--final pressure was 1;050 psi. Mixed & pumped 1;102 sxs (214 bbls) of 16.2 ppg premium cement mixed with .07% EZ-Flow + 12 gphs Halad 344 EXP + 11 gphs SCR 100L at yield of 1.09 cu. ft/sx.																		
Displaced cement at 11 bbls/min with 2;750 bbls of 12.8 ppg. Final circulating pressure was 1;200 psi; bumped the plug with 1;000 psi over that. Set the seal assembly & tested to 7;700 psi. Began testing annular to 250/7;000 psi. Tested with yellow pod from the toolpusher's office. Tested BOPE: upper & middle pipe rams; all fail safe valves & lines ( except bleed lines) to 250/7;700 psi for 5 min each test. Tested annular & fail safes on bleed line to 250/7;000 psi for 5 min on each test. Picked up above BOPs; checked for flow; and pumped slug. POOH from 6;816' to 104' with landing string. Well began flowing back at 0.5 bbls/min. Shut well in; pressure built up to 300 psi. Made up wear bushing assembly & RIH with same to 6;394'. Opened well on stripping tank. Bled back 1 bbl. Opened shear rams. Continued to RIH. Landed wear bushing at 6;934'. Pulled wear bushing running tool; indicators showed wear bushing was left in hole.																		
Continued to POOH with wear bushing running tool. Wear bushing came back with the tool. Inspected tool & wear bushing. None of the shear pins on the wear bushing were sheared. Replaced o-rings. Added 2 stands of HWDP under running tool. RIH with wear bushing to 5;341'. Finished TIH with wear bushing; boosted riser with 13.4 ppg mud. Landed wear bushing. Pulled past choke line with 1;200 psi. Indicators indicated wear bushing was set. Pumped slug & POOH. The wear bushing was still on the running tool. Tested casing to 4;300 psi for 30 min while POOH. Tested both seta of shear rams to 250/4;300 psi. Rigged up & tested Top Drive valves to 250/7;700 psi. Tested Kelly hose & swivel packing to 250/6;000 psi. Made up wear bushing running tool & TIH with same to 6;934'. Closed annular & pressured up with cement unit to 2;500 psi. to set wear bushing. Bled off pressure; opened well; and had 30;000 lb. shear out. Pumped slug & POOH. TIH with 12-1/4" HUghes MXC-1 to 9;091'. TIH to 23;734'. Washed & reamed from 23;734' to 24;010'. Drilled plugs; landing collar; shoe track; and rat hole to 24;277'. 																		
Circulated bottoms up to BOP stack. Flow checked well. Closed annular & located joint. Performed preliminary LOT with 12.7 ppg mud. LOT = 14.2 ppg EMW; 10 second casing shut in was 1;851 psi. No gas on bottoms up. Flow checked; pumps slug & POOH to 16;578'. Changed out ram guides and continued to POOH to 4;259'.																		
On September 13; 2003 at 11:15; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. John McCarroll with the Houma District MMS office to test the 13-5/8" casing string to 4;300 psi with a 12.4 ppg surface mud weight. Mr. Carroll was also advised that the casing setting depth would be shallower; and that a lower shoe test (14.5 ppg EMW); may be obtained than that shown on the approved APD. Mr. McCarroll approved the potential 14.5 ppg EMW casing shoe test change.																		
PAPERWORK REDUCTION ACT OF 1995 (PRA) STATEMENT: The PRA (44 U.S.C. 3501 et seq. Requires us to inform you that we collect this information to obtain knowledge of equipment and procedures to be used in drilling operations.  MMS uses the information to evaluate and approve or disapprove the adequacy of the equipment and/or procedures to safely perform the proposed drilling operations.  Responses are mandatory (43 U.S.C. 1334).  Proprietary data are covered under 30 CFR 250.196.  An agency may not conduct or sponsor; and a person is not required to respond to; a collection of information unless it displays a currently valid OMB Control number.  Public reporting burden for this form is estimated to average 1 hour per response; including the time for reviewing instructions; gathering and maintaining data; and completing and reviewing the form.  Direct comments regarding the burden estimate or any other aspect of this form to the Information Collection Clearance Officer; Mail Stop 4230; Minerals Management Service; 1849 C Street; NW; Washington; DC 20240.																		
																		
																		
MMS	FORM MMS-133																	
																		
																		
																		
																		
																		
"},{"   ":59,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-09-18","TEXT_REMARK":"POOH with 12-1/4" rock bit. Sperry Sun loaded sources in the BHA. TIH to 24;227'. Drilled from 24;277' to 24;287'. Circulated cuttings clear of BHA. Performed Leak-off test with 12.7 ppg mud. 10 sec. casing shut-in pressure was 1;820 psi. Leak-off test = 14.2 ppg EMW. Bled off pressure & pumped Sperry Sun PWD numbers. Maximum recorded PWD reading = 14.64 ppg. Weighted up mud from 12.7 to 13.0 ppg. Drilled 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" Bicenter hole from 24;287' to 25;220'. Weighted up mud from 13.0 to 13.3 ppg at 24;900'. Drilled from 25;220' to 25;543'. Picked up off bottom 30 ft. and function tested all BOP components from the toolpusher's panel on the blue pod and from the driller's panel on the yellow pod. Drilled from 25;543' to 25;819'. Decided to pull bit & BHA due to slow rate penetration. Circulated cuttings clear of bit. Flow checked well. Pumped slug; POOH; function tested shear rams from rig floor on yellow pod & toolpusher's panel on the blue pod.  
Continued to POOH; downloaded radio active sources & drained motor. Inspected bit & passed to aft block for downloading. Made up new bit; loaded radio active sources into Sperry Quad LWD/MWD & RIH to 6;555'. Finished TIH from 6;555 to 25;730'. Filled pipe every 30 stands & tested MWD at shoe. Washed & reamed from 25;730' to 25;819'. Drilled from 25;819' to 25;902. Raised mud weight from 13.3 ppg to 13.5 ppg at 25;827'."},{"   ":60,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-09-25","TEXT_REMARK":"																		
Drilled from 25;902' to 26;451'. Decision was made to stop drilling & run the 11-3/4" liner at 26;451'. Circulated & raised mud weight from 13.5 ppg to 13.8 ppg. Flow checked; monitored well on trip tank & slugged pipe. Tripped out of the hole. TIH with NuTec tool & test plug to 6;930'. Tested BOPs from the rig floor with the blue pod; tested annular & failsafes on bleed line to 250/7;000 psi for 5 min. each on 5" mandrel of NuTec tool. Tested upper & middle pipe rams on 6-5/8" & 5" mandrel of NuTec tool to 250/7;700 psi. Tested lower pipe rams to 250/7;700 psi for 5 min. each on 5" mandrel of NuTec tool. Tested all choke manifold valves; spare safety valves; & failsafes to 250/7;700 psi for 5 min. each. FInished testing BOPs; tested middle pipe rams with 6-5/8" to 250/7;700 psi. 																		
Function tested BOP from toolpusher's panel with yellow pod. Tripped out of the hole with test plug. Rigged up to run 11-3/4" casing. Ran 11-3/4"; 65 lb/ft; HC Q-125; Hydril SLX liner plus Baker liner hanger with ZXP packer. Picked up 6-5/8" drill pipe elevators & rigged up OES flowbacl tool & controls. TIH with 11-3/4" liner to 2;850'. Changed inserts in drill pipe elevators from 6-5/8" to 5". Changed flowback tool cup from 6-5/8" to 5" also. TIH with 11-3/4" liner to 10;984'. Tagged bottom at 26;451'. Rigged up Halliburton & tested lines to 5;000 psi. Pumped 130 bbls. of dual purpose spacer (weighted to 15.0 ppg.) with rig pumps with full returns. Mixed & pumped 557 sxs (108 bbls.) of 16.2 ppg premium cement + .07% EZ-Flo + .02 gps D-Air 3000 + 12 gphs Halad 700 + 9 gphs SCR 1000; with fresh water; yield 1.09 cu. ft/sx. Dropped dart & pumped 10 bbls. of 15.0 ppg dual spacer to release dart. Displaced cement with rig pumps at 10 bpm with 13.8 ppg SBM; dart sheared w/2;600 psi increase at 520 bbls. 																		
Landed plug w/3;550 psi & total displacement of 805 bbls of 13.8 ppg SBM. Cement was in place at 18:50 hrs. Bled off pressure & checked floats. Pressured up to 4;800 psi; liner hanger set. Attempted to pull out of liner top w/dual packoffs; pressured up to 4;000 psi several times. Worked packoffs out of liner at 23:30 hrs. Circulated bottoms up at 23;809'. Tripped out of hole from 23;809' w/liner running tool. Picked up 750 ton drilling bails & TIH w/10-5/8" drilling assembly to 6;444'. Tested liner top ZXP packer against lower shear rams to 250 psi for 5 min. and 2;500 psi for 30 min. Tested upper shear rams to 250/2;500 psi for 5 min. each. Continued TIH to 25;992' & tagged cement. Washed w/mud motor from 25;992' to 26;063' & tagged cement. Drilled cement w/mud motor from 26;063' to 26;197'. Drilled landing collar from 26;197' to 26;199'. Drilled cement w/mud motor from 26;199' to 26;451'. Drilled new formation w/mud motor from 26;451' to 26;461'. Flow checked well & circulated cuttings above liner top in preparation of performing a shoe test.																		
At 10:45 hrs. on September 26; 2003; Leah Bade received a verbal waiver from Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office to modify the upcoming BOP test. We may test the annular preventer against 5" drill pipe only; an annular test against 6-5/8" drill pipe will not be required.	
At 14:15 hrs. on September 26; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office to change the 11-3/4" liner test pressure to 2;500 psi with a 13.8 ppg surface mud weight.
At 12:15 hours on September 30; 2003; Leah Bade spoke with Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District office and received a verbal waiver extending the deadline for ROV inspection of the riser by 48 hours.																	
"},{"   ":61,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-10-02","TEXT_REMARK":"Performed LOT with 13.8 ppg surface mud weight. LOT = 15.1 EMW. Drilled from 26;461' to 26;760' w/mud motor. Suspended drilling operations. Riser tensioners S-1 and S-2 seals completely blew out & tensioner P-2 was leaking. Running in manual mode to keep up w/Nitorgen demand. Circulated 15 mins. & flow checked well. Pumped slug & started tripping out of the hole to replace tensioners. Repaired tensioners. Pumped up complete system ; all tensioners holding 1;200 psi; but S-2 was still leaking fluid slowly due to rod being scored in seal area. The nitrogen generator was repaired & back on line at 100%. Decision was made to TIH & drill. Loaded sources in Sperry tools & TIH with 10-5/8" drilling assembly. TIH from 266' to 12;250'. Tested MWD & pumped 600 gpm. Changed transducers & received signal. Function tested BOPs with yellow pod from toolpusher's panel & with blue pod from rig floor. Continued TIH from 12;250' to 26;419'. Washed & reamed from 26;419' to 26;760'. Drilled from 26;760' to 26;764' w/mud motor.
Sperry's signal was too weak to detect; so pumps were slowed to 450 gpm & RPM to 80; & detection returned. Drilled from 26;764' to 26;946' at reduced pump rate of 480 gpm and 90 rpm (17'/hr) in order to get MWD to work real-time. The decision was made to increase pump rate & rotary speed to attain maximum penetration. Continued drilling to 27;272'; taking surveys w/400 gpm. Logged 3rd stand w/Sperry Sun from 27;145' to 27;272'. Continued drilling from 27;272' to 27;537'. Logged second stand from 27;402' to 27;531'. MWD/LWD signals were undetectable while drilling at 700 gpm & 125 rpm. Drilled from 27;537' to 27;990'. Note: MWD/LWD started logging at drilling parameters due to noise levels diminishing from 27;682' to 27;765'. Detection ceased when noise levels increased. Drilled from 27;990' to 28;171'. Logged w/MWD from 28;036' to 28;171'. Drilled from 28;171' to 28;297'. Logged w/MWD from 28;170' to 28;297'. Drilled from 28;297' to 28;427'. Troubleshot increase in pump pressure. Appeared to be a plugged nozzle. Continued to drill to 28;481'. Decision was made to POOH due to three plugged nozzles. Logged from 28;427' to 28;481' w/MWD while circulating bottoms up to POOH. Racked back one stand & logged from 28;297' to 28;427' w/MWD. Finished circulating bottoms up w/13.8 ppg mud. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 28;436' to 28;164'. Flow checked & POOH to 10;902'. Pumped slug at the shoe & performed maintenance on pipe rubbers."},{"   ":62,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-10-09","TEXT_REMARK":"POOH. Made up & RIH w/new 10-5/8" BHA. Made up BOP test plug with Nu-Tech 6-5/8" x 5" test joint. TIH & landed test plug in wellhead. Tested BOPs & related equipment. Tested on yellow pod from toolpusher's office.Tested annular to 250/7;000 psi & tested rams to 250/7;700 psi. Function tested on blue pod from the rig floor. POOH w/test plug. TIH with 10-5/8" drilling assembly to 28;407'. Washed & reamed from 28;407' to 28;481'. Could not get MWD working. Drilled from 28;481' to 28;531'. Attempted to get MWD working; attempt failed. Drilled from 28;531' to 29;066'. Circulated to separate drilled gas. Performed static influx test & circulated bottoms up. Pumped 80 bbls of super sweep & weighted well bore up to 14.0 ppg. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 29;050' to 27;765'. TIH from 27;765 to 29;050'. No drag. Pumped 80 bbls of super sweep & circulated bottoms up. Bottoms up showed no increase in water or decrease in water phase salinity. Pumped & rotated out of the hole from 29;050' to 26;351'. Flow checked well; well was static."},{"   ":63,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-10-16","TEXT_REMARK":"Continued w/MDT logging. Logged a total of 79 attempted pressures; 49 were successful; 27 were tight; 2 seal failures; and 2 super charged points. Obtained 2 pump outs and samples from 26;702' & 27;521'. Used 4 sample bottles; 2 additional bottles were left. Continued w/MDT program. Attempted 114 pressure tests; 69 were successful; 40 were tight; 3 had seal failures; 2 were supercharged; had 3 pump out; and took 6 samples. Completed first MDT run. POOH. Function tested all fail safe valves from the toolpusher's office on the blue pod while POOH. Continued to POOH while function testing the annular; upper blind rams; middle blind rams; and lower blind rams on the blue pod from the toolpusher's office. Functioned all fail safe valves; annular; and all three blind shear rams on the yellow pod from the rig floor. RIH with OBMI/DSI/GR/ TO 28;150'. Logged up to 26;419'. POOH with OBMI/DSI. Flushed choke & kill lines. RIH w/MDT tools. Performed MDT logging; per program. Obtained 1 pump out sample at 26;639'. Attempted a total of 39 points; 11 were successful; 20 were tight; had 1 seal failure; 7 were aborted; 3 pump outs were done; & 10 samples were taken. At midnight; we pumped out at 28;030'. Obtained 2 samples. Released MDT probes & POOH w/MDT. Made up VSP tools & RIH. Made 4 stops at 8;700'; 18;800'; 23;250'; and 26;550'. Ran to 28;150'. Began logging up; obtaining VSP shot levels every 50' from 27;950' to 19;996' at midnight. Continued to take 50' VSP levels from 19;996' to 17;500'. Started taking 500' VSP levels from 17;500' to the wellhead. Picked up MDT (2 probes; pressure only). RIH to the shoe & stabilizer tool. Performed MDT. Attempted 32 stations; 13 were successful; 15 were tight; we had 3 seal failures; and 1 was super charged. Set down at 28;510' & pulled up to 18;000 lbs on the cable; the jars went off; and the tool was free. Set down at 28;710'. Deepest pressure was taken at 28;927'. POOH w/MDT tools. Changed out wireline spool to 446 KMXXS; tested mechanical coring tool. RIH w/MSCT & took 7 core samples starting at 28;070'; 28;068'; 28;049'; 28;030'; 27;815'; 27;814'; & 27;813'. Schlumberger dropped down 100' to 27;903' & was pulling up to set the tool at sample depth of 27;812'. While pulling up the wireline parted (between the capstan and the sheave under the rig floor). Rigged down Schlumberger.  	Ordered wireline fishing tools.	At 09:45 hrs. on October 16th; 2003; Leah Bade spoke with Brad Hunter; Houma District MMSOffice; and received a verbal extention of the BOP function test by 24 hrs. At 11:00 hrs on October 16; 2003; Leah Bade received verbal approval from Brad Hunter; Houma District MMS Office; to exclude the pipe ram tests from the required BOP function test. We will be required to function test the pipe rams the first time we have pipe across the stack. MMS came on board today; 10-16-03: Mr. Jerry Freeman. No incidents.																		
																
																		
"},{"   ":64,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-10-23","TEXT_REMARK":"Waited on crossover sub for fishing spear. Picked up crankshaft wireline fishing spear; drain sub; & 9-1/16" stop sub. Made up oil & bumper jar. TIH to 4;982'. Tripped out of the hole slowly--no wireline recovered & no markings on the crankshaft spear ot stop sub. Added 1 stand of 5" drillpipe between fishing spear & 9-1/16" stop sub. TIH w/wireline fishing assembly #2 to 5;506'. Flow checked well. Tripped out of the hole w/the wireline fishing assembly. No wireline recovered or markings on spear & stop sub. Changed stop sub from 9-1/16" OD to 12-3/16" OD in order to enter wellhead & 13-5/8" casing. TIH to 6;598'. Stroked open compensator; slacked off slowly w/spear to 6;929'. Picked up 45'; no increase on weight indicator. TIH to 6;943' & weight indicator started taking weight. Picked up 60' & slacked off to 6;943'. Flow checked well. Tripped out of the hole w/wireline fishing assembly. Installed Schlumberger T-bar on wireline & pulled wire out of the hole. TIH w/wireline crankshaft fishing spear & 12-3/16" stop sub to 6;887'. Opened compensator; slacked off top 6;929' & rotated 2 turns to the right. Slacked off to 6;643' & spear took weight of 8;000 lbs. Attempted to 																		
roll stop sub into wear bushing w/3 turns to the right; & torque increased to 1;500-1;900 ft/lb. Tripped out of the hole w/wireline fishing assembly using the compensator. Held safety meeting with Schlumberger & rig crew. Schlumberger pulled wireline to unit & re-threaded wire onto capstan. Schlumberger spliced wireline w/torpedo splice & spooled excess wireline onto winch. Set clocks back an hour for daylight savings time. Had full recovery of wireline & MSCT tool. TIH w/test plug & NuTec tool. Tested BOP equipment from blue pod on the rig floor. Tested annular w/5" to 250/7;000 psi; lower pipe rams w/5" to 250/7;700 psi; upper & middle rams with 6-5/8" & 5" pipe sizes to 250/7;700 psi; choke manifold; all valves & spare valves to 250/7;700 psi. Function tested BOPE from toolpusher's panel w/yellow pod. Functioned upper; middle; & lower shear rams while POOH. Tripped out of the hole w/test plug. RIH w/USIT logging tool & began logging up at 23;742'. Continued running USIT log from 21;550' to 6;930'. Rigged down Schlumberger. Rigged up OES casing equipment to run 9-3/8" liner. TIH w/129 joints of 9-3/8"; 38.4 lb/ft; HCQ-125 liner.  																		
Rigged down 9-3/8" casing equipment. Picked up Baker Oil Tools ZXP Flex Loc liner hanger. Rigged up flow back tool dressed for 6-5/8" drillpipe. TIH w/2 stands of 27 lb/ft; 6-5/8" drillpipe & jars to 5;860'. Changed flow back tool to fit 5" drillpipe. TIH with 9-3/8" liner to 13;854'. Changed flow back tool to fit 6-5/8" drillpipe. Continued to TIH to 29;061' w/full returns. Held pre-job safety meeting. Rigged up Halliburton & broke circulation at 2 bpm. Tested lines to 5;000 psi. Pumped 40 bbls of dual purpose weighted spacer to 15.0 ppg without surfactant; & then pumped 40 bbls of dual purpose spacer weighted to 15.0 ppg with surfactant (SEM 8 at .9 gpb). Mixed & pumped 95 bbls (372 sxs) of 16.2 ppg premium cement with .25% D-air 3000 + 35% silica flour + .10% SA-541 + 12 gphs Halad 334 EXP + 25 gphs 2:1 SCR100L; mixed with 5.69 gps of fresh water. Yield was 1.44 cu. ft/sx. Dropped dart & pumped 10 bbls of spacer without surfactant.																		
Displaced cement w/rig pumps & 14.0 ppg SBM. Pumped at 8 bpm; dart sheared at 529 bbls w/2;570 psi & bumped plug w/921 bbls; at a pressure of 3;000 psi. Had full returns throughout cement displacement. Set Baker liner hanger w/3;300 psi. Released from liner top. Picked up to extend setting dogs; set down; & set ZXP packer. Top of liner was at 23;547'; & the shoe was at 29;065'. Tested ZXP packer & top of liner to 1;900 psi w/14.0 ppg SBM for 15 min. Closed annular & circulated bottoms up. through choke & kill lines. Racked back cement head & stand. Set liner hanger setting tool stinger at 23;498'. Tested liner top & Baker's ZXP packer to 1;900 psi for 30 min. Spotted cement plug from 23;498' to 22;998'. Pumped 15 bbls of Dual Purpose weighted spacer to 15 ppg; & pumped 15 bbls of Dual Purpose  weighted spacer to 15 ppg with surfactant SEM 8 at .9 gpb. Mixed & pumped 74 bbls of 16.4 ppg (392 sxs) of premium cement with .07% EZ-Flo + 8 gphs HR-6L. Mixed at 4.33 gps of fresh water. Yield was 1.06 cu. ft/sx. Pumped 4 bbls of spacer without surfactant & 4 bbls of fresh water. Displaced cement w/rig pumps. Cement was in place at 23:45 hrs. Tripped out of the  																		
from 26;498' to 21;484' after spotting cement plug from 23;498' to 22;998'. Circulated bottoms up to top of the BOP stack to clear residual cement from the casing. Tripped out of the hole from 21;484' to 8;040'. Continued to circulate bottoms up w/boost pumps.  Performed negative test on the liner top & ZXP packer. Displaced wellbore from SBM to seawater from 8;040'. Pulled pipe to 8;000'.  Broke circulation w/seawater & tested lines to 5;000 psi. Left 400' plug frokm 8;000' to 7;600'. Pumped 59.5 bbls Class "H" cement (334 cuft) w/.07% EZ-Flo & 39 gphs of CaCl2 L; 309 sxs mixed at 16.4  ppg; with a 1.08 cu. ft/sx yield mixed with 4.45 gps mix water. POOH to 7;200'. Circulated bottoms up to above BOPE & 2 drillpipe volumes to clear residual cement from the drillpipe & BOPE. POOH from 7;200' to 4;998'.																		
At 08:50 hrs on October 23; 2003; Leah Bade received a verbal extension of 48 hrs for the BOP test from Mr. John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District Office due to wireline fishing operations.																		
At 09:00 hrs on October 25; 2003; Leah Bade received a 24 hr verbal extension of the BOP test requirement from Ms. Leslie Peterson; of the Houma MMS District Office. A BOP test will now be required by midnight on October 26; 2003.																		
At 07:35 hrs; on October 28; 2003; Mr John McCarroll with the MMS Houma District Office; approved running the 9-3/8" liner & temporarily abandoning the well.																		
"},{"   ":65,"WELL_NAME":"  002","API12":608124001100,"WAR_START_DT":"2003-10-30","TEXT_REMARK":"POOH from 4;998' w/setting tool. Racked back top drive & rigged up floor to pull the BOP stack. Pulled out and laid down diverter. Picked up landing joint; closed slip joint; & prepared to unlatch stack. Unlatched at 10:30 hrs on 10/30/03. Held safety meeting & laid out Heavywall pup joint. Laid down 40' & 10' pup joint. Laid out joints 88-72. Pulled & laid out riser joints 72-2. Skidded BOP cart under stack & rigged down riser double. Washed out BOPs & skidded stack to park position. Laid out 2 slick joints of riser. Rig released at 22:30 hrs. en-route to MC 508 OCS-G 21764.																		
"},{"   ":66,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-12-17","TEXT_REMARK":"12/17/07:  UNDERWAY FROM M.C. 860 TO W.R. 678.

12/18/07:  FINISH TRANSIT FROM M.C. 860 TO W.R. 678; FINISH TENSIONER CHANGE OUT; PERFORM CURRENT SURVEY; R/U TO RUN 36" CASING.

12/19/07:  MOVE 7 MILES SOUTH OF ST. MALO #4; M/U 36" CASING; RUN INNER STRING; RUN 36" TO 6622' WHILE DRIFTING BACK TO LOCATION.

12/20/07:  AFT ROTARY JET IN 36" CASING TO 7404'; LET 36" SOAK; TIH W/ 26" BHA ON FWD; RELEASE CADA TOOL FROM 36" LPH; POOH. FWD ROTARY STAB 26" DRILLING BHA INTO LPH.

12/21/07:  DRILL 26" TO F/ 7404' TO 8260'; POOH; CHANGE BHA; RE-JET BIT; BEGIN TIH.

12/22/07:  FINISH TIH TO 8260'; DRILL 26" HOLE TO 8839'; CBU; SPOT 13.0 PPG PAD MUD; FLOW CHECK; BEGIN POOH.
"},{"   ":67,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2007-12-23","TEXT_REMARK":"12/23/07:  FINISH POOH; WASH LPH; POOH; R/U FRANKS & RUN 22" CSG; R/D FRANKS; RIH W/ INNER STRING.

12/24/07: RUN & LAND 22" CSG; CIRC 13.0 PPG MUD; R/U & CEMENT 22" CSG WITH CEMENT RETURNS TO SEAFLOOR; LOCK DOWN WH; DISPLACE 22" W/ 12 PPG PAD MUD; POOH.

12/25/07:  POOH; L/D MRLD & 5" DP; BOP MAINTENANCE; P/U 1 JT RISER.

12/26/07:  PERFORM BOP MAINTENANCE; R/B DP & HWDP. SUSPENDED OPERATIONS & MOVED TO ST. MALO #3 WELL. 
"},{"   ":68,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-02-29","TEXT_REMARK":"02/29/08:  PREPARE & MOVE RIG TO ST MALO #4; SETTING OUT COMPATTS.

03/01/08:  SET OUT COMPATTS; DRIFTED & RAN RISER; LATCHED UP; TESTED CONNECTOR; UPPER BSR'S; LOWER BSR'S & CASING. STARTED TIH WITH SPECIAL BOP TEST TOOL.

"},{"   ":69,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-03-02","TEXT_REMARK":"03/02/08:  TIH w/BOP TEST TOOL. TEST BOP'S. POOH W/TEST TOOL. TIH W/ 18-1/8" DRILL ASSY.

03/03/08:  CONT TIH W/ 18-1/8" DRILLING ASSY. DISPLACED WELL TO 10.5 SBM. DRILLED OUT 22" SHOE TRACK + 10' NEW FORMATION. PERFORMED FIT T/ 11.9 PPG. DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE T/ 8;900'.

03/04/08:  CONT DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE F/ 8;900' T/ 10;260'.

03/05/08:  CONT DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE F/ 10;260' T/ 12;345'.

03/06/08:  CONT DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE F/ 12;345' T/ 14;389'.

03/07/08:  CONT DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE F/ 14;839' T/ 15;295'. TIGHT HOLE CONDITIONS. POOH TO EXAMINE 18-1/8" BHA. AT 15:15 HRS; DAN WILLIAMSON OF CHEVRON RECEIVED VERBAL APPROVAL FROM BENJAMIN COCO OF MMS TO DRILL TO THE PLANNED 16" CASING POINT WITH A MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT OF 11.6 PPG BASED ON A 0.3 PPG MARGIN UNDER THE 11.9 PPG 22" CASING SHOE.

03/08/08:  CONT POOH W/18-1/8" BHA. DISCOVERED MUX LINE STORM LOOP BANANA SHEAVE AND SDC CONTROL LINE JUNCTION BOX BROKE AWAY FROM TERMINATION JOINT DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS. PROCEED WITH SECURING WELL AND SUSPENDING OPS. AT 11:43 HRS; TOM JONES OF CHEVRON RECEIVED VERBAL APPROVAL FROM BENJAMIN COCO OF MMS TO SUSPEND WELL OPERATIONS DUE TO THE NECESSITY TO PERFORM REPAIRS ON MUX CABLES AND HYDRAULIC LINES.
"},{"   ":70,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-03-09","TEXT_REMARK":"03/09/08:  COMPLETE REPAIR TO STORM LOOP & SDC CONTROL LINES. LAND & LATCH LMRP & R/D RISER EQUIPMENT. DISPLACE RISER. P/U & TIH W/ 18-1/8" BHA.

03/10/08:  CONT TIH W/ 18-1/8" BHA. FUNCTION TEST BOP. TEST LMRP CONN. TIH AND WASH & REAM.

03/11/08:  DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE. WORK TIGHT HOLE AS NEEDED. TROUBLE SHOOT TDS FAULT.

03/12/08:  CONT DRILL 18-1/8" HOLE TO TD @ 17;000' MD / 16;998' TVD. WORK TIGHT HOLE AS NEEDED. BACK REAM OUT OF HOLE.

03/13/08:  CONT POOH W/ 18-1/8" BHA WORKING TIGHT HOLE AS NEEDED. TROUBLE SHOOT TDS. WASH 16" HNGR LANDING PROFILE. POOH. R/U TO RUN 16" CSG

03/14/08:  RUN 16" CSG. 

03/15/08:  CONT TO RUN 16' CSG T/16;955'. LAND OUT 16" CASING HANGER. PUMP CEMENT JOB; 2651 CUFT @ 16.8 PPG. SET SEAL ASSEMBLY AND TEST SAME. POOH W/LANDING STRING.

"},{"   ":71,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-03-16","TEXT_REMARK":"03/16/08:  POOH WITH CASING RUNNING TOOL; RIG SERVICE; C/O IBOP; TIH WITH BOP TT & TEST BOP'S; PERFORM FULL DIVERTER; POOH.

03/17/08:  CASING-UPPER AND LOWER BSR-FUNCTION TESTS; TIH WITH 14 3/4" X 16 1/2" BHA; WASH & REAM; DRILL SHOE TRACK.

03/18/08:  DRILL CEMENT & SHOE TRACK. DRILL 10' OF NEW FORMATION; CIRC & COND; PERFORM FIT; WEIGHT UP TO 11.5 PPG; DRILL; WEIGHT UP TO 12.0 PPG.

03/19/08:  REAMING; WOW; REAMING; DRILLING 14-3/4"; ACTIVATE RHINO REAMER; MAKE
16-1/2" CUT OUT FOR RHINO ARMS; VERIFY REAMER ARMS ARE OPEN.

03/20/08:  REAM; ACTIVATE RHINO STABILIZER; REAMING; DRILLING 14-3/4" X 16-1/2" HOLE; REAM TIGHT HOLE & RAISED MUD WEIGHT TO 12.3 PPG; DRILLING AHEAD. 

03/21/08:  DRILLING AHEAD; REAMING TIGHT HOLE; DRILLING; REAMING TIGHT HOLE; DRILLING.

03/22/08:  DRILLING; REAMING & REPAIR TDS; CIRCULATE & RAISE MUD WEIGHT; DRILLING; REAMING; DRILLING; REAMING; CIRCULATE BOTTOMS UP; POOH.

"},{"   ":72,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-03-23","TEXT_REMARK":"03/23/08:  POOH; MAKE UP & TRIP IN HOLE WITH BHA #7; FUNCTION TEST BOP WHILE TRIPPING IN THE HOLE; REAMING/OPENING 14-3/4" HOLE TO 16-1/2".

03/24/08:  REAMING; DRILLING 14-3/4" X 16-1/2" HOLE; TROUBLESHOOT TDS; POOH TO SHOE; REPAIR TDS; TRIP IN HOLE; DRILLING AHEAD.

03/25/08:  DRILLING; DISPLACE 12.5 PPG MUD IN HOLE WITH 12.0 PPG; DRILLING AHEAD.

03/26/08:  DRILLING; CIRCULATE BOTTOMS UP; POOH DUE TO INCLINATION INCREASING; MAKE UP & TRIP IN HOLE WITH BHA #8.

03/27/08:  TRIP IN HOLE; DRILL AHEAD.

03/28/08:  DRILL; POOH TO CHANGE OUT BHA; TRIP IN HOLE; TEST BOP'S.

03/29/08:  FINISH TESTING BOP'S TO MMS AND CHEVRON SPECIFICATIONS. POOH. MAKE UP BHA #9 AND TRIP IN HOLE. WASH/REAM/RE-LOG TO 20;089'.
"},{"   ":73,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-03-30","TEXT_REMARK":"03/30/08:  WASH & REAM DOWN TO BOTTOM. CONT TO DRILL 14.75 X 16.5 HOLE F/ 20;193' 
T/ 20;769'. CIRC & COND MUD. POOH TO 16" SHOE TO WORK ON TOP DRIVE.

03/31/08:  MAKE REPAIRS TO TOP DRIVE. TIH W/14.75 x 16.5 BHA. CONT TO DRILL F/ 20;769' T/ 20;946'. CIRC & COND MUD. POOH FOR BHA FAILURE.

04/01/08:  CONT POOH W/ 14.75 X 16.5 BHA. SLIP & CUT DRILL LINE. TIH W/NEW BHA. WASH & REAM T/ 20;925'.

04/02/08:  CONT TO WASH & REAM TO BOTTOM. CONT TO DRILL 14.75 X 16.5 HOLE F/ 20;946' 
T/ 21;900'.

04/03/08:  CONT TO DRILL 14.75 X 16.5 HOLE F/ 21;900' T/ 23;226' NOTE: BOBBIE JO KULL (CHEVRON) RECEIVED APPROVAL FROM MR. BENJAMIN COCO (MMS HOUMA DISTRICT) AT 13:46 ON 04/03/08 TO DRILL BEYOND THE PERMITTED DEPTH OF 23;300' FOR THE 13-5/8" LINER PROVIDED THAT THE CONTINUED DRILLING STAYS WITHIN THE 0.5 PPG MARGIN OF THE FIT.

"},{"   ":74,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-04-06","TEXT_REMARK":"04/06/08:  CONT TO LOG W/ GR/LDT/CNL/AIT/MSIP. POOH. RIH W/ GR/MDT. TAKE PRESSURE & FLUID SAMPLES.

"},{"   ":75,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003100,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-04-13","TEXT_REMARK":"04/13/08:  PERFORM CEMENT JOB ON 13 5/8" CASING; CIRCULATE AND CONDITION MUD; POOH WITH HALLIBURTON FASDRILL TOOL; SLIP AND CUT DRILL LINE; TEST 13 5/8" CASING TO 3835 PSI; TRIP IN HOLE WITH 12 1/4" X 13 1/2" DRILLING ASSY.

04/14/08:  TRIP IN HOLE TO 12;339'; RIG UP AND TEST BOP PER CHEVRON AND MMS SPECIFICATIONS; FINISH TRIPPING IN HOLE TO TOP OF CEMENT; DRILL 13 5/8" FASDRILL; CLEAN OUT 13 5/8" CASING.

04/15/08:  DRILL CEMENT & 10' NEW FORMATION; PERFORM FIT TO 13.5 PPG; DRILL 12-1/4" X 13-1/2" HOLE SECTION; ACTIVATE ANDERREAMER AT 23;546'.
