"},{"   ":100,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003101,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-10-19","TEXT_REMARK":"10/19/08:  FINISH CBU; SPOT WEIGHTED SBM PILL ON BOTTOM; POOH.

10/20/08:  FINISH POOH; R/U W/L; LOG OPEN HOLE; R/U CASING EQUIPMENT.

10/21/08:  RUN 5763' OF 9-7/8" CASING; TIH WITH 9-7/8" CASING ON 6-5/8" LANDING STRING. NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH AND MUDLINE.

10/22/08:  TIH WITH 9-7/8" CASING ON LANDING STRING TO 28;265'. SHUT IN WELL DUE TO MUD LOSSES AT ~3 BPM.

10/23/08:  MONITOR BOP/WH PRESSURE WHILE CUTTING SURFACE & RISER VOLUME BACK F/ 14.1 PPG TO 11.0 PPG.
NOTE: BOBBIE JO KULL (CHEVRON) RECEIVED APPROVAL VIA E-MAIL FOR 24 HR EXTENSION ON BOP TEST.

10/24/08:  CUT MW IN RISER F/ 14.0 TO 11.0 PPG; PERFORM SEVERAL UNSUCCESSFUL ATTEMPTS TO RELEASE LINER RUNNING TOOL; LOOSING SBM AT ~3 TO 4 BPM WHENEVER OPEN ANNULAR TO TRY AND RELEASE LINER RUNNING TOOL. WAITING ON SBM TO PERFORM CMT JOB. 
NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH AND MUDLINE.
NOTE: BOBBIE JO KULL (CHEVRON) RECEIVED APPROVAL VIA EMAIL FOR BOP TEST EXTENSION UNTIL 10/28/08.

10/25/08:  CEMENTED 9-7/8" LINER W/ 15.8 PPG CMT (1516 CUFT; 978 SX; 1.55 CUFT/SX); ATTEMPTED TO RELEASE FROM RUNNING TOOL; NO SUCCESS; WOC.
"},{"   ":101,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003101,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-10-26","TEXT_REMARK":"10/26/08:  WOC UNTIL 2200 HR; R/D CMT HEAD; R/U E-LINE & TEAS SYSTEM.
*NOTE: FUNCTION BOP'S F/ OIM PANEL. LOST 32 BBLS OF 11.0 PPG SBM WHILE FUNCTIONINB BOPS. TOTAL VOLUME OF 11.0 PPG LOST IS 885 BBLS.

10/27/08:  RUN FREE POINT TOOL; DP STUCK AT ~16;800'. RUN TEMP & NOISE LOG. NO CHANGE IN TEMPERATURE PROFILE INDICATING NO FLUID MOVEMENT BELOW 17;500' MD. NO FLOW DETECTED BY NOISE LOG - TOO MUCH BACKGROUND NOISE. TOTAL VOLUME OF 11.0 PPG LOST IS 1347 BBLS.
*NOTE: BRAD HUNTER (MMS) WAS VERBALLY NOTIFIED ON 10/27/08 AT 13:45 HRS THAT A TOI EMPLOYEE WAS SENT IN ON 10/26/08 FOR FURTHER MEDICAL EVALUATION.

10/28/08:  RUN RST SIGMA BASELINE LOG. RUN "BORAX" RST CHEMICAL TRACER LOG. LOSS OF SIGMA SIGNAL FROM BORAX INDICATES LOSS ZONE IS 22" SHOE. RUN 2ND TEMPERATURE LOG F/ 21;500' TO 20;500' - NO CHANGE IN TEMPERATURE PROFILE; WORK ON TEAS SYSTEM.
*NOTE: TOM JONES (CHEVRON) RECEIVED VERBAL APPROVAL FROM BENJAMIN COCO (MMS) FOR 24 HR EXTENSION ON BOP TEST.

10/29/08:  POOH W/ RST; TEMPERATURE; NOISE; GAMMA & CCL TOOL. WAIT ON ORDERS FOR P&A PLAN. M/U PERF GUN; ATTEMPT TO PERF DP F/ 21;520' TO 21;525' - UNSUCCESSFUL.
*NOTE: TOM JONES (CHEVRON) RECEIVED VERBAL APPROVAL FROM BENJAMIN COCO (MMS) AT 1600 HRS TO START P&A OPERATIONS ON THE ST MALO 4 WELL.

10/30/08:  POOH W/ SLB PERF GUN. RIH W/ PERF GUNS; PERF DP F/ 21;010' TO 21;015'. DISPLACE 14.1 PPG SBM IN DP & ANNULUS TO 15.0 PPG WBM. SET CEMENT PLUG F/ 20;015' TO 21;015'; WOC.  
*NOTE: ROV INSPECTED RISER; BOP; WH AND MUDLINE; NO ISSUES.
*NOTE: BOBBIE JO KULL (CHEVRON) RECEIVED VERBAL APPROVAL FROM BEN COCO (MMS) OF COMPLETE P&A PLAN FOR ST MALO 4; WITH REQUESTED DEPARTURES APPROVED.

10/31/08:  WOC; DISPLACE SBM TO WBM IN RISER; ATTEMPT TO PERF DP @ 18;626' TO 18;631'.

11/01/08:  TEST PLUG @ 20;010 TO 2450 PSI. WAITING ON ARRIVAL OF PERFORATING GUNS FROM SLB. RIH W/ SLB PERF GUNS; ATTEMPT TO PERF DP @18;355'. POOH W/ SLB PERF GUNS. RIH WITH TEMP NOISE LOG TOOLS. 
*NOTE: WHILE WAITING FOR PERFORATING GUNS; ALLOW 10 PPG WBM IN KILL LINE TO COMMUNICATE WITH THE WELLBORE BELOW CLOSED ANNULAR TO CHECK WELLBORE INTEGRITY. WELL TOOK 5 BBLS IN 3 MIN & WHP INCREASED FROM 3305 PSI TO 3600 PSI. MONITOR WHP.
*NOTE: ROV PERFORMED SEABED SURVEY ON 11/01/08 AND NOTICED A BLACK SUBSTANCE COMING OUT OF THE SEABED AT 188' @ 306 DEG FROM WELLHEAD. SAMPLES OF THE SUBSTANCE WILL BE COLLECTED FOR ANALYSIS. "},{"   ":102,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003101,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-11-02","TEXT_REMARK":"11/02/08:  CONTINUE RUNNING SBL NOISE AND TEMPERATURE LOGS FROM 19;400' TO 7;050'. NOTICE SLIGHT TEMPERATURE CHANGE FROM 8;600' TO 8;775'. POOH W/ SLB NOISE LOG. R/U SLB SCMT WIRELINE. RIH W/ SAME. 
NOTE: TOM JONES NOTIFIED BEN COCO AND BRYAN DOMANQUE OF POOLS OF DARK SUBSTANCE ON SEAFLOOR. COAST GUARD AND NRCC WAS ALSO NOTIFIED BY RIG.

11/03/08:  RUN SLB WIRELINE CMT TOOL TO 19;000'. LOG UP F/19;000' TO 15;000'. RIH W/ "BLACK WARRIOR" WIRELINE PERF GUNS TO 18;600'. UNSUCCESSFUL PERF DP ATTEMPT.  

11/04/08:  CONTINUE TO PERFORM WIRELINE PERF OPERATIONS.

11/05/08:  CONTINUE TO PERFORM WIRELINE PERF OPERATIONS.

11/06/08:  R/U SLB FREEPOINT WIRELINE. RIH TO 16;720' & PERFORM OPS. P/U SLB STRING SHOT TOOLS & TIH TO 16;772'. BACK-OFF DP. POOH W/ WIRELINE. R/U CMT LINES.

11/07/08: PUMP 98 BBLS CEMENT PLUG. EST TOC @ 16;772' TO 16;272'. DISPLACE RISER
F/ 10.0 PPG TO 9.6 PPG.

11/08/08: POOH W/ DP TO SURFACE. SLIP & CUT 119' OF DRILL LINE. P/U 14-3/4" BIT & TIH TO 16;155'.
"},{"   ":103,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003101,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-11-09","TEXT_REMARK":"*NOTE: ON 11/07/08 AT 12:45 HRS; MIKE FRENCH (CHEVRON) HAD A TELEPHONE CONVERSATION WITH BEN COCO (MMS-HOUMA) DISCUSSING THE REVISION TO THE APM FOR THE P&A SUBMITTED FOR THE ST MALO 4 WELL. THESE REVISIONS INCLUDED ELIMINATING THE CEMENT PLUG IN THE 16" CASING FROM 8800' TO 9300' AND UTILIZATION OF A 9-7/8" TIEBACK/SCAB LINER TO ISOLATE THE LEAK IN THE 16" CASING.

11/09/08:  WASH & REAM TO 16;421' WITH 14-3/4" BIT. TAG UP AT 16;421'.  POOH; SERVICE RIG; TIH W/ 16" EZSV RETAINER. SET DOWN AT 16;159' P/U TO 16;151' WITH NO OVERPULL.

11/10/08:  P/U TO 16;126' AND LOCATE TJ. ATTEMPT TO SET EZSV AT 16;126'. ATTEMPT PULL TEST AND HAD FREE TRAVEL. MAKE SEVERAL ATTEMPTS WITH ROTATION AND PULL TO SET EZSV BETWEEN 16;121' AND 16;159' - NO SUCCESS. SET 60 KLBS DOWN AT 16;159'. P/U AND VERIFY TAG. SPOT 108 BBLS OF CLASS H CEMENT. ESTIMATED TOC AT 15;700'. DID NOT GET TEST ON EZSV. POOH; R/U W/L.

11/11/08:  ATTEMPT TO RUN CALIPER LOG; 2 RUNS UNSUCCESSFUL. P/U 14-3/4" BIT AND TIH FOR CLEANOUT TRIP. WASH DOWN FROM 7530' TO 9500'; CIRC CLEAN.
*NOTE: ON 11/11/08 AT 14:15; MIKE FRENCH HAD ANOTHER TELEPHONE CONVERSATION WITH BEN COCO ADVISING HIM OF THE COMPROMISED 16" EZSV SET AT 16;159' AND PLANS TO SET ANOTHER EZSV AT APPROX 9400' AFTER CONCLUDING THE CASING LEAK DIAGNOSTICS. MR. COCO REQUESTED THAT THE CHANGES ON 11/07/08 AND 11/11/08 BE INCORPORATED IN A REVISED APM AFTER THE CASING DIAGNOSTICS ARE COMPLETED.

11/12/08:  POOH F/ 9500'. M/U SJCT ASSY; CLEAN RISER FROM 642' TO 7081'. PUMP PILLS & CBU. 

11/13/08:  POOH W/ SJCT ASSY & L/D. R/U W/L & RUN CALIPER LOG - TOOL NOT FUNCTIONING PROPERLY. POOH - NEED TO REDRESS TOOL. RUN USIT LOG FROM 9500' TO 7380' AND CALIPER LOG FROM 9500' TO 7081'. R/D W/L. P/U 16" RTTS & RIH.

11/14/08:  CONT TIH W/ 16" RTTS ASSY AND SET SAME AT 7;450'. ATTEMPT TO TEST CASING BELOW TO 1000 PSI - NO TEST. TEST CASING AND 16" SA ABOVE RTTS TO 1000 PSI - GOOD TEST. CHASING LEAK WITH RTTS. LEAK DETERMINED TO BE BETWEEN 8750' AND 8845'. DROP GYRO AND POOH SURVEYING FROM 8994' TO 7081'. CONTINUE TO POOH.

11/15/08:  TIH W/ EZSV; SET AT 8707'. TEST BACKSIDE TO 1000 PSI - GOOD TEST. SQUEEZE 100 BBLS CEMENT BELOW EZSV. POOH. MU & TIH W/ 5" STINGER FOR NEXT PLUG.
"},{"   ":104,"WELL_NAME":"  003","API12":608124003101,"WAR_START_DT":"2008-11-16","TEXT_REMARK":"11/16/08:  TIH WITH 5" CEMENT STINGER TO 8680'. PLACE 108 BBLS OF 16.4 PPG CMT (606 SACKS) ON TOP OF EZSV. CEMENT PLUG FROM 8680' TO 8180'. POSITVE TEST CMT PLUG TO 
1000 PSI FOR 15 MINS. PERFORM 380 PSI NEG TEST FOR 30 MINS - GOOD. DISPLACE TO SEAWATER. RUN DOWNHOLE CAMERA TO INSPECT 16" SUPPLEMENTAL ADAPTER AND CASING FROM 7378' TO 7392'.

11/17/08:  POOH DOWNHOLE CAMERA; P/U RISER BRUSH ASSEMBLY; TIH TO W/H; CBU; POOH. 
RIG UP RISER HANDLING TOOLS. 

11/18/08:  PULL RISER JEWELRY AND UNLATCH BOP STACK FROM WH AT 03:47 HRS. PULL RISER ON FWD ROTARY. ON AFT ROTARY TIH WITH 5" CEMENT STINGER TO 7400' AND SPOT 68 BBLS OF 16.4 PPG CEMENT. SURFACE PLUG FROM 7400' TO 7200'; POOH.

11/19/08:  WAIT ON RISER WRENCH SOCKETS TO ARRIVE AND CONTINUE PULL RISER.

11/20/08:  PULL RISER ON FWD ROTARY; SKID BOP'S TO STORED POSITION AND SECURE. PREPARE RIG FOR TRANSIT. AFT ROTARY; M/U JET-IN BHA'S.      
"},{"   ":105,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-11-20","TEXT_REMARK":"11/20/2011: Arrived on location at 10:00 hrs.; set out compatts with ROV; P/U and run 36" casing and jetting BHA. 

11/21/2011: Cont'd RIH 36" casing on landing string. Jet in 36" from 6;899' to 7205' (12' stick up) and soak same. Release CADA tool from LPWH and TOH with inner string 30". Jet in BHA assy to clear LPWH at 6;887'; pump thru string to clear 22' above LPWH.
"},{"   ":106,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-06","TEXT_REMARK":"12/06/2011: Off location; finishing pre-job technical services for St. Malo PN001. Transit to St. Malo PN001 and begin racking back 26" drilling BHA #2.

12/07/2011: Finish racking back 26" drilling BHA #2. Pick up and begin tripping in with 26" drilling BHA #1. 

12/08/2011: Trip to 500' above wellhead with 26" drilling BHA. Suspend rig floor operations while waiting on boat to offload casing.

12/09/2011: Trip in hole with 26" drilling BHA and drill with seawater from 36" shoe at 7;205' to 7;784'. 

12/10/2011: Drill 26" hole with seawater from 7;784' to 8;853'. Weight up to 10.0 ppg salt-saturated PAD mud and continue drilling to 9;429'. Displace to 11.0 ppg salt-saturated PAD mud.
"},{"   ":107,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-11","TEXT_REMARK":"12/11/2011: POOH above LPH with drilling BHA #1 on Aft rotary. TIH on Forward rotary with drilling BHA #2. Ream down from 9;241' to 9;429' to obtain correlation log. Drill 26" hole from 9;429' to 9;786' with 11.0 ppg salt-saturated PAD mud. Top of salt at 9;474'. 

12/12/2011: Drill 26" hole to 10;452'. Displace hole to 12.5 ppg SSPAD mud. Spot 16.0 ppg SSPAD mud in the rathole. POOH with 26" drilling BHA to LPH and wash wellhead with PBL sub. 

12/13/2011: POOH with 26" drilling BHA on Forward rotary. On Aft rotary; run 22" casing; M/U HPH joint; run 4-1/2" inner string; M/U MRLD running tool.

12/14/2011: Run 22" casing on landing string. Land HPH in LPH. Perform cement job with 12;378 cu-ft of 13.8 ppg lead cement and 1;108 cu-ft of 16.4 ppg tail cement. Cement returns verified at the mudline. Perform rigid lockdown of HPH to LPH and release MRLD running tool. POOH with landing string. 	

12/15/2011: POOH with landing and inner strings. TIH with 6-5/8" diverter sub and tag cement @ 10;186' with 30 klbs down. Displace seawater in 22" casing with 12.5 ppg mud treated with oxygen scavenger and corrosion inhibitor. POOH. Install TA cap on wellhead and pump 55 gallons of preservation fluid. 

12/16/2011: Perform seafloor survey with ROV. Pull compatts/transponders from seafloor. Move rig off location.
"},{"   ":108,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-03","TEXT_REMARK":"08/03/2012: Began rigging up riser equip on Fwd.
NOTE: Mr. Kevin Corbin of Chevron gave 72 hour notice by e-mail to Mr Bobby Nelson & Mr. Josh Ladner of BSEE on initial subsea BOP tests on Monday 08/06/2012.

08/04/2012: Finished with between well planned rig maintenance; P/U 2 jts of riser while skidding BOPs to well center.

"},{"   ":109,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-05","TEXT_REMARK":"08/05/2012: Finished skidding BOPs to well center; M/U double and R/U BOP to splash; splash BOP; tested riser; run BOPs on marine riser; tested at 3;269'; continued running BOPs @ 3;944' midnight depth.

08/06/2012: Finished running BOPs to depth; P/U 5' pup; termination; slip and landing jts; R/U jewelry in moonpool; land in SDC ring and latched up to W/H. Performed overpull and slump test; L/O landing jt. Closed BSR with ROV; completed BSR/CSG test to 250/2100 psi while performing ERA offset.

08/07/2012: Completed ERA test; picked up diverter and install. Perform deadman test. Rigged down riser equip; rigged down drilling equip. Run in hole with BOP test assembly BHA. Perform diverter flow test; finish run in hole and land test assy in wellhead. Perform accumulator test; test BOPs - #7 (1 of 18) to 250/8000 psi on rams and 250/4900 psi on annular.

08/08/2012: Finished testing BOPs; POOH DQ BOP test assembly. Function tested BSRs/CSRs and diverter while servicing rig. TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" RS assembly to 6;406'. Held trip drill and installed back-saver slips. 

08/09/2012: Function tested BSRs and CSRs. Finished displacing well to 11.2 ppg SBM. Drilled out shoe track and 10' of new formation. Performed 22" casing FIT to 13.0 ppg.

08/10/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 10;462' to 10;544'. Dropped 2-1/4" steel ball and attempted to activate the Anderreamer without success. TOH from 10;544' to surface and racked back 18-1/8" x 21" BHA. TIH from surface to 706' with new 18-1/8" x 21" drilling BHA. Activated and functioned Anderreamer at surface.

08/11/2012: TIH to 6;150' with 18-1/8" x 21" RS drilling assembly on 6-5/8" DP. Function tested diverter. Slipped and cut drill line and serviced rig. Function tested BSRs and CSRs. TIH from 6;150' to 10;544' and drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;544' to 11;200'.
"},{"   ":110,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-12","TEXT_REMARK":"08/12/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 11;200' to 12;989'. AROP - 74.5 fph.

08/13/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 12;989' to 14;475'. AROP - 70.7 fph.

08/14/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 14;475' to 16;474'. AROP - 83 fph.

08/15/2012: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 16;474' to 17;141'. Troubleshot downhole problem with loss of pressure and communications with Schlumberger tools. Circulated hole clean. TOH from 17;141' to 10;515'. Worked Anderreamer into 22" casing shoe and pulled to 10;400' with excessive drag. Continued TOH from 10;400' to 6;024'. 
NOTE: Mr. Kevin Corbin received approval from Bobby Nelson for a 24 hr extension on the BOP function test due at midnight on 08/15/12. BOP Function Test will be due by midnight on 08/16/12.

08/16/2012: TOH from 6;024' to surface with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly #2 inspecting BHA. Changed out BHAs and TIH from surface to 10;212' with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly #3. Set DQ wear sleeve in HPWH and function tested diverter and BOPs during trip in hole.

08/17/2012: Finished TIH from 10;212' to 17;010' with 18-1/8" x 21" RS BHA on 6-5/8" DP. Washed and reamed down to TD at 17;141'. Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 17;141' to 17;946'. Initiated kick-off at 17;409'.

08/18/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 17;946' to 19;325' as per directional drilling program.

"},{"   ":111,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-19","TEXT_REMARK":"08/19/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 19;325' to 20;146'. Circulated and reduced MW from 12.5 ppg to 11.8 ppg prior to exiting BOS at 19;902'.

08/20/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 20;146' to 20;186'.

08/21/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 20;186' to 20;252'.

08/22/2012: Directionally drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 20;252' to 20;287'. TOH to 17;144' and pressure tested BOPs as per Sure-Tec IPT testing program. 

08/23/2012: Finished testing BOPs and diverter. TOH from 17;144' to 3;231' with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling BHA and function tested BSRs/CSRs.

08/24/2012: Finished tripping out of hole and changed out 18-1/8" x 21" bottom hole assembly. Began tripping in hole from surface to 13;397' with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling bottom hole assembly and Dril-Quip BOP Test Tool / Dual Cam Tool Assembly. 
Note: Mr. Xianjie Yi of Chevron submitted to Mr. Bobby Nelson of BSEE via email an updated hurricane evacuation procedure for St. Malo PN001 at 11:42 AM on 08/24/2012. Mr. Nelson approved the updated procedure via email at 12:58 PM on 08/24/2012.

08/25/2012: Landed Dril-Quip BOP Test Tool in High Pressure Wellhead Housing wear sleeve and released from the Dual Cam Tool. Pressure tested on top of the BOP Test Tool to 1;000 psi proving it was holding pressure/set in place. Closed the BSRs. Displaced the riser from 11.8 ppg SBM to seawater and tripped out of hole to surface with Dril-Quip Dual Cam running tool. Began rigging up to pull riser and LMRP due to Tropical Storm Isaac.
"},{"   ":112,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-26","TEXT_REMARK":"08/26/2012: Unlatched LMRP from BOP. Moved ~250 feet southeast of well location; released SDC ring and removed the drape hoses. The riser termination and slip joints were picked up and laid out. The rig began pulling marine riser from 6;644' to 3;400'.

08/27/2012: The LMRP was pulled to surface on riser landing the LMRP out on the designated cart. Operations were suspended due to weather. Rig began relocating @ heading 190 @ ~2 knots to avoid Tropical Storm Isaac.

08/28/2012: Operations suspended while waiting on weather from Hurricane Isaac.

08/29/2012: Operations suspended while waiting on weather from Hurricane Isaac.

08/30/2012: Waited on weather. Performed drops inspection and held pre-job safety meeting. Made up riser double and lowered LMRP through the splash zone to 194'. Ran LMRP on riser from 194' to 2;500'.

08/31/2012: Ran LMRP on riser from 2;500' to 6;632' while drifting in due to high current. Tested choke and kill lines halfway and after 5' heavy weight pup joint. Deployed ROV to monitor LMRP. Picked up and installed riser termination and slip joints. Rigged up drape hoses to termination joint. 

09/01/2012: Pressure tested drape hoses and choke; kill; mud boost and rigid conduit lines on the riser. Picked up heavy wall pup and landing joint. Latched the SDC ring and landed out slip joint on SDC ring. Positioned rig over PN001; cleaned wellhead with ROV; latched LMRP to BOP; pressure tested the choke/kill stabs; scoped out slip joint and installed the diverter. Performed Diverter function/flow test. Rigged down riser handling equipment. Displaced kill line and riser from 8.6 ppg sea water to 11.6 ppg SBM.
"},{"   ":113,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-02","TEXT_REMARK":"09/02/2012: TIH with Dual-Cam retrieval tool to above BOPs. Function tested BSRs. Engaged Dual-Cam tool; closed the annular preventer and tested the LMRP connector against the BOP test ram with 11.8 ppg SBM at 250 psi low/ 4;900 psi ligh for 5 minutes each. Pressure tested BSR with 250 psi low/ 2100 psi high for 5 minutes. Function tested the BOPs and performed BOP accumulator draw down test. Pulled out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" bottom hole assembly (BHA) and removed Dual-Cam with BOP test tool. Ran in hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA. 

09/03/2012: Pressure tested the BOP's to 250-psi Low / 8;000-psi High. Performed annular pressure test to 250 psi low / 4;900 psi high for 5 minutes. Function tested diverter and BOPs. Ran in hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA and drilled ahead from 20;287' to 20;338' MD/ 20;225' TVD.

09/04/2012: Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 20;338' to 20;900' MD/ 20;736' TVD with the BHA. 
NOTE: Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) received approval via e-mail on 09/04/2012 at 02:46 PM from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma District BSEE) to extend the 22" casing evaluation for seven(7) days from the due date of Sept. 5 to a new due date of Sept. 12.

09/05/2012: Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 20;900' to 21;910' MD/ 21;643' TVD.

09/06/2012: Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 21;910' to 22;550' MD/ 22;219' TVD.

09/07/2012: Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 22;550' to total depth 23;242' MD/ 22;840' TVD. Began circulating 100 bbl Hi-Vis sweep 13.8 ppg synthetic base mud to clean wellbore. 

09/08/2012: Finished circulating the wellbore clean at total depth 23;242' MD/ 22;840' TVD. Performed a Simulated Influx Test. Circulated two 100 bbl Hi-Vis sweeps off 13.8 ppg synthetic base mud to clean wellbore. Spotted 16.0 ppg pill in rathole. Pulled out of hole with BHA from 23;242' MD to 23;118' MD. Spotted a 1500 bbl of 45-ppb treated 11.8-ppg synthetic base mud pill. 
"},{"   ":114,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-09","TEXT_REMARK":"09/09/2012: Finish spotting the 1500-bbl of 45-ppb "Stress-Shield" treated 11.8-ppg SBM pill in the 21" open hole for running 16" casing. Pull out of the well from 23;118' to surface with the 18-1/8" x 21" Rotary Steerable Drilling BHA. Slip and cut drill line.

09/10/2012: Rigged down the drill pipe running and handling equipment; rigged up the 16" casing handling and running equipment and ran in the well with the 16" casing string from surface to 7;112'.

09/11/2012; Finished running in the well with the 16" casing string from 7;112' to 15;928'; made up the 16" casing hanger and continued to run in the well with the 16" casing on 6-5/8" drill pipe landing string from 15;928' to 17;960'.

09/12/2012: Finished running in the well with the 16" casing on 6-5/8" drill pipe landing string from 17;960' to 23;118'. Rigged up to cement the 16" casing. Circulated and conditioned the 11.8 ppg SBM. Mixed; pumped and started displacing the cement for the 16" casing. 
NOTE: Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) received approval via e-mail on 09/12/2012 at 1:21 PM from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma District BSEE_ to extend the 22" casing evaluation for an additional 48 hrs from the due date of Sept. 12; 2012 to a new due date of Sept. 14; 2012.

09/13/2012: Finished displacing the cement for the 16" casing; set and tested the 16" casing hanger pack off; released the 16" hanger running tool from the 16" casing hanger and pulled out of the well with the 6-5/8" landing string and 16" casing hanger running tool to just above the BOP at 6;800'. Circulated a "Nerf" ball down and out the 6-5/8" landing string; pulled out of the well with the 16" casing hanger running tool on 6-5/8" drill pipe landing string; slip and cut drill line and started performing planned drill floor equipment maintenance.

09/14/2012: Finished performing planned maintenance to the drilling equipment. Performed a pressure test on the 16" casing and Blind Shear Ram to 250/4700 psi with 11.8 ppg SBM. Ran in the well with the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" Rotary Steerable drilling BHA from surface to 17;099'.

09/15/2012: Finished tripping in the well with the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" Rotary Steerable drilling BHA from 17;099' to 22;048' on 6-5/8" FH drill pipe. Pressure tested the BOP with 11.8 ppg SBM to 250 psi/ 4900 psi for annular and 250 psi/ 8000 psi BOP. Washed down to the top of cement in the 16" casing at 22;822'; performed a choke drill with the drill crew and began drilling out the 16" casing shoe track from 22;822' to 22;835'.
"},{"   ":115,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-16","TEXT_REMARK":"09/16/2012: Finished drilling out the 16" casing shoe track from 22;835' to 23;118'; washed down to the bottom of the 18-1/8" rathole at 23;242'; circulated bottoms up; performed a Formation Integrity Test to 13.8 ppg equivalent mud 2eight and drilled ahead from 23;242' to 23;352'. Troubleshoot activating 16.5" reamer.

09/17/2012: Troubleshoot problems with activating the 16-1/2" reamer. Dropped a 2-1/2" ball/dart to activate the dual-ported PBL sub and circulated bottoms up from 23;264'. Pumped a 100-bbl slug and pulled out of the well with the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" Rotary Steerable drilling BHA from 23;264' to surface. Cleaned and cleared the Forward drill floor and serviced the Forward drilling equipment.

09/18/2012: Picked up and ran in the well the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" Rotary Steerable drilling BHA from surface to 975'; activated the 16-1/2" reamer on surface and tripped in the well with the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" Rotary Steerable drilling BHA on 6-5/8" drill pipe from 975' to 23;220'; staged pumps up to 950 gpm; pull tested reamer at casing shoe; took SCRs; washed and reamed to 23;333'.

09/19/2012: Finished washing and reaming to 23;352'. Drilled ahead from 23;352' to 24;210'.

09/20/2012: Drilled ahead to 24;761'. Noticed gain in active system; flow checked well; well flowing; shut well in with a 6.5bbl gain. Obtained stabilized pressures; figured kill weight mud - 12.8 ppg. Began well kill operations using wait and weight method. 2;430 bbls out of 3;816 bbls needed for surface to surface pumped at midnight.

09/21/2012: Continued well kill operations; displaced riser with kill weight fluid; swept gas from stack; monitored well on strip tank; jumped rams and monitoring well on TT at midnight. Well appears to be flowing at 0.2 bbls in 5 min.

09/22/2012: Weighted up active system to 13.0 ppg and circulated out well up both kill and choke lines through both auto chokes at 8.4 bpm monitoring pressures. Flow checked well; well static. Displaced riser with 13.0 ppg mud; swept stack; jump rams and monitor well; open well and monitored; CBU and drilled ahead from 24;761' to 24;840'.
"},{"   ":116,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-23","TEXT_REMARK":"09/23/2012: Drilled from 24;840' to 25;350' TD with 13.3 ppg MW; stopped drilling and weighted up system to 13.4 ppg; performed SIT and CBU; shakers clean. Spotted 20 bbls of 16.0 ppg SBM inside 14.5" rathole; displacing pill with 13.4 ppg Stress Shield SBM.

09/24/2012: Finished spotting Stress Shield SBM in open hole; TOH wet from 25;247' to shoe; checked reamer at shoe; pumped slug and TOH to BOP; pulled wear sleeve; TOH to surface; R/B BHA; clean/clear rig floor.

09/25/2012: Slipped and cut drill line; and changed out encoder and spline on Forward MDDM. R/D drilling elevators and bails. Rigged up Frank's casing equipment. Ran 14"; 115.53 ppf; HPQ-125; SLSF casing from surface to 2;592'. R/D casing equipment and continued TIH from 2;592' to 10;534' with 14" casing on 6-5/8" DP landing string.

09/26/2012: TIH with 14"; 115.53 ppf; HPQ-125; SLSF liner from 10;534' to 25;245'. Staged pumps up to 5.0 bpm with 50% SBM returns. Held PJSM for cementing. R/U and tested cement line. Mixed; pumped and displaced cement as per cementing program. Bumped plug with 1;000 psi above final circulating pressure at 23:00 hrs. Verified floats were holding and dropped VersaFlex ELH setting ball.

Note: Mr. Kevin Corbin (CVX) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) to proceed with cementing operations for the 14" cement job on Sept. 26; 2012; at 15:16 hrs.

09/27/2012: Expanded VersaFlex ELH as per Halliburton procedure. Released running tool from ELH and racked back cement head stand. Pulled and racked two stands of 6-5/8" DP and inserted Nerf ball into drill string. Circulated to flush drill string and condition mud for running 13-3/4" tieback casing. Pressure tested BOPs as per IPT plan.

09/28/2012: Finished pressure and function testing BOP's. Performed positive and negative tests on 16" x 14" casing. Pumped slug and TOH to surface with Halliburton VersaFlex ELH running tool. Function tested diverter and BSR's/CSR's. Pressure tested 16" x 14" casing and BSR's to 250/3050 psi with 13.4ppg SBM. Performed planned rig maintenance.

09/29/2012: Finished planned rig maintenance; slipped and cut drill line; and replaced saver sub on forward MDDM. Rigged up Frank's casing equipment and held PJSM with rig crew and third party personnel. Ran 13-3/4"; 98.6 ppf; HPQ-125; SLSF tie-back casing from surface to 8;351'.
"},{"   ":117,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-30","TEXT_REMARK":"09/30/2012: Ran 13-3/4" casing to 15;637'. R/D Frank's fill-up tool and R/U OES DP flowback tool. Made up DQ 13-3/4" casing hanger assembly. TIH to 22;483' with 13-3/4" casing on 6-5/8" DP landing string. R/D OES DP flowback tool. Made up GSI cement head stand and staged pump up to 5 bpm. TIH and landed out DQ hanger in HPWH. Staged pump up to 6 bpm and circulating one annulus volume.

10/01/2012: Held PJSM; rigged up cement line and cemented 13-3/4" tieback casing as per program. Set 14" casing hanger seal assembly and pressure tested to 7;600 psi. Sheared out running tool and jetted to clean seal assembly and wellhead. Rigged down cement line and Frank's equipment. Pumped slug and TOH with DQ casing hanger running tool. Rigged down Frank's 1250T; 20' bails. Changed out 3-1/2" ID saver sub on Forward MDDM.

10/02/2012: Finished installing knuckle links and drilling bails on Forward MDDM. Serviced rig equipment. Held PJSM with rig crew on handling BHA and tripping operations. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" BHA/ Dril-Quip LIT and performed operations at the HPWH as per DQ procedures. TOH with LIT and verified that the 14" hanger was set in the "normal" position. Made up the lock-down sleeve (LDS) assembly and TIH to top of 14" hanger. Locked down hanger as per DQ procedures.

10/03/2012: Set the Dril-Quip LDS. Pumped 40-bbl; 15.6-ppg slug. TOH with lock-down sleeve running tool from 8;967' to 2;397' (bit depth). Run and set DQ seat protector in HPWH. TOH with running tool. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" BHA to 6;384'. Pressure tested BSR to 250/3050 psi with 13.4 ppg SBM for 5 mins. Function tested BSR/CSR. Slip and cut drill line. TIH from 6;384' to 14;063'. 

10/04/2012: TIH from 14;063' to 17;151'. Made up dual entry test stand; located tool joint on annular and spaced out for testing BOPs. Pressure tested BOPs and related equipment against 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" DP from the Toolpusher's panel on Yellow pod with 13.4 ppg SBM as per the SureTec IPT procedure. All tests were held for 5 minutes except the Lower VBR that failed to test on both the 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" drill pipes. Function tested BOPs and diverter. TIH from 17;419' to 21;573'. Washed to top of cement at 22;060' and drilled cement to 22;220'.

Note: On 10/04/2012 at 14:24 hrs; MR. Xianjie Yi (operations engineer with Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma District BSEE) to continue operations on PN001 with the LVBR taken out of service.

10/05/2012: Drilled cement out of 13-3/4" casing; Washed down in 14" liner to top of float collar at 25;063'. Circulated and conditioned mud to 13.8 ppg in and out. Drilled 14" casing upper float collar to 25;070'.

10/06/2012: Drilled 14" float equipment and drilled out 14" shoe track. Washed and reamed out 14-1/2" rathole. Drilled 10' of new formation with the 12-1/4" BHA. Circulate and condition hole prior to LOT. Performed LOT to 14.9 ppg EMW. Drilled 20' of new hole to 25;380'. Activated reamer and performed overpull test. Drilled 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole to 25;395'.
"},{"   ":118,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-10-07","TEXT_REMARK":"10/07/2012: Drilled 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 25;395' to 26;070' (AROP - 28.1 fph).

10/08/2012: Drilled 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 26;070' to 26;760' (AROP - 28.7 fph). 

10/09/2012: Drilled 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 26;760' to 27;000'. De-activated reamer and continued drilling 12-1/4" hole from 27;000' to 27;515'.

10/10/2012: Drilled 12-1/4" hole from 27;515' to 27;538'. Flow checked well and performed Static Influx Test (SIT). Pumped 60-bbl; 16.3-ppg high viscosity weighted sweep and circulated hole clean. TOH wet for 5 stands; pumped slug and continued TOH with 12-1/4" drilling BHA to 600'.

10/11/2012: TOH from 600' to surface with 12-1/4" drilling assembly. Cleaned rig floor and held PJSM. Slipped and cut drill line and serviced rig. TIH with Baker 12-1/4" x 5-1/4" coring assembly to 19;282'; filling DP every 25 stands. Function tested BOPs and diverter. 

Note: Mr. Kevin Corbin received a 48 hour extension by Bobby Nelson via e-mail on the riser inspection due to the ROV control unit suffering a computer failure. The ROV was returned to service 10/12/2012 and completed the inspection on 10/12/2012. 

10/12/2012: TIH to 27;538' with 12-1/4" x 5-1/4" coring assembly on 6-5/8" DP. Cut 240' of 5-1/4" core from 27;538' to 27;778'. Broke core with 6;000 lbs overpull and flow checked well; well static.

10/13/2012: Pumped out of hole with 12-1/4" x 5-1/4" coring assembly on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP from 27;778' to 27;022'. TOH from 27;022' to 1;760' as per coring program trip plan.
"},{"   ":119,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-10-14","TEXT_REMARK":"10/14/2012: TOH with 12-1/4" x 5-1/4" coring assembly on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP from 1;760' to surface as per coring program trip plan. Recovered core at surface. TIH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly on 5-7/8" DP to 4;424'.

10/15/2012: TIH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly on 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" DP from 4;424' to 27;324' MD.  Function tested BSRs/CSRs prior to crossing stack from Toolpusher's panel on both Blue and Yellow pods. Reamed down from 27;324' MD to 27;778' MD to acquire LWD log data. Drilled 12-1/4" hole from 27;778' MD to 28;055' MD (AROP - 42.6 ft/hr).

10/16/2012: Drilled 12-1/4" hole from 28;055' MD to total well depth of 29;009' MD (AROP - 42.4 ft/hr). Flow check well (well static). Conduct static influx test. Pump a sweep and circulate hole clean.

10/17/2012: Finished circulating hole clean. Flow check well (well static). TOH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly from 29;009' MD to 26;960' MD; reaming through intermittent tight spots. Made wiper trip to bottom at 29;009' MD. Pumped 30 bbls of base oil followed by 75 bbls of 16.3 ppg high viscosity SBM and circulated hole clean. Flow checked well (well static). Spotted 20 bbls 17.0 ppg pad mud on bottom and TOH wet to 26;816' MD.

10/18/2012: TOH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP from 26;816' MD to 17;533' MD. Pressure tested BOP's and associated valves against 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP as per IPT test plan. Test annular to 250/ 4;900 psi and rams and surface components to 8;000 psi. Function tested BOPs and diverter. TOH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" DP from 17;533' MD to 8;767'.

10/19/2012: TOH with 12-1/4" drilling assembly on 5-7/8" DP from 8;767' to surface. Rigged up Schlumberger wireline equipment and log well up with ZAIT/HLDS/QCNT/ECS/CMR+/HNGS/HTGC tool string (Run #1) as per program to 25;300' MD.

10/20/2012: Completed Schlumberger logging run #1 (ZAIT/HLDS/QCNT/ECS/CMR+/HNGS/HTGC) and run #2 (Dual-OBMI/BPIT/PPC/DSI/PPC/HTGC). RIH with logging Run #3 tool string (HTGC/HP-MDT) and obtained pressure at station #1. Repeated the first pressure station until tool string temperature stabilization was obtained.
"},{"   ":120,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-10-21","TEXT_REMARK":"10/21/2012: Continued logging run #3 (HTGC/HP-MDT) obtaining pressure samples as per geologic evaluation program. Monitored well on trip tank; well static.

10/22/2012: Continued with logging run #3 (HTGC/HP-MDT) obtaining pressure and fluid samples as per geologic evaluation program (54 successful pressures taken out of 85 attempts; at that point the pressure probe was not stabilized. Unable to take additional pressure point.) The fluid sample was taken by quick silver probe. 3 fluid samples complete; sample #4 in progress at 24:00 hrs.

10/23/2012: Finished obtaining MDT pressure and fluid samples as per geologic evaluation program. Attempted to utilize PS probe without success. Utilized quick silver probe to obtain pressure samples. Total of 116 attempts with 67 successful with run #3 HTGC/HP-MDT. POOH with run #3 - 300' from surface at midnight. Proper hole filled and well static.

10/24/2012: Lay down wireline run #3 - HTGC/HP-MDT; Changing out cable/drum on wireline unit with 7-52ASUS LT cable - SWL rating 21;500 ftlbs. Function BSR/CSR and diverter; swap out drums on wireline unit. Pick up wireline run #4 - HTGC/MSTC; RIH and set up at 53 rotary sidewall core stations per geological program. POOH with run #4 to 1;000' at midnight.

NOTE: Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) @ 13:12 hrs on 10/24/2012 received written approval via e-mail from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma District BSEE) approving a 48 hour extension for the BOP function test.

10/25/2012: Finished pulling out of hole and lay down wireline run #4. Preliminary result 44 of of 53 core samples recovered. Pick up run #5 HTGC/MSTC; RIH; obtain 57 rotary SWCs as per geological program. POOH; recovered cores; preliminary result 49 out of 57 core samples. Lay down wireline run #5; rig down wireline; began slip and cut drill line ops. Monitor well on trip tank; well static.

10/26/2012: Finished slip and cut ops; performed planned rig maintenance; Rig down drilling equip. Rig up 9-7/8" liner equipment. Run in hole with 9-7/8" 65.11 ppf SLSF Q-125HP liner. Made up 9-7/8" hanger. Run in hole with 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" landing string to 8;923'.

10/27/2012: Continue run in hole with 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" landing string to 29;000'. Made up cement head; circulate SBM. While pumping at 5 bpm( 1500 psi); pump pressure increased to 1;800 psi; hole packing off. Brought pumps down to 2 bpm and pressure increased to 2;200 psi. Started rotating pipe at 20 rpm and stalled out at 30k torque. Brought pumps down and bled off pressure to 600 psi; removed torque from string. Brought pumps up to 1 bpm and rotated pipe at 15 rpm - pipe rotating free. Reciprocated and rotated pipe while staging pumps back up to 5 bpm. After the string was free and hole in good condition; rig up chicksans and cement hose to cement head. Mixed and pumped cement; swapping over to rig pump for displacement at midnight.

"},{"   ":121,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-10-28","TEXT_REMARK":"10/28/2012: Finished displacing cement; floats failed; waited on cement; set 9-7/8" x 14" hanger; checked spaceout for upcoming tieback run; stung out of 9-7/8" liner. Insert nerf ball in landing string. Circulate and condition synthetic base mud (SBM). 

10/29/2012: Continued circulating and conditioning SBM; checked flow; pumped slug. TOH; L/D 9-7/8" running tool. Pressure tested casing and blind shear rams (BSR); function tested BSRs/CSRs; made up 9-7/8" EZSV. Tripped in hole with 9-7/8" EZSV @ 7;445'.

Note: Mr. Xianjie Yi contacted Ms. Casey Kavanaugh at the BSEE Houma District for verbal approval granted to perform steps 1-3 on the submitted Temporary Abandonment APM.

Note: Mr. Xianjie Yi contacted Mr. Paul Nelson from the BSEE to clarify that the 10;100 psi surface equipment test can be performed after the tieback is run and cemented. The test pressure for the next BOP test (which will not include the tieback) can be at the 8000 psi and still be compliant with the approved APD.

10/30/2012: Continued to trip in hole with 9-7/8" EZSV from 7;445' to TOC at 28;555'; attempt to set EZSV; troubleshoot; and determined ESVZ set at 28;555' - discussed with management as well as seeing U tubing hydrostatic from heavier fluid in annulus. Decision made to circulate bottoms up and ensure 14.1 ppg SBM all the way around. Circulating and conditioning wellbore at 00:00 hrs.

10/31/2012: Finished negative testing. Pulled out of hole with EZSV running tool to 6-5/8" test stds; pressure test BOPs per IPT schedule with 14.1 ppg SBM.

11/01/2012: Pulled out of hole with EZSV running tool and laid down. Slipped and cut 149' of drill line; Run in hole with Dril-Quip seat protector retrieving tool from surface to 5;769'.

11/02/2012: Retrieved seat protector; pulled out of hole with Dril-Quip seat protector retrieving tool and change out to Lockdown Sleeve retrieving tool. Ran in hole and retrieved lockdown sleeve. Pulled out of hole and inspected lockdown retrieval tool and noted test sub sleeve did not shift. Rigged up forward rotary to run in hole with 9-7/8" tieback.

Note: On 11/2/2012 at 10:44 AM; Mr. Xianjie Yi notified Mr. Bobby Nelson from Houma District BSEE that we plan to place Top of Cement at ~9;000' opposed to 8;200' that was in the RPD approved 10/02/2012. This change is to satisfy WCD if we have a completion failure and have to sidetrack from the production tieback. The well design will still be sound and the Professional Engineer from PPI stated no re-certification is required.

11/03/2012: Finished rig up to run in hole with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" casing. Run in hole with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" casing tieback from surface to 17;971'; running stands out of derrick and building stands in aft mousehole (SIMOPs). Changed out casing handling equipment to drill pipe handling tools. Picked up 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" Dril-Quip casing hanger and continued to run in hole from 17;971' to 18;356' on 6-5/8" 50# drill pipe.
"},{"   ":122,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-11-04","TEXT_REMARK":"11/04/2012: Continued running in hole and stung seal assembly into PBR. Cemented 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. Set and tested casing hanger to 9;940 psi - good test. 

11/05/2012: Pulled out of hole with Drill-Quip hanger running tool from 6;799' to surface. Picked up CleanWell. Clean out BHA and ran in hole with Dril-Quip Lead Impression tool from surface to 6;884' and take impressions.

Note: Application for Permit to Modify (APM) was approved by Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on November 5; 2012 @ 3:50 pm for the Temporary Abandonment Procedure to run RTTS and abandon the well.

11/06/2012: Finished inspecting lead impression blocks and made no adjustments to Lockdown Sleeve running tool. Picked up Dril-Quip Lockdown Sleeve running tool and run in hole to 6;884' and set lockdown sleeve. Pulled out of hole with Lockdown Sleeve running tool to 4;110'; picked up RTTS and SCIII storm valve and run in hole from 4;110' to 7;483'.

11/07/2012: Set RTTS at 9;500'. Test RTTS and storm valve to 1000 psi for 15 minutes. POOH to ~6;984' and perform negative test; Displaced riser to seawater.

11/08/2012: Rigged up riser handling equipment. Pulled and laid out the diverter. Unlatched the BOP stack from the HPWH and moved the rig 300 feet south of the wellhead. Cleaned the HPWH and confirmed LDS measurements with ROV. 

11/09/2012: Oriented; landed out and latched Subsea production tree on the 18-3/4" High Pressure Wellhead. Tested the subsea production tree - VGX-2 Gasket. Pulled the subsea production tree running string to surface. Pulled riser to 6;344'.

11/10/2012: Finished pulling BOPs on marine riser to surface. Landed BOPs on cart; washed BOP bore; R/D riser handling equipment while transferring BOPs to stored position. Cleaned and cleared rig floor. Begin between well planned maintenance. 
"},{"   ":123,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-11-11","TEXT_REMARK":"11/11/2012: Finished rigging down riser handling equipment; cleaned and cleared rig floor. Begin planned rig maintenance including replacing linear actuator on forward PRS; broke down Aft MDDM inspected; broke down Forward PRS; installed 16 inch isolation valve in shakerhouse.

11/12/2012: Continue with rig maintenance.

11/13/2012: Continue with rig maintenance.

11/14/2012: Continue with rig maintenance.

11/15/2012: Continue with rig maintenance.

11/16/2012: Continue with rig maintenance.

Note: Mr. Kevin Corbin (CVX) received approval from Ms. Casey Kavanaugh (BSEE Houma District) to commence with subsea latch up and BOP test pending further approval of the completion APM.

11/17/2012: Finish planned rig maintenance. Skid BOP to well center; finished hooking up IWOC's hardware onto BOP; splash BOP and began testing riser lines."},{"   ":124,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-11-18","TEXT_REMARK":"11/18/2012: Continue run BOP on marine riser; installed IWOC's guides and tested riser lines to 5;144' per Completion Program.

11/19/2012: Finished running BOP on marine riser. Make up termination/flex joint; installed drape hoses and storm loops; tested lines. Make up slip joint and landing joint; landout BOP; locked connector; performed pull test; completed final adjustments on tensioners.

11/20/2012: Scoped out slip joint. Land out landing joint; performed pressure test on connections. Installed diverter; performed deadman test; rigged down spider/gimbal and riser equipment. Tested UBSRs/connections for deadman test. Energized diverter and flow tested. Function and pressure tested LBSRs via ROV. Rigged up drilling equipment; picked up 5-7/8" 28# CTM drill pipe. Tripped in the hole with Cameron Weight Set Test Tool (WSTT) Assembly above BOPs. 

NOTE: Mr. Miles Sweep (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) for St. Malo PN001 APM Completion Procedure on 11/20/2012 at 3:10 PM to commence with completion up to; but not including; the zone perforation until the commingling permit is approved. 

11/21/2012: Continued to trip in hole with Cameron WSTT assembly above BOPs. Continue to pick up 5-7/8" 23# CTM drill pipe while Oceaneering Intervention Vessel 1 ROV recovered DCL ROV. Received MOC to proceed with testing BOPs before completing first two tests on XT-57 DP. Trip in hole and landed out test plug. Began testing BOP pressure with IPT - 6 out of 15 online tests performed. Completed Accumulator drawdown test. 

11/22/2012: Completed all 15 BOP Pressure tests with IPT. Function tested BOPs and diverter. Trip out of hole with test assembly; lay down test assembly; function tested BSRs. Tripped in hole with HES SSCIII- RTTS retrieval assembly. Displaced well from 8.6 ppg seawater to 14.1 SBM. Installing blanks and securing overboard lines in surface lines.
 
11/23/2012: Trip in hole with HES SSCIII- RTTS overshot retrieval assembly to 9;460'. Circulated at 420 gpm at 9;430' and moved slug to above BOPs. Washed from 9;460' to 9;497'. Latched RTTS and attempted to unseat and circulate without success; drill string appears to be plugged and RTTS will not relax. Waited on Schlumberger and STS personnel to arrive. Rigged SLB wireline with TEAS system; made up gauge run assembly. Tested lubricator and run in hole with e-line. 

11/24/2012: Continued to run in hole with e-line gauge run tools inside drill pipe to obstruction/plug (~15' from bit); logged depth. Tripped out of hole with gauge run and lay down tools. Pick up e-line shot assembly and run in hole to first joint of drill pipe above logged depth. Pressured up drill pipe and shot guns with no pressure drop observed. Began pulling out of hole with e-line shot assembly; recorded 21 shots fired. Lay down tools and attempted to circulate below RTTS; with no success. Pressured up on drill string with no indications of circulation below RTTS. Pulled assembly out of hole and broke out lubricator to pick up e-line shot assembly #2. 
"},{"   ":125,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-11-25","TEXT_REMARK":"11/25/2012: Picked up second drill pipe (DP) punch assembly #2 and ran in hole to 500' above drill collars (DCs) and logged on depth. Pressured up DP to 3;000 psi and fired guns. Tripped out of hole with punch assembly #2. Punch assembly #2 did not fire. Redressed assembly #2 and ran back in the hole to 500' above DCs; pressured up to 2;000 psi and fired guns. Did not see a pressure drop. Tripped out of hole with assembly #2 to surface (21 out of 21 shots fired). Attempted to circulate with no success. Finished checklist for radio silence and picked up punch assembly #3. Waited on weather to clear the area. Finished picking up assembly #3. Run in hole with assembly #3 to 300' below RTTS (9;700') logging on depth of 9;433' at midnight. Planned shot depth was 1st single below RTTS. 

11/26/2012: Continue to run in hole with punch assembly #3 and logged on depth. Once on depth fired guns and then pulled out of hole with punch assembly #3 (9 out of 13 shots fired). Laid down punch assembly #3 and attempted to circulate with no success. Picked up punch assembly #4 and ran in hole with punch assembly #4. Logged on depth and fired guns. Pull out of hole with punch assembly #4 (13 out of 13 shots fired). Laid down TEAS system and lubricator and pulled out of hole with drill string from 13;538' to 13;506'; attempting to break circulation with no success. Begin rigging up TEAS system for wireline ops.

11/27/2012: Finished rigging up TEAS system and lubricator. Laid down 5-7/8" drill pipe while waiting on Schlumberger punch assemblies. Picked up punch assembly #5 and ran in hole to planned shot depth. Fired guns successfully and pulled out of hole with punch assembly #5. Laid down assembly and rigged down TEAS system and wireline. Established circulation at 3 bpm maximum and mitigated pressuring up while pumping out of hole with RTTS and cleanout assembly from 9;325' RTTS depth/ 13;459' bit depth. Monitored active volume while pulling out of the hole.

11/28/2012: Continued to pull out of hole with RTTS to BOPs and monitor well conditions. Continued to pull out of hole in order to inspect BHA. Laid out joints of drill pipe that was shot. Ran in hole with cleanout assembly to 1;000'.

11/29/2012: Continue to run in hole with Well Tech Cleanout assembly from 1;000' with 24;120' with a total of 10 assemblies on clean out in the string. Circulated approximately every 4;000'. Circulating at 00:00 hrs.

11/30/2012: Started drilling out 9-7/8" shoe track at 24;477' and exited cement at 24;852'. Continued washing and reaming down with low ROP from 24;852' to 25;034' while varying parameters to increase ROP in an attempt to free any debris around BHA.

12/01/2012: Continued to wash and ream from 25;373' to the EZSV at 28;553' while continuing to vary parameters in order to increase ROP and free debris from the clean out string. Discussed slow ROP issues with management and the decision was made to pull out of hole with Well Tech Cleanout Assembly. Pulled out of hole from 25;373' to 6;447'.
"},{"   ":126,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-12-02","TEXT_REMARK":"12/02/2012: Pulled out of hole from 6;447' to surface and inspected clean out assembly; observed 1/3 of the 8-1/2" roller cone bit worn away. Picked up new 8-1/2" roller cone bit and ran in hole with the Clean Well BHA assemblies 1 through 10 from surface to 22;335' at 00:00 hrs.

12/03/2012: Wash and ream from 22;335' to 28;514' with clean out assemblies - note string stacking weight intermittently; worked pipe as necessary; then wash and ream down.

12/04/2012: Washed and reamed down with clean out assemblies and tagged EZSV packer at 28;546'. Pumped 16.2 ppg high viscosity sweep and circulated hole clean. Tested 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" casing to 7;600 psi per APM. TOH with clean out assembly on 5-7/8" CTM 57 DP from 28;397' to 21;548'.  TIH from 21;548' to 28;346' picking up riser brush assemblies. Recorded baseline circulating and rotating parameters. Washed down from 28;346' and tagged EZSV at 28;546' with 10 klbs down.

12/05/2012: Circulated and conditioned 14.1 ppg SBM. Flushed and cleaned surface equipment in preparation for displacing SBM to 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Mixed chemical spacers for displacement.

12/06/2012: Cleaned mud system and prepared spacers for displacement to CaBr2. Displaced well from 14.1 ppg SBM to 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Spaced out and began pressure tested BOPs per IPT program. Unable to obtain proper IPT benchmark test at 9;800 psi without exceeding 15k pressure limitation of the BOPs (subsea pressure). Discussed the situation with management. Discontinued the IPT test plan and continued performing tests conventionally; recording pressures on manual chart until straight line tests were achieved.

12/07/2012: Pressure and function test BOPs per APM. Rigged down BOP test line. Attempted to pressure test Baker high pressure debris unit (HPDU) without success; made short trip out of hole from 28;546' to 25;915' and continued pressure testing choke and kill manifold.

12/08/2012: Finished short trip with clean out assemblies. Boosted riser while finishing pressure testing on the choke and kill manifold. Rigged up and reverse circulated 1;570 bbls of CaBr2. Activated the Halliburton Jet Tech tool and jetted the BOP stack and SSPT per Halliburton procedures. Circulated and filtered CaBr2 - 35 NTUs @ 24:00 hrs.
"},{"   ":127,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-12-09","TEXT_REMARK":"12/09/2012: Finished circulating and filtering 14.1 ppg CaBr2 to 26 NTU's and <0.01% solids. TOH from 28;490' to 1;435' with Halliburton 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" casing cleanout assemblies. Function tested BSRs.

12/10/2012: TOH from 1;435' to surface with Halliburton 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" casing cleanout assemblies. Rigged up Schlumberger wireline logging equipment. Completed wireline Run #1 - GR/Gauge Ring/Junk Basket. RIH and begin log up with wireline Run #2 - Isolation Scanner/ CCL/ GR (Run #2) to 23;500'.

12/11/2012: Complete wireline Run #2 with Schlumberger Isolation Scanner/ CCL/ GR tool string. RIH with permanent packer - wireline Run #3 - and set on depth. POOH with running tool to surface. RIH with sump packer - wireline Run #4 - and set on depth. POOH with running tool and tagged up at 24;832' (WLM); attempting to work tool string past 24;832' depth 12 times; tool string become stuck.

12/12/2012: Continued attempting to free wireline tool string without success. Utilized ECRD to disconnect cable from tool. POOH with E-line rope socket/ ECRD tool from 24;832' to surface. R/D wireline; slip and cut drill line; perform rig maintenance. P/U fishing BHA; TIH with fishing assembly to 4;903'.

12/13/2012: Continued tripping in the hole with the 5-3/4" overshot dressed with an 8-1/8" oversize guide and 3-5/8" basket grapple and mill control pack-off from 4;903' to 24;427'. Circulate bottoms up. Continue TIH to above PBR; wash down through PBR - no indication of latching fish. Continue TIH with fishing assembly to 26;532'.

12/14/2012: Continued tripping in the hole with the 5-3/4" overshot with an 8-1/8" oversize guide dressed with 3-5/8" grapple and mill control pack-off from 26;532' to 28;237'. Wash down at 40 spm and engaged fish at 28;328'. POOH with fish from 28;320' to 425'.

Notes:
Chevron received approval report from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) for St. Malo PN001 RPM Completion Procedure on 12/14/2012 at 12:45 PM.

Chevron received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson on 12/14/2012 at 10:17 PM to change BOP test pressures to 8;000 psi from 9;800 psi for the rams and from 4;500 psi to 3;500 psi for the annular. The BOP pressures in eWell were not adjusted down as intended when the RPM was re-submitted; however; the desired pressures were listed in the revised RPM procedure submitted as an attachment.

12/15/2012: Continued POOH with fish from 425' to surface. Recovered 100% fish; L/O fish and fishing BHA. R/U TCP equipment (pressure tested UBSRs and LBSRs offline). P/U TCP BHA assemblies from surface to 1;728'. RIH with TCP assemblies on 5-7/8" DP from 1;728' to 14;762'.
"},{"   ":128,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-12-16","TEXT_REMARK":"12/16/2012: Continued to trip in hole with TCP assembly from 14;762' to 28;351'; land out on sump packer; check measurements; rack back 1 stand and make up control head; rig up surface lines; test lines; space out guns to proper depth; set packer; close annular; establish circulation across control head; fired guns. Established loss rate - 6 bph; began reversing out landing string.

12/17/2012: Finished reversing out gun debris; rig down surface iron and TCP control head; POOH with spent TCP assembly from 28;340' to 9;149' stopping at preplanned depths to monitor loss rate. Closed annular and CBU down drill string up choke and kill lines through poor boy degasser; opened annular and flow checking well at midnight - 3 bbl/hr loss rate.

12/18/2012: Continued to trip out of hole with spent TCP assembly; laid out TCP assembly BHA (lower zone gun package failed to fire); slipped and cut drill line. Made up BOP test assembly and tripped in hole to 997'

12/19/2012: Continued trip in hole from 997' to 7;960' (3 pressure tests performed on choke manifold during TIH). Spaced out on 5-7/8" work string and performed 9 out of 14 BOP tests online. Rigged down surface test assembly and spaced out on 6-5/8" Stim-tech joints; attempted first test on 6-5/8" without success. Test rams appear to be leaking. Continued functioning and attempting to pressure test BOPs on 6-5/8" against test rams.

Note: Mr. Paul Benet (Chevron) received formal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 12/19/2012 at 11:43 AM to change BOP test pressures for the rams from 9;800 psi to 8;000 psi and for the annular from 4;500 psi to 3;500 psi. The BOP pressures in eWell were not adjusted down as intended when the RPM was re-submitted; however; the desired pressures were listed in the revised RPM procedure submitted as an attachment.

12/20/2012: Troubleshoot test rams on 6-5/8" work string; finished testing BOPs on 6-5/8" work string; function tested BOPs on 5-7/8" work string; function tested diverter; performed rig maintenance on Fwd MDDM; and tripped out of hole with BOP test assembly to 2;285'. 

12/21/2012: Continued trip out of hole with BOP test assembly from 2;285' to surface. L/D crossover and mule shoe. Monitoring well on trip tank (1 bbl/hr loss rate sustained over the last 24 hrs.) Performing rig maintenance and general housekeeping while waiting on orders.

12/22/2012: Performed rig maintenance and general housekeeping while waiting on orders. Received permission from CVX management to proceed with operations @ 07:00 hrs. Picked up TCP assembly and tripped in hole with TCP assembly from surface to 13;864'.
"},{"   ":129,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-12-23","TEXT_REMARK":"12/23/2012: Continue TIH with TCP assembly; landout on sump packer; checked measurements; L/O single; M/U control head and spaced out to put guns on depth. R/U surface lines to TCP control head; tested lines; set TCP packer; fired guns; establish loss rate; lined up and reversed out 1-1/2 landing string volume; monitored well (6 bbl/hr loss rate); R/D chicksans and control head. TOH from 28;340' to 28;094'.

12/24/2012: Continued to TOH with spent TCP assembly from 28;094' to 500' below BOPs. Closed annular and circulated bottoms up through choke and kill lines. Cont TOH with spent TCP assembly to 1;335'. Monitored hole loss - 3.5 bbls per hour.

12/25/2012: Finished laying out spent TCP assembly; slipped and cut drill line; rigged up handling tools for 4" Hydril 511 washpipe; picked up/ made up Deburr Assembly and ran in hole to 19;671'.

12/26/2012: Finished running in hole with Deburr Assembly to Top of Perforations - 28;120'. Held PJSM; washed and reamed through perforations; engaged washpipe in sump packer; activated VacTech and circulated bottoms up. Pulled out of hole one stand above sump packer and monitor wellbore - static. Ran in hole and engaged sump packer - no problems. Pulled out of hole from 28;488' to 26;861'.

12/27/2012: Finished testing BOPs on 5-7/8" drill pipe; pressure tested BOPs on 6-5/8" Stim Tech; function BOPs; continued to pull out of hole with DeBurr Assembly from 15;585'.

12/28/2012: Finished pulling out of hole with DeBurr Assembly; hold PJSM and emptied VacTech debris into cuttings box. Slipped and cut 149' drill line; functioned BSRs; rigged up ESTMZ handling tools and ran in hole to 461'.

12/29/2012: Continued to run in hole with GP assembly. Ran lower service tool & washpipe through sump seal extension. Ran GP equipment for Zone 1-3 - 250 psi tested and charted. Ran temporary/fishing washpipe; engaged washpipe below screens; pulled out of hole with temporary washpipe at jt 18.
"},{"   ":130,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-12-30","TEXT_REMARK":"12/30/2012: POOH with temporary washpipe. Test lower zone Gravel Pack assembly and continue to POOH with temporary washpipe. Test run in hole position of Gravel Pack assembly. M/U VCH packer and run in hole with ESTMZ assembly on 5-7/8" CTM-57 drill pipe to 19;230'. Functioned LBSR and UBSR from Driller's panel on Yellow and Blue pods.
 
12/31/2012: RIH ESTMZ assembly on 5-7/8" CTM-57 DP to 28;399'. Set and test VCH packer. Set isolation packers. Perform stripping test on 6-5/8" StimTech joints. Rig up 4" surface iron to frac head and frac manifold - fill and pressure test lines. Functioned diverter on 5-7/8" DP from Driller's panel.

01/01/2013: Perform pickle job on drill pipe and reverse out. Rig up for Zone 1 frac job. Flush and test lines. Pump acid treatment for Zone 1. Perform mini-frac and evaluate results. Pump main frac for Zone 1; no screen out achieved.

01/02/2013: Reverse out proppant and 10.5 ppg NaBr frac fluid left in drill pipe. Isolate Zone 1. Move service tool to Zone 2 and test Gravel Pack assembly to ensure all sleeves are closed. Wait on weather.

01/03/2013: Wait on weather. Monitor wellbore on trip tanks - static. Function tested BOPs from Driller's panel; Yellow pod. Functioned diverter on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel. Forego casing pressure test due today due to approved APM alternative compliance #7. 

01/04/2013: Wait on weather. Rig up frac iron and coflex hose from stimulation boat in preparation for Zone 2 frac job. Flush and test lines. Pump acid treatment for Zone 2. Pump main frac for Zone 2; no screen out achieved. Reverse out proppant and 10.5 ppg NaBr frac fluid left in drill pipe.

01/05/2013: Continue reversing out proppant and 10.5 ppg NaBr frac fluid left in drill pipe after Zone 2 frac job. Isolate Zone 2. Move service tool to Zone 3 and test Gravel Pack assembly to ensure all sleeves are closed. Stand by waiting for stimulation boat to transfer frac fluid and move proppant from lower to upper deck. Rig up frac iron and coflex hose from stimulation boat in preparation for Zone 3 frac job.
"},{"   ":131,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-01-06","TEXT_REMARK":"01/06/2013: Rigged up coflex hose from stimulation boat and frac iron in preparation for Zone 3 frac job. Flushed and pressure tested lines. Pumped acid treatment for Zone 3. Pumped main frac for Zone 3; no screen out achieved. Reversed out excess proppant and 10.5 ppg NaBr frac fluid left in drill pipe. Isolated Zone 3 and rigged down all frac iron. TOH with Halliburton service tool assembly from 20;633' to 19;867'.
 
01/07/2013: TOH with Halliburton ESTMZ service tool assembly. Slippped and cut 149' of drill line. TIH to 948' with Halliburton isolation assemblies for Zones 1 & 2. Functioned LBSR/UBSR from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow and Blue pods.

01/08/2013: TIH with Halliburton isolation assemblies for Zones 1; 2 & 3 to 28;404' - opened 6 isolation sleeves. Monitored for losses - 329 bbls lost before isolation assembly seals were stung into VCH packer seal bore. Functioned LBSR/UBSR from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow and Blue pods.

01/09/2013: Tested FS-1 fluid loss device and seals in VCH packer seal bore to 1;000 psi for 5 min. Dropped 1-7/8" brass ball and pumped ball on seat to de-activate circulation sub. Pressured up in 500 psi increments and released running tool at 2;280 psi. Monitored well on trip tank; well static. TOH with running tool from 27;011' to 16;450'. Began testing BOPs on 28# 5-7/8" DP.

01/10/2013: Pressure tested BOPs on 5-7/8" DP from Driller's panel on Blue pod. 250/ 8;000 psi rams. 250/ 3;500 psi annular. 250/ 10;000 psi surface equipment. Function tested BOPs on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow pod. Functioned diverter on 5-7/8" DP from Driller's panel. TOH with isolation assembly running tool to surface. Slipped and cut drill line. Pressure tested UBSR/ LBSR against FS-1 valve to 250/ 1;000 psi from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow pod. P/U production PBR assembly.

01/11/2013: P/U TNT permanent packer. TIH with TNT permanent packer and production PBR on 5-7/8" DP to 25;926'. Functioned LBSRs/UBSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow and Blue pods.

01/12/2013: Continue TIH with TNT packer and production PBR to 27;026'. Latched into isolation assembly PBR; verified latch with 30k overpull. Tested backside to 1;000 psi and confirmed seal engagement. Pressured up down drill string; staging pressure up to 4;700 psi to set TNT permanent packer. Pressure tested topside of packer to 4;500 psi. Pressure tested below TNT packer to 4;000 psi against FS-1 valve. TOH with TNT packer running tool to 5;442'.
"},{"   ":132,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-01-13","TEXT_REMARK":"01/13/2013: Continue to trip out of hole with TNT packer running tool and 2-7/8" washpipe. Lay down TNT packer running tool. Rig up becket/bails. Lay down 2-7/8" washpipe and sliding sleeve shifter. Rig down becket/bails. Rig down Halliburton equipment from forward rotary. Service rig. Pick up Halliburton CleanWell assemblies and Cameron Bore Protector retrieval running tool BHA. Trip in hole to BOP stack; jet Subsea Production Tree (SSPT); land and latch Bore Protector retrieval running tool into SSPT; function and pressure tested 9-5/8" fixed rams; vented Tubing Hanger Seal Test (THST) valve on tree; pulled SSPT bore protector; jetted tubing hanger profile; boosted riser. Tripped out of hole Bore Protector retrieval running tool to surface. Lay down CleanWell assemblies and rack back Bore Protector retrieval running tool/ bore protector. Slip and cut drill line.
 
01/14/2013: Finished slip and cut ops; rig down 750T equipment; rig down Weatherford tubing equipment. Rig up Schlumberger sheave package and hang in A-frame. Hold pre-job safety meeting. Pick up and trip in hole with upper completion production tubing as per CVX/Superior tubing tally POA.

01/15/2013: Hold pre-job safety meeting with all personnel involved with tubing operations. Rig up and adjusted control arm on Weatherford slips for control lines; repaired forward Pipe Racking System; continued trip in hole with 4-1/2" production tubing from 310' to 9;772'. 

01/16/2013: Run 4-1/2"; 17#; 13 chrome production tubing from 9;772' to 17;302' per CVX pipe tally and POA. Make up Surface Control Subsea Safety Valve (SCSSV) and Chemical Injection Mandrel (CIM) assembly. Terminate and test SCSSV.

01/17/2013: Finished terminating the 1/2" LDHI line to the Downhole Chemical Injection Nipple (DCIN) and tested line to 14;000 psi for 15 min (Good). Installed SCSSV and DCIN control lines in Auto Clamp head. Rig down single joint elevator. Trip in hole with 4-1/2" production tubing out of derrick from 18;175' to 18;407'. Change out Weatherford handling equipment to P/U 6" VIT tubing. Re-dressed Weatherford Top Drive Stand Compensator for 6" tubing. Make up 6" Vam Top Box x 4-1/2" Vam Top Pin crossover to bottom of first single of 6" VIT on aft. Trip in hole with 6" VIT in singles from 18;407' to 19;876' off secondary conveyor per tally.

01/18/2013: Pick up and make up tubing hanger. Troubleshoot pressure anomaly with lower (Asphaltene) chemical injection line. Confirm integrity of Asphaltene line. Begin terminating control lines on tubing hanger.

01/19/2013: Terminate and test control; injection and gauge lines. Release tubing hanger handling tool. Rig down spooler equipment and Weatherford handling equipment. Transfer Subsea Test Tree to forward rotary. Begin making up Subsea Test Tree to Tubing Hanger.
"},{"   ":133,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-01-20","TEXT_REMARK":"01/20/2013: Latched and locked subsea test tree to tubing hanger. Tripped in hole with subsea test tree. Held pre-job safety meeting. Rigged down elevators and bails. Rigged up 22' bails; thread compensator; and weatherford elevators dressed for 7-5/8" landing string. Picked up junk basket and tripped in hole with 7-5/8" landing string.
 
01/21/2013: Tripped in hole with tubing hanger. Broke circulation and confirmed top of PBR (26;726'). Soft land tubing hanger (bottom of tubing @ 26;788'). Stung out of PBR and displaced annulus with 1;100 bbls of 14.1 ppg inhibited packer fluid. Displaced landing string with 525 bbls of 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Installed space out pups and began rigging up compensated coil tubing lifting frame.

01/22/2013: Completed rig up and function tested the compensated coil tubing lifting frame. Completed rig up of lines. Transferred Expro flowhead and made up to landing string. Installed torpedo packers. Landed out tubing hanger. Transferred landing string weight to compensated coil tubing lifting frame. Completed rig up of lines. Began testing tubing hanger as per Cameron procedure. Tested tubing x casing annulus to 5;000 psi down kill line and against 9-5/8" pipe rams for 30 mins.

01/23/2013: Tested lines and subsurface tree to 12.5k psi. Tested subsurface test tree retainer valve; landing string and surface flow tree to 7.5k psi (achieved good test). Opened subsurface test tree retainer valve; tested landing string and production tubing against FS-1 valve to 4;650 psi. Closed SCSSV; bled down to 1k psi and tested for 15 min. Rigged up slickline and lubricator. Tested lubricator to 11k psi. Ran in hole and retrieved isolation sleeve from 6;877'. Prepared to open FS-1 valve. Rigged up check valve in chiksan line.

01/24/2013: Attempted to cycle open FS-1 valve with 3;000 and 4;000 psi with 72 cycles performed without success. Pressure tested subsurface test tree upper ball valve to 12;600 psi using the IWOCS system for 15 minutes. Negative tested Lower ball valve by applying 4;500 psi to tubing string; closing valve; and bleeding off pressure in 1;000 psi increments to 200 psi and monitoring for 15 minutes. Equalized pressure by applying 4;500 psi and opening valve. Bled off pressure to 0 psi. Made up Cameron's GS running/pulling tool string with tubing hanger protection sleeve. Tested Halliburton quick test sub to 11;000 for 5 minutes. Ran in hole with slick line and set sleeve @ 6;877'. Tripped out of hole with Cameron's GS running/pulling tool. Made up bailer assembly. Tested Halliburton Quick test sub to 11;000 for 5 minutes with the cement unit. 

01/25/2013: Ran in hole with Halliburton slick line bailer and tagged FS-1 valve; performed bailing ops and pulled out of hole with a small amount of debris with bailer. Attempted to open FS-1 valve by cycling; had no success. Rigged up SLB E- line and remove Halliburton slick line BOPs. Pumped base oil into landing string to equalize hydrostatic on FS-1 valve and performed pressure cycles on FS-1. FS-1 opened and began to bullhead 310 bbls of base oil. Performed negative pressure test on SCSSV. 

01/26/2013: Rigged up slick line and retrieved tubing hanger protection sleeve. Installed and pressure tested lower and upper crown plugs to 10;240 psi (12;600 psi subsea); charted for 15 minutes.
"},{"   ":134,"WELL_NAME":"PN001","API12":608124005300,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-01-27","TEXT_REMARK":"01/27/2013: Displaced kill line with base oil. Displaced choke line; boost line; and riser annulus to seawater. Flushed SSPT lines with base oil. Perform negative test on SCSSV - successful. Displaced kill line with seawater. Unlatched THRT from tubing hanger. Displaced landing string to seawater. R/D Torpedo Packers and transferred SFT to center mousehole.
 
01/28/2013: R/D CCTLF and associated equipment. TOH from 6;841' to 160' with Expro SSTT and THRT on 7-5/8" landing string.

01/29/2013: Transferred SSTT to center mousehole. R/U riser handling equipment. L/D diverter and heavy wall pup. M/U landing joint to slip joint and locked slip joint. Unlatch BOP/LMRP and moved 200 feet from wellhead at 105 degrees. Began R/D riser jewelry.

01/30/2013: R/D riser jewelry. Pulled BOP stack on marine riser from 6;963' to 2;219' (59 of 88 total joints).

01/31/2013: Pulled marine riser from 2;219' to BOPs. Land out BOPs on cart.

 
"},{"   ":135,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-11-21","TEXT_REMARK":"11/21/2011: [offline] R/U for running 36" casing. RIH 36" casing to 318'. Set 36" in rotary. Jet in BHA assy in 36" casing. Cont'd RIH with 36" Jet In assy from 318' to 763'.

11/22/2011: Cont'd TIH from 763' to to 6;330' and perform baseline pump pressure test. Cont'd RIH with 36" Jet In assy to ML depth; prep for spud; and jet in 36" from 6;887' to 7;205' (LPWH 10' stick up). Allow casing to soak and release from casing. TOH.
"},{"   ":136,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-04-27","TEXT_REMARK":"04/27/2015: Stabbed 26" BHA into 36" housing and washed through 36" to 7;200'. Drilled 26" hole section from 7;200' to 8;482' with seawater and sweeps.

Note: Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to proceed with steps 1-7 (drilling 26" hole section; running and setting surface casing; stump test and splashing BOP) of the submitted RPD while permit review continues.

04/28/2015: Continued to drill 26" hole from 8;482' to 10;456' MD (section TD). Switch from seawater to 10.1 ppg water based mud at 9;300' MD. Pump 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg sweep and circulate the hole clean with 10.1 ppg WBM. 

04/29/2015: Continued to pump 16.0 ppg sweep around with 10.1 ppg WBM. Displace hole to 12.5 ppg WBM in preparation for running casing. POOH with 26" drilling assembly. Once above wellhead; moved vessel to dropped object zone and continue to POOH to surface with drilling assembly. Rigged up 22" casing handling equipment. Begin waiting on weather at 20:00 hrs due to high current.

Note: Mr. Steve Lance (Chevron) submitted 72 hour notification to Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) for the commencement of stump testing operations.

04/30/2015: Continued to wait on weather due to high current.

05/01/2015: Continued to wait on weather due to high current.

05/02/2015: Continued to wait on weather until 11:00 AM. RIH with 22" casing to 3;243'.
"},{"   ":137,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-03","TEXT_REMARK":"05/03/2015: RIH with 22" casing from 3;243' to 3;425'. Ran inner-string inside 22" casing. Made up MRLD and installed landing string handling equipment. Run in on 6-5/8" landing string to 4;335'.

05/04/2015: TIH with 22" casing from 4;335' to 10;406'. Begin cementing 22" casing.

05/05/2015: Continue cementing 22" casing. Pumped 214.5 bbls (1;205 cu ft) of Lead #1(13.6 ppg - Class H); 979 bbls (5;497 cu ft) of Lead #2 (13.8 ppg); and 227 bbls (1;275 cu ft) of Tail (16.4 ppg) cement. Cement in place at 04:00 hrs and floats held. Pulled out hole from 10;076' to 6;585' above wellhead. Moved vessel to safe handling zone. Continue to POOH to surface; laying out the MRLD. Rig down pipe handling equipment and begin between well maintenance.

05/06/2015: Performed between well maintenance workscope.

05/07/2015: Performed between well maintenance workscope.

05/08/2015: Performed between well maintenance workscope.

05/09/2015: Performed between well maintenance workscope."},{"   ":138,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-10","TEXT_REMARK":"05/10/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/12/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/13/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/14/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/15/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/16/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.
"},{"   ":139,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-17","TEXT_REMARK":"05/17/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.  

05/18/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/19/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/20/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/21/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/22/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

05/23/2015: Rig unable to Run BOP due to loop current.

"},{"   ":140,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-24","TEXT_REMARK":"05/24/2015: Waited on loop current. Picked up BOP off of beams and completed break test. Tested all inner valves on BOP and began to run BOP. Riser Gantry Crane developed a leak. Shut down and began repairing leaking hydraulic line on riser gantry crane.

05/25/2015: Ran BOP on marine riser to 3;253'. Tested conduit lines and continued running BOP on marine riser.

05/26/2015: Ran BOP from 3;253' to 6;653'. Test choke; kill; boost and rigid lines. Make up slip joint and install hands free goose neck. Begin pressure testing choke; kill; boost and rigid lines.

05/27/2015: Continue testing choke; kill; boost and rigid lines. Noticed leak on rigid conduit line #1 at hands free goose neck. Attempt to fix issue without success. Waiting on parts to fix hands free goose neck.

05/28/2015: Repair hands free goose neck. Move vessel over PN002. Land BOP on wellhead and latch same. Function CSR and BSR from Yellow Pod; Driller's panel. Close BSR with ROV and perform casing test to 2;770 psi for 30 minutes. Good test.

05/29/2015: Pressure test diverter to 350 psi - good test. Rig down riser handling equipment. Perform diverter flow test port and starboard - good test. Make up BOP test tool and RIH with 6-5/8" drill pipe to 7;631' with 50k down. Perform accumulator draw down test - good test; Initial pressure 5;000 psi; Final pressure 2;680 psi. Begin testing BOP on Driller's panel; Yellow Pod; utilizing IPT version 3.1.7.9. Tested connector to 250/11;600 psi; Annular to 250/6;500 psi; Pipe rams to 250/11;600 psi; BSR to 250/11;600 psi and surface equipment to 250/10;000 psi. 

05/30/2015; Finish pressure testing BOP on Driller's panel; Yellow pod. Perform CSR and BSR function test from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. Function test BOPs from Toolpushers panel; Blue Pod. Function test diverter from Driller's panel - good test. POOH with test assy. Test 22" casing to 2;650 psi for 30 min against BSRs on Driller's panel; Blue Pod - good test. Make up BHA and RIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assy to 2;433'. 
"},{"   ":141,"WELL_NAME":"PN002","API12":608124005400,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-31","TEXT_REMARK":"05/31/2015: Functioned BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod. TIH and set wear sleeve. Continue RIH and displaced well with 11.2 ppg. Performed choke drill; drilled out cement; and circulated well clean for FIT test.

06/01/2015: Performed FIT to 13.0 ppg equivalent (11.2 ppg SBM; 975 psi). Drilled ahead to 12;016' MD.

06/02/2015: Drilled from 12;016' MD to 13;674' MD; weighting up initially to 11.6 ppg and further 12.0 ppg at 13;300' MD. Continued drilling to 14;409' MD.

06/03/2015: Drilled from 14;409' MD to 15;390' MD. Weighted mud up to 12.5 ppg @ 15;390' MD. Continued drilling from 15;390' MD to 16;230' MD. 

Note: Jeff Finley (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that our ROV would be out of service until parts arrive on 06/04/2015 and repairs are made.

06/04/2015: Drilled from 16;230' MD to 18;298' MD with 12.5 ppg MW.

Note: Jeff Finley notified Bobby Nelson by email on 06/04/2015 that the ROV part made it out to the rig today but the Tech did not make the flight. The Tech will arrive on 06/05/2015. The ROV should be operational on 06/05/2015 and we will proceed with the Riser and BOP inspection.

06/05/2015: Drilled from 18;298' MD to 19;518' MD with 12.5 ppg MW. Circulated and jarred pipe free at 19;507' MD. Circulated and washed back to bottom. Drilled from 19;518' MD to 19;735' MD.

06/06/2015: Drilled from 19;735' MD to 19;855' MD. Displace well with 11.8 ppg mud. Commence POOH. Function test Diverter from Toolpusher's panel.
