Displace WBM with SBM and rig down lines and test assembly back to 11.8 ppg SBM. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod and function diverter from Driller's panel. POOH with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly; open PBL sub; wash 16" supplemental adapter profile; POOH to above BOP; and function test CSR and BSR from Driller's panel; Blue pod.

03/16/2013: Continue to POOH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly to surface. Pull BHA wet; inspecting for wash outs. Conduct flow test of reamer with blanked jets. Slip and cut drill line. Conduct planned rig maintenance. Rig up Frank's casing handling equipment and prepare to run in hole with 16" casing.
"},{"   ":208,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-03-17","TEXT_REMARK":"03/17/2013: Finish rig up of Frank's casing handling equipment with casing swage on floor and functioned. Run in hole with 16" casing to above BOP. Function CSRs and BSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Line up BOP for running non-shearable tubulars. Continue running 16" casing to 8;460'.

03/18/2013: Continue to run in hole with 16" casing from 8;460' to 16;056'. 

03/19/2013: Run in hole with 16" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 16;056' to 22;963' MD. Make up cement stand and circulate and condition wellbore; staging pumps up to 12 bpm. Spot 700 bbl LCM pill in landing string and land 16" hanger in SA.

03/20/2013: Finish rig up of cement hose and chicksan iron. Mix and place 1;159 bbls of 13.0 ppg lead cement followed by 268 bbls 16.6 ppg tail cement and displaced with 3;566 bbls of 11.8 ppg SBM with full returns. Set and test 16" Dril-Quip hanger seal assembly. Circulate 1.5 x landing string volume. Pump slug and pull out the hole to 4;408'.

03/21/2013: TOH from 4;408' to 3;052' and perform DROPS Inspection of finger board. TOH from 3;052' to surface and L/D casing hanger running tool. R/D Frank's casing equipment and hold AAR for cement job. Clean rig floor; slip and cut drill line; service MDDM and block dollies; and TIH from surface to 3;728' with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling assy.

Note: RPD was approved with added procedures capturing the running and positive testing of the additional mechanical barrier as well as the negative testing once the 14" liner is set and cemented.

03/22/2013: TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling assembly to 6;482'. Function test BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. Troubleshoot cement unit. Pressure test casing to 5;250 psi for 30 min and BSRs to 250/5;120 psi; 5/5 min; all from the Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. Troubleshoot hydraulic choke. Continue to TIH with drilling assembly to 15;616'. Function test BOPs from the Driller's panel; Yellow pod and function tested Diverter from the Toolpusher's panel. Continue to TIH with drilling assembly to 19;746'.

03/23/2013: TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling assy from 19;746' to 22;055'. Establish SCRs and CLFPs. Perform Choke Drill and continue TIH from 22;055' to 22;625'. Wash from 22;625' to 23;132' and tag cement at 23;132'. Drill cement from 23;132' to 23;169'; drilling out casing shoe track and guide shoe to 23;445'. Increase mud weight from 11.8 ppg to 12.0 ppg while drilling cement. Wash and ream rat hole to 23;548' and drill 10 ft of new formation from 23;548' to 23;558'. Pump sweep and circulate to 500' above BOPs.
"},{"   ":209,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-03-24","TEXT_REMARK":"03/24/2013: Troubleshoot and repair slip joint packer issue. Trip in the hole to 23;353'. Perform 16" casing shoe test; obtaining a 13.72 ppg EMW surface. Wash down from 23;354' to 23;558'. Drill 14-1/2" hole from 23;558' to 23;715'. Activate 16-1/2" Rhino-reamer. Back ream from a bit depth of 23;675' to 23;592'; placing reamer 10' below 16" shoe. Ream back to bottom and drill 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section to 23;736'. 

Note: Jim Burt (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) via after hours voicemail; informing him of a 5 bbl spill of 11.8 ppg SBM into the moonpool due to a mechanical failure.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) to drill the 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section with a 0.4 ppg drilling margin.

03/25/2013: Drilling 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section from 23;736' to 24;580'.

03/26/2013: Drilling 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole section from 24;580' to 25;600'. Weighting up as per schedule to 13.3 ppg.

03/27/2013: Drill from 25;614' to 26;658'. Observed losses at 12-15 bbls/hr. Circulated LCM pill sweeps. 20 bbl/hr losses after LCM sweep at half the drilling rate. 60 bbl/hr losses at drilling flow rate. Drill from 25;658' to 25;667' and circulate LCM sweep. While making a connection; observed 1.7 bbl gain - determined to be ballooning after flow check/swab test. Circulate LCM pill sweeps.

Note: Matthew Albers (CVX) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) to utilize the revised SureTec Software Version 2.4 conditions of approval.

03/28/2013: Circulate LCM sweep at 25;667'. Spot 650 bbls of Tiger Bullet LCM pill in open hole. Pump out of the hole while logging with MWD to 24;563'.

03/29/2013: Pump out of the hole while logging with MWD from 24;563' to 23;514'. R/U OES flow back tool and pump out of the hole from 23;514' to 16;672'. Function BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel; Blue pod. Function test diverter on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) of an 18 hr BSR Function Test extension.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) of a 72 hr BOP Pressure Test extension.

03/30/2013: Pump out of the hole from 16;672' to 9;602'. Continue POOH without pumping from 9;602' to 7;460'. Drop PBL activation ball and wash BOPs and wellhead. Pull out of the hole from 7;460' to 6;532'. Function BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod and rig down OES flow back tool. Slip and cut 149' of drill line. Service MDDM and traveling block assembly. Change out FWD drill line upper guide kite cable and roller.
"},{"   ":210,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-03-31","TEXT_REMARK":"03/31/2013: Continue to change out drill line kite and roller. Pump slug and POOH from 6;532' to surface. Rig up Frank's casing equipment and run 14" liner from surface to 268'.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received approval via email on 03/31/13 from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) for shallow setting of the 14" liner.

04/01/2013: Running 14" liner from 268' to 15;708'.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) on 04/01/13 for a 24 hour BOP Pressure Test extension.

04/02/2013: Run 14" liner to TD at 25;662' MD/ 25;002' TVD and cement 14" liner with zero returns. Pumped total of 971 cu ft of cement.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (CVX) received verbal approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District) for another 24 hour BOP Pressure Test extension on 04/02/13 at 16:13 hrs.

04/03/2013: Set Versaflex Hanger; verify hanger set with 100k overpull and release from same. Rig down lines and Cement Head; pump wiper ball and circulate and condition mud. POOH 5 stands; wait on weather and pressure test BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow pod.

04/04/2013: Pressure Test BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow pod; suspending testing operations as weather squalls pass through. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod.

04/05/2013: POOH with landing string and liner hanger setting tool. Pressure test casing against BSR to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes.

04/06/2013: Function tested BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Finish pressure test casing against BSR to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes. Rig up Schlumberger wireline and ran CBL and USIT log - determined TOC to be at 24;300' MD. Run Fas-drill on E-line; and was unable to get Fas-drill past top of 14" liner. POOH with Fas-drill.
"},{"   ":211,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-04-07","TEXT_REMARK":"04/07/2013: Pull out of the hole with FasDrill on E-line. Inspected FasDrill and 7 slip segments were lost in hole. Slip and cut drill line. Trip in hole with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly to above BOP. 

04/08/2013: Trip in hole with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly; wash through 14" top of liner at 22;833'; then continue to trip in hole to top of cement at ~25;313' MD. Circulate and condition mud and pull out of hole.

04/09/2013: Pull out of hole from with 12-1/4" Cleanout assembly on 6-5/8" drill pipe from 22;896' to surface. Rig up Schlumberger E-line; make up and run in hole with 12" gauge ring and junk basket assembly. Tagged up the assembly and did not go past 24;315'. Pull out of hole with E-line and unable to pull past top of 14" liner.

04/10/2013: Continue to attempt to free gauge ring on Schlumberger E-Line. Burn E-Line at electrical control release device (ECRD); pull out of hole with E-Line. Functioned blind shear rams from Toolpusher's panel on Blue pod. Pick up and run in hole with overshot/grapple fishing assembly on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 7;717'. 

04/11/2013: Continue run in hole with 11-7/8" x 5-3/4" fishing assembly with 3-3/4" grapple and control and engage fish at 22;863'. Confirm fish on with pump out sub; burst disc in pump out sub and pull out of hole with fish to 47'. Functioned BOP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue pod.

04/12/2013: Lay out fish and fishing assembly. Slip and cut drill line. Trip in hole with reverse circulating basket and junk basket assembly from surface to 22;962'. Washed at 14" TOL. 

04/13/2013: Wash down from 25;216' and tag top of cement at 25;449' with 18k. Pull out of hole to surface. Break down reverse circulating sub and junk basket assembly. Make up FasDrill packer on drill pipe.

"},{"   ":212,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-04-14","TEXT_REMARK":"04/14/2013: Run in hole with FasDrill packer on 6-5/8" drill pipe from surface to 25;451' MD. Set FasDrill packer at 25;421' MD. Pressure test packer to 1;500 psi for 15 minutes. Rig down lines; pump slug and pull out of hole.

04/15/2013: Pull out of hole from 25;386' to 8;832'. Pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 13.3 ppg WBM to 250 psi low and 8;000 psi high and annular to 250 psi low and 4;500 psi high with 13.3 ppg MW. All tests utilized IPT software from Driller's panel Blue pod.

04/16/2013: Finish pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 13.3 ppg WBM to 250/8;000 psi on BOP rams and 250/8;000 psi on annular. All tests utilized IPT software from Driller's panel Blue pod. Spot base oil and complete negative test of 1;870 psi on 14" liner top. POOH with MST. Slip and cut drill line. Begin planned Health Checks on MDDM. Function BOP from Driller's panel on Yellow pod. Function Diverter from Toolpusher's panel.

04/17/2013: Finish Health Checks and planned maintenance. R/U Frank's casing handling equipment. RIH with 13-3/4" tieback casing to 10;653'. Function BSR from Driller's panel on Yellow pod prior to crossing the BOP stack.

04/18/2013: Continue TIH with 13-3/4" tieback on 6-5/8" landing string from 10;653' and land out in 18-3/4" wellhead at 7;118'; tieback depth of 22;727' MD. 

04/19/2013: Rig up hydraulic and co-flex hoses to cement head. Land casing hanger in wellhead; maintain 100k of tension on landing string. Mix and pump 1050 cu ft of 14.2 ppg lead and 528 cu ft of 16.6 ppg tail cement slurries; displace same. Top plug did not bump. Check floats; holding; and wait on cement. ETA for cement cure is 14:30 hours on 04/20/13.

04/20/2013: Wait on cement until 14:30 hours. Spot base oil in kill line and riser/BOP. Make multiple attempts to set and test Drill-Quip seal assembly with no success. Begin u-tube base oil out of kill line and riser/BOP. 
"},{"   ":213,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-04-21","TEXT_REMARK":"04/21/2013: U-tube base fluid out of riser and choke/kill/boost lines. Boost riser volume; 13.3 ppg returns. Flow check well; static. POOH with Drill-Quip casing hanger running tool. Begin TIH with Drill-Quip flush/mill assembly.

04/22/2013: Finish TIH with Drill-Quip flush-mill assembly. Circulate and condition mud. Flow check well - static. Complete flush-mill operation and POOH. TIH with seal setting assembly. Spot base fluid in riser and set seal assembly. Pressure up 4;280 psi and engage seal assembly in hanger; pressure test seal assembly 10;000 psi surface pressure. Displace base oil out of hole with 13.3 ppg SBM. Shear out of Drill-Quip running tool; and pressure test seals to 8;000 psi for 5 min. Begin POOH with seal setting assembly.

04/23/2013: TOH with Drill-Quip seal assembly running tool; slip and cut drill line; service rig and perform planned maintenance. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" BHA. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod. Function test Diverter from Driller's panel. Function BOP from Driller's panel on Blue pod.

Note: Mr. James Richard and Clinton Campo (BSEE Houma District Inspectors) arrived on board at 12:32 hours. Inspectors reviewed IADC reports and BOP test charts and procedures. Inspectors departed rig at 15:00 hours.

04/24/2013: TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" drilling assembly and Drill-Quip MPT with wear sleeve to 12;457' bit depth. Set wear sleeve at 7;117'. Flow check well - static. POOH with Drill-Quip MPT from 12;457' to 6;409' and lay out. Pressure test BSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod using 13.3 ppg SBM to 250/3;300 psi for 5 minutes each on chart. Establish operating parameters of Smith XC Reamer. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow pod. Perform planned maintenance. TIH with 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" drilling assembly from 6;409' to 21;240'. Change out slip joint air packer inserts. 

Note: Chevron received written approval to modify the RPD from Bryan Domangue (BSEE Houma District) for setting the 14" liner 398' TVD higher than original plan.

04/25/2013: Record SCRs and CLFP; TIH to 21;508'; wash to TOC at 22;361'. Drill 13-3/4" tieback cement and float equipment from 22;361' to 22;722'. Wash and ream 22;722' to 22;770'. Drill cement from 22;770' to 22;830'. Wash through 14" liner top at 22;833 and continue wash down to 22;975'. Pump weighted sweep; circulate and condition hole.

04/26/2013: Circulate weighted sweep out of hole at 22;975'. TIH and tag FasDrill packer at 25;414'. Perform choke drill. Pressure test 14" x 13-3/4" casing to 3;300 psi for 30 minutes. Clear condensation from emergency generator switchboard. Drill FasDrill packer; cement and float equipment from 25;414' to 25;591'.

04/27/2013: Drill cement and 14" shoe at 25;622'. Clean out rathole to 25;667'. Drill 10' new formation to 25;677' MD. Sweep hole with high viscosity weighted sweep. Pump sweep to 500' above BOP. Perform FIT to 14.79 ppg EMW surface. Drill 12-1/4" hole to 25;789'. Pull back to 25;772' and activate Rhino reamer. Ream 10' and perform push/pull test 15k. Ream back to bottom at 25;789' with reamer arms open. Drill 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 25;789' to 25;880'.
	"},{"   ":214,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-04-28","TEXT_REMARK":"04/28/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" x 13-1/2" hole from 25;880' to 26;805'. Close Rhino XC Reamer per Schlumberger procedure. Drill 12-1/4" hole from 26;805' to 26;903'.

04/29/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 26;903' to 27;391'. Flow check well and well was static. Sweep hole with 100 bbls 16.0 ppg Hi-Vis weighted sweep. Flow check well and well was static. TOH for BOP test from 27;391' to 15;894'.

04/30/2013: TOH from 15;894' to 13;357'. Function test diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Displace choke line; kill line; and BOP to 14.1 ppg WBM. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Pressure test BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 14.1 ppg WBM to 250 psi low and 8;000 psi high. Pressure test Annular to 250 psi low and 4250 psi high. All tests utilized IPT software from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod.

05/01/2013: Continue test BOP on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe with 14.1 ppg WBM to 250/8;000 psi. Displace 14.1 WBM from choke line; kill line and BOP with 14.1 SBM. TOH from 13;050' to 6;538'. Perform flow check below BOP and well was static. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. Slip and cut drill line and service MDDM. TIH from 6;538' to 22;443'.

05/02/2013: TIH with drilling assembly from 22;443' to 27;157'. Wash from 27;157' to bottom at 27;391'. Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 27;391' to 28;014'.

05/03/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 28;014' to 28;980'.

05/04/2013: Drilling 12-1/4" hole from 28;980' to 29;325'. Pump 14.1 ppg Hi-Vis sweep and circulate out. Flow check well and well was static. Conduct static influx test. Pump 100 bbls 16.0 ppg weighted Hi-Vis sweep and circulate out. Weight up to 14.2 ppg and circulate due to increase in gas from static influx test.
"},{"   ":215,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-05-05","TEXT_REMARK":"05/05/2013: Circulate and raise mud weight from 14.1 ppg to 14.2 ppg. Flow check well and well was static. TOH from 29;325' to 28;045' with wet pipe to confirm correct displacement. Pump slug and TOH to 12;423'. Flow check well and well was static. Function diverter from Driller's panel. Function BOP from Toolpusher's panel; Blue pod. TOH from 12;423' to 1;618'.

05/06/2013: TOH with drilling assembly. Hand off BHA to AFT rotary. Function test BSRs and CSRs. Rig up Schlumberger wireline and pick up run #1; ZAIT/HLDS/QCNT/ECS/HNGS/CMR. RIH and log per program.

05/07/2013: POOH with wireline run #1. Change out wireline spool. RIH with wireline run #2; NGI/XPT. Troubleshoot communication issues with NGI/XPT tool. POOH with wireline run #2. Lay out NGI tool and RIH with reconfigured wireline run #2 XPT. Begin taking pressure readings with XPT.

05/08/2013: Complete 5 pressure collections with Schlumberger XPT wireline assembly. XPT tool failure. POOH with XPT assembly. Lay out same and RIH with re-run of HLDS/QCN (Neutron-Density) wireline assembly. Complete Neutron-Density wireline run. RIH with re-run XPT assembly.

05/09/2013: Perform start up diagnostics of Schlumberger XPT wireline assembly. Take pressure samples 6-73 of 125.

05/10/2013: Finish taking pressure samples 74-125 of 125. POOH with XPT on Schlumberger wireline. Lay out XPT and P/U MDT wireline assembly. RIH with MDT.

Note: Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) received written approval via email for a 72 hour extension on the BOP and Diverter function tests from Bobby Nelson (BSEE Houma District).

05/11/2013: POOH with MDT due to failed communication. Troubleshoot assembly and RIH with same. Take samples 1; 2; and 3 of 6 totals. Begin pressure sample #4 of 6.
"},{"   ":216,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-05-12","TEXT_REMARK":"05/12/2013: Complete taking pressure samples; currently 4 of 6 and POOH with the MDT wireline assembly. Function test BSRs/CSRs from the Driller's Panel on the Blue Pod. Lay down MDT and pick up the MSCT rotary sidewall coring assembly and change out the wireline spool for the MSCT run. RIH with the wireline MSCT assembly to 12;000'.

05/13/2013: RIH with Schlumberger wireline coring assembly and complete the depth correlation logs. Complete collection of cores 1-35 of 50. 

NOTE: On 05/13/2013; Bobby Nelson (BSEE) granted Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) a 72 hour extension for the BOP pressure test.

05/14/2013: Finish taking core samples; 35 of 50; and POOH with coring assembly. Rig down the wireline equipment and slip and cut drill line. R/U casing handling equipment and begin to RIH with 9-7/8" liner to 2;055'.

05/15/2013: Continue running in the hole with 9-7/8" liner from 2;055' to 4;058'; pick up the liner hanger; and continue running in to 25;625'. Function BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's Panel Yellow pod before crossing the stack; and function BOPs from the Driller's Panel Yellow pod; and function Diverter from the Toolpusher's Panel after the liner hanger was below the stack. ROV function lower pipe ram with hot stab.

05/16/2013: Continue to TIH with 9-7/8" liner from 25;625' to 29;298'. Make up cement head and yield ball through Allamon diverter tools. Wash down with 9-7/8" liner from 29;298' to 29;325' and tag bottom with 30k. P/U to liner setting depth at 29;320' MD/ 28;363' TVD. Begin circulating and conditioning the wellbore in preparation for cementing operations and observe an 8 bbl gain at the pits and shut-in well. Monitor SICP/SIDPP. Attempt to bleed off pressure incrementally to determine if gain was formation ballooning (45 bbls injected @ higher pump rate). No success as pressure returned after each bleed. Attempted to circulate influx out of wellbore with annular shut-in unsuccessfully. Unable to maintain constant drill pipe pressure without losing returns. Decision was made to proceed with pumping cement with annular closed bull-heading cement slurry down the drill pipe. Pump 112 bbls of 15.4 ppg spacer followed by 175 bbls of 16.6 ppg tail cement slurry. Begin displacing cement with rig pumps with 14.2 ppg SBM; annular closed and monitoring pressure on choke line as static line.

05/17/2013: Finish displacement of cement slurry with rig pumps. Pumped max displacement of 1;013 bbls without bumping plug. Bleed back 6.75 bbls to cement unit and observe floats holding. Wait on cement for 24 hrs prior to setting Versa-flex liner.

05/18/2013: Set and expand the Versa-flex liner hanger and circulate surface to surface volume through power choke with Annular closed. Sweep BOP stack via base oil placement in Kill line and allow fluid to U-tube after opening Annular. Begin flushing down Choke line and up Kill line through power choke.

NOTE: On 05/18/2013; Bobby Nelson (BSDEE) granted Gabriel Barragan (Chevron) written approval via email for a 48 hour extension on the BOP pressure test and to forgo the cement evaluation log on the 9-7/8" liner until completions.
"},{"   ":217,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-05-19","TEXT_REMARK":"05/19/2013: Completed flushing the choke and kill lines. Took 100 kips overpull to ensure hanger was set. Released Versa-Flex liner hanger setting tool from 25;213' and pulled out of hole to surface. Laid out Versa-Flex liner hanger setting tool. Pressure tested 9-7/8" liner to 1700 psi for 30 minutes and pressure tested blind shear rams to 250 psi low/1;700 psi for 5 minutes each. 

05/20/2013: Slip and cut drill line. RIH with the EZSV packer from surface to 12;280'. Closed annular and displaced the BOP stack from 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud to 14.2 ppg water based mud. Pressure tested BOP rams and associated valves at 250 psi low and at 8;000 psi high on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel Blue pod. Pressure tested annular bag and associated valves at 250 psi low and at 4;250 psi high on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe. 

05/21/2013: Completed BOP testing on the rams; annular bag and associated valves on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel Blue pod. Tripped in hole with the EZSV packer from 12;102' to 29;109'. Set the EZSV packer with top located at 29;091'. Closed annular bag and pressured tested backside to 1;700 psi and held test for 15 minutes with no pressure observed in drill pipe. Stung out of EZSV packer and circulated bottoms up.
	
05/22/2013: Continued to circulate bottoms up. Performed a negative test on the 9-7/8" liner top with 6.6 ppg base oil to riser margin with differential of 2300 psi. Displaced drill pipe from base oil to 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud. Performed flow check on trip tanks and well remained static. Functioned the BOPs from the Driller's panel from the Blue pod. Pumped slug and tripped out of hole with the EZSV running tool.

05/23/2013: Continued to trip out of hole with the EZSV packer running tool from 12;229' to surface. Performed planned maintenance. Make up and tripped in hole with Dril-Quip multi-purpose tool to retrieve wear bushing assembly. Retrieved the wear bushing and tripped out of hole.

05/24/2013: Tripped out of hole with wear bushing on Dril-Quip multi-purpose tool. Slip and cut drill line on forward side of rig floor. Rigged up casing handling tools and equipment to run 10-3/4" tieback. Picked up seal stem assembly. Function tested blind shear rams and casing shear rams from Driller's panel Yellow pod. Ran tieback from surface to 9;650'.

05/25/2013: Continued to run 10-3/4" tieback from 9;650' to 18;114'. Rigged down casing handling equipment and rigged up drill pipe handling tools. Ran the 10-3/4" tieback on 6-5/8" 50# landing string from 18;244' to 25;195'. Rigged down the OES flow back tool and made up the GSI cement stand. Broke circulation and established returns. Slacked off and soft land hanger in wellhead; seal stem depth 25;242'. Tested seals in polished bore receptacle to 1300 psi for 5 min.
"},{"   ":218,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-05-26","TEXT_REMARK":"05/26/2013: Rigged GSI cement head and slacked off stem seals into the polished bore receptacle and the hanger in order to confirm space out. Pulled out of polished bore receptacle and pumped lead cement of 3;639 cu ft and tail cement of 831 cu ft. Displaced cement with 8;647 cu ft 14.2 ppg synthetic based mud. There was no indication of bumping the plug. Stung into the lower polished bore receptacle and landed the hanger in the wellhead. Bled off pressure on the drill pipe and confirmed that the floats were holding. Released the running tool as per Dril-Quip procedure. Attempted to set and test the seal assembly; no test. Rigged down the cement hose/lines and pulled the running tool above the blowout preventer. Broke down the cement head and transferred the cement head to the aft side of the rig floor. Rigged down Frank's casing handling equipment. Rigged up the drilling bails and the BX elevators. Tripped out of hole with the hanger running tool.

05/27/2013: Tripped out of hole with the hanger running tool and transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Picked up the diverter sub and tripped in hole to 7;891' (mill/flush tool depth of 7;056'). Milled and flushed the hanger profile as per Dril-Quip procedure to 7;120'. Pumped a slug and tripped out of hole with mill and flush tool to be transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Make up SART with secondary seal assembly and tripped in hole to 7;902' (seal assembly depth at 7;062'). Landed running tool and tested to 9;600 psi for 5 min; good test. Tripped out of hole with SART to 2;568'. Held after action review with drilling crew "F" on running/cementing 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. 

05/28/2013: Held after action review with crew "A" on running/cementing 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. Tripped out of hole with Dril-Quip SART and transferred to aft side of the rig floor. Cleaned the rig floor and serviced the rig. Tripped in hole with the Dril-Quip lead impression tool. Landed the lead impression tool in the wellhead and obtained a lead impression of high pressure wellhead housing lockdown profile. Tripped out of hole with Dril-Quip lead impression tool and transferred to the aft side of the rig floor. Made up the Dril-Quip LDS tool and tripped in hole. Made up a side entry stand and rigged up a cement hose and chicksans. Landed Dril-Quip LDS on shoulder profile of 10-3/4" casing hanger. Closed annular and pressured up backside to 1;000 psi for 5 min to confirm land out.  
	
05/29/2013: Pressure tested lockdown sleeve to 9;600 psi for 5 min; good test. TOH with LDS running tool to 8;867'. Function tested BOP on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow pod. Function tested the diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Continued TOH with LDS running tool and transfer to aft side of the rig floor. Continued to trip out of hole with 5-7/8" drill pipe and diverter sub to surface. Conducted an after action review on LIT and LDS runs. Slip and cut of 149' of drill line. Pressure tested the 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" tieback casing to 7600 psi for 30 minutes; good test. Function tested the blind shear rams and the casing shear rams from the Driller's panel; Blue pod. Picked up the EZSV and tripped in hole on 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" drill pipe to 8;124'. Made up the side entry sub stand and lowered the EZSV to a setting depth of 8;134'. Washed down the setting area from 8;145' to 8;130'.

05/30/2013: Set and tested the EZSV at 8;134' as per the Halliburton procedure. Tested EZSV to 1;000 psi for 15 min; good test. Mixed and pumped 25 bbls of 16.6 ppg and balanced plug 300' above the EZSV. Pulled back to 7;332' (approximately 500' above top of cement plug) and pumped a 6" nerf ball through the drill pipe. Picked up a side entry stand; perform negative test pumping 6.6 ppg base oil down drill pipe to 100 ft in excess of riser margin (2;250 psi); good test. Reversed out base oil and pulled to 7;210' and displaced the BOP and riser to seawater and spotted 8.6 ppg suspension fluid from 100' below high pressure wellhead to 7;117'. Tripped out of hole with the EZSV running tool from 7;210' to 4;156'. 

05/31/2013: TOH with the EZSV running. Rigged down the drilling bails from the MDDM and RU the MDDM to pull the riser. RU the riser gimble; the spider and the torque wrenches. Pulled and laid out the diverter. Picked up the landing joint to land and lock the slip joint in place. Unlatched from the BOP at 16:41 hrs. Pulled and transferred the riser weight to the MDDM. Moved 50' northwest of PS001 location. Split the SDC ring in moon pool and pulled and laid out the landing joint and 16' of a heavy wall pup. Rigged down the storm loops in the moon pool and pulled to the termination joints and rigged down the drape hoses. Pulled and laid out the slip joint.

06/01/2013: Pulled the riser termination joint/pup joint and laid out. Pulled the riser/blowout preventer from 6;869' to 1;544'.
"},{"   ":219,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2013-06-02","TEXT_REMARK":"06/02/2013: Continue pull riser/BOP from 1;544' to surface. Land BOP on beams and skid to BOP set back. Rig down riser handling equipment. Splash SSPT and run to 6;700'. Move rig from 500' NNW safe zone to 100' N of PS001. ROV pull trash cap; inspect and clean gasket profile. 

06/03/2013: Run SSPT on drill pipe. Land on PS001 HPWH. Confirm orientation at 182.3 deg. Lock connector and test gasket seal to 13;264 psi; good test. Run tree debris cap on subsea winch and deploy with ROV. ROV perform end of well bottom survey. Recover COMPATTs. 
"},{"   ":220,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-11-13","TEXT_REMARK":"11/13/2014: Moved rig over wellhead. Landed and latched BOP to SPPT at 05:40 hrs. ROV verified latch indicator. Performed pull and latch test; laid out landing joint; installed diverter; and performed ERA offset test - good tests. ROV performed function test - closed lower BSR with 17-H hot stab; 7 min 18 sec to close. Pressure tested lower BSR; 10-3/4" casing; and connector to 1;300 psi with 8.6 ppg SW for 5 min - good test. Performed deadman test subsea per TOI procedure. Confirmed activation of upper BSR by testing to 1;300 psi for 5 min - good test. 

11/14/2014: Waited on weather. R/D riser running equipment. R/U drill pipe handling equipment. Prepared to RIH with BOP testing assembly. Pressure tested choke manifold and associated valves to 250/11;300 psi for 5 minutes each using 8.6 ppg SW as per APM - good tests. 

11/15/2014: TIH with 8-1/2" Cleanout & BHA Testing Assembly from surface to 7;343'. Tagged at 7;343' and POOH to surface. TIH with BHA Testing Assembly from surface to 7;313'. Performed Accumulator draw down test per TOI procedure. Initial surface accumulator pressure 5;000 psi (4;967 psi subsea accumulator pressure). Final surface accumulator pressure 2;643 psi (4;911 psi subsea accumulator pressure). Time to recharge system 3 min 9 sec - good test. Dropped Dual Cam dart. Landed Boll Weevil Test Tool at 7;313' bit depth; closed annular and performed 5 min test using 8.6 ppg seawater to 2;000 psi to confirm test tool on seat - good test. Closed middle pipe rams and released from Dual Cam. 
"},{"   ":221,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-11-16","TEXT_REMARK":"11/16/2014: Pressure tested LBSRs/UBSRs and connector to 250/11;300 psi - good tests. Latched into Dual Cam and performed BOP pressure test on 5-7/8" 34# DP to 250/11;300 psi against rams and 250/8;000 psi against annular. Performed function test of BOPs and diverter - all good tests. TOH with Boll Weevil Test Assembly from 7;234' to surface. Performed function test of UBSRs/LBSRs - good test. P/U and TIH with 8-1/2" Cleanout Assembly to 7;205'. 

11/17/2014: TIH with 8-1/2" Cleanout Assembly from 7;205' to 7;340'. Displaced well from 8.6 ppg SW to 14.1 ppg SBM. TOH from 7;340' to 6;934' above BOP stack and waited on weather. Troubleshot ground fault on Yellow Pod Sem B. Swapped to Sem A; ground fault cleared and confirmed 100% functionality of the BOP/LMRP. TIH; washing and reaming cement from 7;330' to 7;882'. 
 
11/18/2014: Washed and reamed with 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA from 7;882' to 7;943'; tagged hard cement. Drilled cement from 7;943' to 8;123' and tagged EZSV. Drilled EZSV from 8;123' to 8;126'; adjusting parameters as needed. Performed choke drill. TIH with the 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA from 8;126' to 8;326'. Washed and reamed from 8;326' to 8;730'. TIH from 8;730' to 8;926'. 

11/19/2014: TIH with 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA on 5-7/8" DP from 8;926' to 15;996'. Tagged with 24 klbs down on obstruction between 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" casing cross over (thought to be remnants from EZSV set at 8;123'). Washed and reamed with 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA from 15;996' to 15;997'. POOH with the 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA due to lack of progress on drilling up EZSV. Continue TOH with the 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA from 15;997' to 8;153'.

11/20/2014: TOH with the 8-1/2" Cleanout BHA on 5-7/8" DP from 8;153' to surface. Functioned BSRs from Driller's Panel. TIH with 8-1/2" Milling Assembly on 5-7/8" DP from surface to 15;997'. Milled on the EZSV at 15;997'.

Note: On 11/20/2014 at 14:56 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the DCL acoustic doppler current profiler (ADCP) was not communicating and that notification would be given when it was functioning again.

11/21/2014: Milled with 8-1/2" Piranha Mill BHA on obstruction at 15;997' (10-3/4" x 9-7/8" cross over at 15;999'). Decision made to POOH due to ROP. Circulate and condition mud. TOH with 8-1/2" Piranha Mill BHA from 15;997' to surface. R/U wireline equipment.

11/22/2014: P/U and RIH with 8" Fishing magnet toolstring on wireline. Performed 3 runs with the 8" Fishing Magnet on Wireline. Landed out on top of fish at 15;997' each time. Collected 3.8 lbs of metal on run #1; 3.9 lbs of metal on run #2; 4.9 lbs of metal on run #3. Total metal recovered for 3 runs = 12.6 lbs. 

"},{"   ":222,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-11-23","TEXT_REMARK":"11/23/2014: Performed two wireline runs (#4 and #5) with 8" Fishing Magnet to top of fish at 15;997'. Collected 3.1 lbs of metal on run #4; and 3.4 lbs of metal on run #5. Total metal recovered for five runs = 19.1 lbs. P/U 8" Reverse Circulating BHA and TIH from surface to 7;020'. Washed BOP stack from 7;020' to 7;155'; pumped 75 bbl sweep and circulated to surface. TIH from 7;155' to 8;509'. Performed BOP and Diverter function tests - good test. TIH from 8;509' to 9;863'. Note: MODU ESD System was placed in active mode as of 20:00 hrs.

11/24/2014: TIH with 8" Reverse Circulating Basket BHA on 5-7/8" DP from 9;863' to 15;859'. Dropped 1-3/4" Activation Ball and continued to TIH from 15;859' to 15;997' and tagged top of fish (TOF). Staged up pumps and rotated while setting down weight to wash TOF. P/U off bottom and back reamed up to 15;951'. POOH to surface with 8" Reverse Circulating BHA on 5-7/8" DP - no debris observed in basket. R/U SLB wireline; and performed 8" Fishing magnet BHA run #6 to 15;999' and POOH to surface. Recovered 2 lbs of shavings on magnet. P/U and TIH with the 8-1/2" Bladed Junk Mill BHA on 5-7/8" DP from surface to 521'.
 
11/25/2014: TIH from 521' to 15;823' with 8-1/2" Bladed Junk Mill assembly on 5-7/8" drill pipe. Washed down from 15;823' to TOF at 15;997'. Milled from 15;997' and worked through the fish at 15;998'. TIH from 15;998' to 20;834'. Circulated and conditioned mud due to barite sag. Observed drag while TIH from 20;834' to 22;002'. Washed down from 22;002' to 22;011' and tagged obstruction. Washed and reamed. Observed string to be pushing obstruction ahead to 22;054'.

11/26/2014: Washed and reamed with 8-1/2" Bladed Junk Mill assembly from 22;054' to obstruction at 22;183' and continued to 22;200'. Broke through the obstruction at 22;200' and continued washing and reaming. Tagged TOC with 25k at 24;563'. Washed and reamed cement from 24;563' to 24;594'. Pumped sweep and circulated wellbore clean. Spaced out and located annular with tool joint in preparation for non-BSEE casing test.

11/27/2014: Schlumberger performed non-BSEE casing pressure test to 7;600 psi for 15 minutes using 14.1 ppg SBM - good test. TOH with the 8-1/2" Bladed Mill assembly on 5-7/8" drill pipe from 24;594' to surface. Made up Cleanout assembly #2 and TIH from surface to 7;791' at midnight.

11/28/2014: Continued to TIH with 8-1/2" Cleanout assembly #2 on 5-7/8" drill pipe from 7;791' to 20;364'. Washed and reamed from 20;364' to 21;312' and TIH from 21;312' to 24;594'. Washed and reamed cement from 24;594' to 24;755'.

11/29/2014: Drilled hard cement from 24;755' and tagged the top of the orifice collar at 25;056'. Drilled the orifice collar from 25;056' to 25;058. Continued drilling hard cement from 25;058' to 25;246'. Washed and reamed Cleanout assemblies 1; 2 & 3 through tieback gap and cleaned out with junk baskets from 25;246' to 25;376'. Circulated wellbore clean. TIH from 25;376' to 25;591' and observed drag. Washed and reamed down from 25;591' to 25;620'.
"},{"   ":223,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-11-30","TEXT_REMARK":"11/30/2014: Washed and reamed from 25;620' to 29;072'; tagging EZSV to verify depth. Cleaned packer setting depth; pumped sweep; and circulated the hole clean. TOH from 29;072' to 24;002' and began testing BOPs on 5-7/8" DP to 250/8;000 psi from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod and performed diverter function test from the Driller's panel - good test. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and drill.

12/01/2014: Completed pressure testing BOPs on 5-7/8" DP to 250/8;000 psi from the Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. Performed BOP function test on 5-7/8" DP from Driller's panel on Blue Pod - good test. TOH from 24;022' to 7;791' and flow check well at 7;791' - well static. TOH from 7;791' to surface. Performed diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel - good test.

12/02/2014: RIH from surface to 29;075' on wireline and tagged the EZSV. Logged from 29;075' to 25;800' with gamma ray and TOH from 25;800' to surface. Laid out gamma ray tool and made up the isolation scanner for cement evaluation. RIH with wireline from surface to 20;000'.

12/03/2014; Logged from 20;000' to 29;060' with isolation scanner and logged up to 9;500'. RIH on wireline with isolation scanner to 11;600'.

Note: On 12/03/2014 @ 13:30 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to revise the bridge plug setting depth to ~29;070'.

12/04/2014: Logged from 11;600' to 10;225' with isolation scanner and TOH from 10;225' to surface. Functioned the UBSRs/LBSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod. Picked up and RIH from surface to 29;075' with the plugged permanent packer on wireline. P/U from 29;075' to 29;060' and set packer. TOH from 29;060' to surface. Pressure tested casing to 7;600 psi for 30 minutes against packer and UBSRs - good test.

12/05/2014: Performed UBSR/LBSR pressure test to 250/1;000 psi for 5 minutes each from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. Performed USBR/LBSR function test from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. TIH from surface to 28;358' with displacement assembly on 5-7/8" TFM drill pipe.

12/06/2014: TIH from 28;358' to 28;783' with displacement assembly on 5-7/8" DP. Washed down from 28;783' and tagged at 29;060'. Circulated and conditioned the 14.1 ppg SBM for displacement. Began displacing wellbore from 14.1 ppg SBM to 14.1 ppg CaBr2.
"},{"   ":224,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-12-07","TEXT_REMARK":"12/07/2014: Finished displacing the wellbore from 14.1 ppg SBM to 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Picked up and positioned the drill string at hang-off depth of 28;844'. Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and drill.

12/08/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. Function tested BOPs on 5-7/8" DP from Driller's panel on Blue Pod and Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. Function tested diverter from Driller's panel - good test. 

12/09/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. 

Note: On 12/09/2014 @ 13:03 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to extend the BSR function until 12/19/2014 or first trip out of hole; whichever comes first.

12/10/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. 

Note: On 12/10/2014 at 16:24 hrs; Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the acoustic doppler current profiler (ADCP) was properly functioning and updating to the NOAA website.

12/11/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. 

12/12/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. 

12/13/2014: Continued cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on rig. 
"},{"   ":225,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-12-14","TEXT_REMARK":"12/14/2014: Finished cleaning and inspecting fluid lines on port side. Flushed and verified all pumps and lines. Pulled out of hole with displacement assembly from 28;899' to 22;031' to inspect displacement tools. Fine metal shavings and dirty (mud) was recovered from tools. A decision was made to swap out assemblies for new ones. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and Drill.

12/15/2014: Trip in hole from 22;031' to 29;031' with displacement assembly; reverse circulated 1.5x system volume; and performed BOP jetting. POOH to 28;578'; spaced out on 6-5/8" joints. Performed Diverter function test and attempted BOP pressure test on 6-5/8" from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Unable to achieve high pressure test on choke line. Began troubleshooting steps to determine leak path.

12/16/2014: Continue troubleshooting the source of the leak; and narrowed the leak path down to the choke line. ROV located a leak in the choke line coflex hose. Pulled out of hole from 28;578' to 21;941'. Note: Performed MODU ESD Drill

12/17/2014: Continued pulling out of hole from 21;941' to surface with displacement assembly. Tools were observed with no mud residue on surfaces. Performed BSR function test from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Trip in hole with RTTS/displacement assembly from surface to 7;179'. 

12/18/2014: Continue to trip in hole with RTTS/displacement assembly from 7;179' to 12;972'. Set RTTS at 7;600' with top of fish at 7;582'. Performed positive test to 1;000 psi - good test. Pumped 163 bbls of 6.6 ppg base oil down DP to 2;385 psi differential. Bleed down to 2;265. Performed negative test to 2;265 psi (seawater gradient to RTTS + 50 psi SF) - good test. Displaced well to seawater. Place XCD pill on top of RTTS. POOH with RTTS overshot from 7;582' to surface. 

12/19/2014: Latched diverter running tool and pulled and laid out diverter. Picked up riser landing joint and made it up to slip joint. Unlatched LMRP. Moved from WR 678 #PS001 to DOZ. Laid out riser landing joint. P/U to position goosenecks in moonpool and began removing coflex choke line. Replaced coflex choke line. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and Test.

12/20/2014: Performed line test on coflex choke hose to 250/15;000 psi. Connected new coflex choke hose to gooseneck and performed integrity pressure test to 12;000 psi. Performed 5 minute straight line test on choke and kill lines against test valves on LMRP to 250/11;300 psi and boost line to 5;000 psi. Moved rig from DOZ to WR 678 #PS001 and latched to BOP. Verified no pressure under BSRs by monitoring on strip tank up kill line. P/U and installed diverter and energized slip joint seals. DPO performed ERA offset test. Trip in hole with RTTS overshot on 5-7/8" DP from surface to 5;583'. Performed diverter line flow test from Driller's panel through port and starboard lines. Offline: Began testing choke manifold and associated valves to 250/11;300 psi with 8.6 ppg seawater for 5 min each using IPT SureTec v3.1. 
"},{"   ":226,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-12-21","TEXT_REMARK":"12/21/2014: Finished pressure testing BOPs (17 of 17 tests completed). Function tested diverter from Driller's panel. Function tested BOPs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod and Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Displaced kill; choke; and boost line from 8.6 ppg seawater to 14.1 ppg CaBr2.

Note: On 12/21/2014 @ 13:28 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to resume permitted operations following successful BOP test.

12/22/2014: Displaced choke manifold; choke; kill and boost lines with 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Began displacing riser and well above RTTS at 7;600' down drill string with 14.1 ppg CaBr2 per procedure. Washed down from 7;578' to 7;592' with RTTS overshot. Latched into and retrieved RTTS. POOH from 12;972' to 5;363' with RTTS overshot assembly and Displacement assemblies. Function tested UBSRs/LBSRs from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Pressure tested HPDU unit to 250/7;000 psi using 14.1 ppg CaBR2 with cement unit. TIH with Displacement assemblies on 5-7/8" DP from 5;363' to 16;574'.

12/23/2014: TIH from 16;574' to 29;057' with Displacement assemblies #1-4 on 5-7/8" drill pipe. Circulated and conditioned the 14.1 ppg CaBr2 to required specifications (NTUs - 15; 0% solids); POOH with Displacement assemblies #1-4 on 5-7/8" DP from 29;057' to 15;490'.

12/24/2014; Continued POOH to surface with Displacement assemblies #1-4 and laid down assemblies. R/U E-line equip; M/U sump packer to E-line. Run and set sump packer (top at 28;753'); correlate to open hole log; POOH with E-line from 28;753' to 8;500'.

Note: On 12/25/2014 at 13:39 hrs; Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email of additional communication issues with Yellow Pod SEM A. We will continue to evaluate/troubleshoot SEM A which may include powering down the SEM. Please note that while operating on the Yellow Pod; we are utilizing Yellow Pod SEM B; and Blue Pod SEM A & B are 100% fully functional.

12/25/2014: Finished POOH from 8;500' to surface with Resolve tool on wireline. Laid out Resolve tool BHA and rigged down wireline equipment. Functioned tested LBSRs and UBSRs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Pressure tested UBSRs; LBSRs to 250/1;000 psi for 5 min. each and casing to 7;600 psi for 30 min. - good tests. Made up and TIH with TCP gun assembly on 5-7/8" DP to 10;500'.

12/26/2014: Continued TIH with TCP gun assembly on 5-7/8" DP from 10;500' to 28;755' DPM (drill pipe measurement) and landed out on sump packer. R/U surface lines to firing head and tested lines. Set TCP packer on depth. Fired TCP guns on depth with shots from 28;738' MD to 27;495' MD (DPM). Established loss rate of 17 bph. Began reversing out 1.5 drill string volumes. 

12/27/2014: Reversed out 1.5 DP volumes. Monitored well on trip tank with fluid loss rate to the formation at 4.75 bph. Rigged down iron from the firing head stand. Unseated the TCP packer and removed the firing head stand. POOH from 27;491' to 9;431' with spent TCP assembly. Stopped and monitored the well; losing at ~4.8 bph. Closed annular with BHA two stands below BOP and began circulating surface to surface down drill string up choke and kill to clear any trapped gun gas from TCP assembly. 
"},{"   ":227,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-12-28","TEXT_REMARK":"12/28/2014: Continued circulating with the annular closed to remove potential trapped gas from spent TCP guns - no gas observed. Opened annular and monitored the well with 14.1 ppg CaBr2 losses to the formation at a rate of 3.6 bph. POOH to surface. Picked up deburr assemblies and TIH to 7;155'. Function tested BOPs on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel on Blue Pod and Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. Function tested the diverter from Toolpusher's panel - good test. Function tested UBSRs/LBSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod - good test. Lost 14.1 ppg CaBr to the formation at 3.6 bph. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and drill.

12/29/2014: TIH with deburr assemblies and tagged sump packer at 28;755'. Lost 14.1 ppg CaBr to the formation at 4.8 bph.

12/30/2014: TOH with deburr assemblies to surface. Function tested BOPs on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod and Driller's panel on Blue Pod - good test. Function tested diverter from Driller's panel - good test. Lost 14.1 ppg CaBr to the formation at 3.8 bph.

12/31/2014: Changed out the primary MDDM power service loop on MDDM. Lost 14.1 ppg CaBr to the formation at 3.6 bph.

01/01/2015: Completed service loop repair. Made up gravel pack assembly in forward rotary - bottom of assembly at 1;485'. Function tested UBSRs/LBSRs from Toolpusher's panel on BluePpod - good test.

01/02/2015: Completed service loop repair. Made up gravel pack assembly in forward rotary - bottom of assembly at 1;485'. Function tested UBSRs/LBSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod - good test.

01/03/2015: TIH from 1;485' to 6;627' with the gravel pack on 5-7/8" TFM drill pipe. Monitored the well on trip tank prior to crossing the BOP stack with non-shearables with CaBr2 losses to the formation at 2.5 bph. TIH from 6;627' to 24;548' with the Halliburton GP Assembly on 5-7/8" TFM drill pipe. Lost 14.1 ppg CaBr to the formation at 2.5 bph.
"},{"   ":228,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-01-04","TEXT_REMARK":"01/04/2015: Continued to TIH with gravel pack assembly from 24;548' to 28;838'. Set the VCH Packer from 27;377' to 27;385'. Pressure tested VCH packer from backside with 1;500 psi - good test. Set isolation packers on gravel pack and R/U frac head. Pumped 70 bbls of pickle to clean pipe prior to frac job. Note: Performed MODU ESD Lamp Test and drill.

01/05/2015: Completed reversing out pickle from drill string. Waited on weather. 

01/06/2015; Waited on weather. R/U frac iron and frac hose; tested the same. Pumped acid job and spotted on Zone 1 perforations (28;587' - 28;738'). Performed frac job on Zone 1. Screened out and reversed out proppant with 14.1 CaBr.

01/07/2015: Continued reversing out proppant. Closed MCS & FCS in Zone 1 with a loss rate of 0 bph observed. Closed the annular and pressure tested the MCS/FCS to 500 psi using the cement unit to confirm sleeves were closed - good test. TOH with the HES service tool on 5-7/8" DP from 28;838' to 28;612'. Waited on weather. 

01/08/2015: Waited on weather. R/U frac iron and frac hose; tested the same. 

01/09/2015: Pumped acid job and spotted on Zone 2 perforations (28;314' - 28;465'). Performed frac job on Zone 2. Screened out and reversed out proppant with 14.1 CaBr. Closed MCS & FCS in Zone 2 with a loss rate of 8 bph observed. Troubleshoot BOP Blue Pod surface controls. POOH from 28;612' to 28;115'. 

01/10/2015: R/U frac iron and frac hose; tested the same. Pumped acid job and spotted on Zone 3 perforations (27;856' - 28;007'). Performed frac job on Zone 3. Reversed out excess proppant with 14.1 ppg CaBr. POOH from 28;115' to 27;799'. 
"},{"   ":229,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-01-11","TEXT_REMARK":"01/11/2015: Waited on weather. Picked up 72' with service tool to cycle the MCS sleeve. Located WD position and placed the service tool in the reverse position. Rigged up 4" Supreme Iron. Monitored the well; loss rate 7 bph.

01/12/2015: Pressure tested frac lines; coflex hose; and set pop-offs. Pumped acid job and spotted on Zone 4 perforations (27;495' to 27;646'). Performed frac job on Zone 4. Monitored the well; losses noted at 4 bph. POOH with service tool from 27;754' to 27;257'.

Note: On 01/12/2015 @ 11:08 hrs; Mr. Kevin Corbin (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to delay BOP testing following completion of Step 19 of Section 1.2 of the APM by 48 hours to allow for isolation of losses.

01/13/2015: TOH with service tool on 5-7/8" DP from 27;257' to 2;839'. Performed Diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel (43 seconds to close). Continued to TOH with service tool on 5-7/8" DP from 2;839' to surface and L/D same. Total losses over 24 hours; 66 bbls.

01/14/2015: Functioned BSRs from Drillers panel; Blue Pod. TIH with Isolation and FS-1 ball valve assembly from 1;567' to 9;962' with 5-7/8" DP.

01/15/2015: TIH with Isolation and FS-1 ball valve assembly on 5-7/8" DP from 9;962' to 28;828'. Opened sleeves across zones 1-4 and latched up to VCH profile at 28;828' with 30 klbs down. Total losses while opening sleeves; 320 bbls. Tested VCH Seals and FS-1 valve to 1;000 psi. Spotted 50 bbls of inhibited packer fluid at Isolation Assy. Pressured up down the DP to 2;500 psi and released from Isolation Assy. Tagged the top of the PBR with the No-Go to confirm setting depth (27;283' DPM). TOH with PO running tool from 27;292' to 24;964' to test BOPs on 5-7/8" 34# test stands. Performed BOP function test from Driller's panel on Blue Pod.

01/16/2015: Pressure tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod; with annular and associated valves to 250/4;200 psi; VBRs and associated valves to 250/8;000 psi; service equipment and associated valves to 250/9;800 psi - good tests. TOH with PO running tool on 5-7/8" DP from 24;964' to 11;259'.

01/17/2015: TOH with PO running tool on 5-7/8" DP from 11;259' to surface. TIH with TNT permanent packer assembly on 5-7/8" DP from surface to 2;639'.
"},{"   ":230,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-01-18","TEXT_REMARK":"01/18/2015: TIH from 2;639' to 27;244' with packer assembly on 5-7/8" DP. Sting into PBR and landed out at 27;297'. Set and tested packer to 4;000 psi for 30 minutes (good test). TOH with packer setting tool on 5-7/8" DP from 26;976' to 25;488'.

01/19/2015: TOH from 25;488' to 23;320' with setting tool. Function test BOP (Driller's panel; Blue Pod; and Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod) and Diverter (Driller's Panel); tests successful. Continue to TOH from 23;320' to surface. Function (Driller's panel; Blue Pod) and pressure test (Driller's panel; Yellow Pod) BSRs to 250/1;000 psi - good test. Picked up and TIH with bore protector assembly. Landed bore protector and pressure test to 2;000 psi for 5 minutes - good test. Pressure test 9-5/8" fixed rams to 250/8;000 psi; charted for 5 minutes; good test. POOH with bore protector to 7;310' (bullnose depth). Functioned; flushed and displaced SSPT; TCV1; and THST lines with 35 gallons of methanol. Circulated bottoms up; ensuring methanol completely displaced from wellbore. 

01/20/2015: Continued circulating the Transaqua/methanol flush from the riser. TOH from 7;310' to surface with the bore protector assembly on 5-7/8" DP. TIH with lower/upper seal assemblies. M/U the Chemical Injection Mandrels and Downhole Pressure Gauge (CIMs/DHPG) and TIH to 306'. RU control line sheave package.

Note: On 01/20/2015 @ 8:57 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) of BOP fluid weep at the Yellow Pod. Installed the flying lead and confirmed UIKV close functionality with no visible weep at the Yellow POD wedge.

Note: On 01/20/2015 @ 10:27 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson to extend casing test by 72 hours to allow for running of completion equipment.

01/21/2015: Continued to hang sheave package. Tested CIMs and DHPTG. RIH with 4-1/2" tubing string from 306' to 4;963'.

01/22/2015: TIH with lower completion assembly from 4;963' to 17;534'. MU SCSSV assembly and began to terminate control lines.

01/23/2015: Finished terminating control lines on SCSSV. Tested lines to 10k psi - good test. Slacked off and terminated control lines on LDHI-CIM and tested control lines to 14 kpsi - good test. TIH with lower completion assembly from 17;534' to 19;237'.

01/24/2015: TIH with lower completion assembly from 19;237' to 19;926'. Made up the tubing hanger and waited on weather. Terminated control lines and tested SCSSV to 15;000 psi - good test. M/U TEC gauge line fitting to begin testing. 
"},{"   ":231,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-01-25","TEXT_REMARK":"01/25/2015: Finished pressure testing TEC gauge line fitting - good test. Conducted test on DHPTGs - good test. Function tested SCSSV on both ports. Pressure tested SCSSV both ports to 10;000 psi/ 10 min - good test. Secured control lines and landed tubing hanger in split bushings. RU landing string handling equipment. Transferred land and lock to forward rotary. Latched land and lock to tubing hanger. Pressure tested control line stabs 10;000 psi/ 10 min - good test. Lowered tubing hanger below rotary and M/U jewelry to first landing string stand. TIH to 20;387' with 7-5/8" landing string.

01/26/2015: Finish TIH with landing string from 20;387' to 26;925'; Rigged down landing string handling equipment and R/U pipe handling equipment. M/U land out stand and S/O to engage PBR. Configured SSPT and slack off to confirm soft landing with 45 klbs down; 150 psi on Land & Lock at 27;050'. Note 59' of seals engaged on soft land. P/U above PBR and pumped 1;107 bbls of packer fluid. Displaced string volume. Slack off with landing string and set string in slips in preparation of P/U Compensated Coil Tubing Lift Frame (CCTLF).

01/27/2015: R/D handling equipment. Changed out nitrogen lines for CCTLF. R/U to pick up CCTLF. Waited on new elevators. Installed elevators and picked up CCTLF.

Note: On 01/27/2015 @ 8:01 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to extend the casing test by a further 24 hours.

01/28/2015: Rigged up the CCTLF and performed startup checks. Rigged up bails and elevators to the bottom of the CCTLF; and laid out handling assembly. Rigged up slings to transfer SFT (Surface Flow Tree) from center mousehole to CCTLF. Troubleshoot and flushed hydraulic system on CCTLF.

Note: On 01/28/2015 @ 14:21 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson that once tubing hanger was landed; as per APM; no additional casing tests would be needed.

01/29/2015: Rigged up auxiliary HPU for CCTLF. Transferred SFT from center mousehole to CCTLF. Made up SFT to landing string. Installed torpedo packers. Landed and locked tubing hanger. Rigged up lines to SFT and test production equipment. Begin testing tubing hanger.

Note: On 01/29/2015 @ 13:56 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson; stating "no issue regarding the delay of casing testing until the point of landing the tubing hanger."

01/30/2015: Finished testing the tubing hanger. Pressure tested the SFT; landing string; and tubing - good test. Performed negative test on the SCSSV with 5;000 psi differential pressure - all tests good. Rigged up slickline equipment.

Note: On 01/30/2015 at 09:10 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson to continue with well operations per APM to suspend the well with the control system for energizing the flowline seals in block position. The integrity of the diverter system and full functionality of the diverter is still operational.

01/31/2015: Tested lubricator to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. Retrieved Isolation Sleeve with slickline. Laid out Isolation Sleeve. Made up Lower Crown Plug. Displaced landing string/kill line with 6.6 ppg base oil. Tested lubricator. RIH and set Lower Crown Plug. Pressure tested Lower Crown Plug to 10;400 psi from above for 15 minutes - test good. Pressure tested below Lower Crown Plug to 8;300 psi/ 15 minutes - test good. Pumped 13 fluid loss valve opening pressure cycles.
"},{"   ":232,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-02-01","TEXT_REMARK":"02/01/2015: Finished cycling fluid loss valve open. Bullheaded 50 bbls of base oil down kill line across SSPT and down the tubing. Closed SCSSV and Production Master Valve (PMV). Pumped 10 gal methanol through XT. Rigged up Upper Crown Plug (UCP) on slickline. RIH and installed UCP in setting profile. POOH with slickline. Tested top of UCP to 10;400 psi/ 15 minutes - good test. Tested between UCP and Lower Crown Plug (LCP) to 13;000 psi with Installation/Work Over Control System (IWOCS) - good test. Rigged down slickline equipment. Put trip tank online and observed lower diverter seal not holding. Inserted packing material between diverter and housing to form a seal.

02/02/2015: Attempted to repair leaking flowline seals on the diverter with no success. Scoped in and locked Compensated Coil Tubing Lift Frame (CCTLF) and engaged active heave. Closed annular and unlatched Tubing Hanger Running Tool (THRT). Displaced 6.6 ppg base oil out of landing string with 14.1 ppg CaBr2 by pumping down choke line and up landing string. Opened annular and pulled THRT above BOP. Wait on weather.

Note: On 02/02/2015 @ 10:09 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that Chevron plans to pull the diverter; repair; test and continue with well suspension.
 
02/03/2015: Wait on weather. Removed torpedo packers. Picked up to clear land and lock tool from BOP. Rigged down surface lines and broke out SFT from landing string. Transferred SFT to center mousehole. Rig down dolly; nitrogen/hydraulic hoses and electric line from CCTLF. Lay out CCTLF as per Transocean procedure. Transfer SFT to AFT rotary; rig up landing string handling equipment. Lay out SFT.

02/04/2015: Rigged up landing string handling equipment. POOH with landing string; removing cross coupling clamps. Filled up down boost line every 5 stands; keeping fluid level in riser ~10' below flow line.

Note: On 02/04/2015 @ 15:29 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received written approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to forgo further BOP testing/functioning due to well barriers currently in place.

02/05/2015: Continued POOH to surface with landing string and land and lock tool. Transferred land and lock to Aft rotary. Rigged down landing string handling equipment. Note: Functioned Upper and Lower Blind Shear rams on Yellow pod from Toolpusher's panel - good test. P/U diverter running tool; latched onto diverter and pulled same. Landed diverter out on gimbal. Rigged down diverter and transferred to main deck. P/U and installed new diverter. Function tested diverter. Tested flowline seals to 400 psi - good test. Began displacing riser with seawater.

02/06/2015: Finish displacing riser to seawater. Bled tubing x casing annulus to SW hydrostatic. Performed negative test on SCSSV - good test. Displaced choke and kill lines to seawater. R/U riser handling equipment; laid down diverter; and P/U landing joint. Recovered IWOCS Umbilical Termination Assembly (UTA). 

02/07/2015: Scoped in slip joint and lock. Unlatched BOP. Moved rig to DOZ ~1;000' from well. Tested choke and kill lines to 15;000 psi - good test. Removed SDC ring and secured in moonpool. Laid down landing joint and slip joint. Removed drape hoses and laid down termination joint. Began pulling LMRP/BOP on marine riser.
"},{"   ":233,"WELL_NAME":"PS001","API12":608124005700,"WAR_START_DT":"2018-10-28","TEXT_REMARK":"10/28/18   Rigged up temporary filters and pump spread. Pressure tested temporary equipment to 11;300 PSI. Shut-in well. Opened downhole chemical injection valve. Pumped Xylene pre-soak. Pumped Methanol buffer. Pumped umbilical volume of organic acid.

10/29/18   Stopped pumping and secured well for xylene soak period. Pumped acid package into well.

10/30/18   Pumped remainder of acid package into well. While pumping; cycled well open and closed to lift acid up well-bore. Pumped umbilical volume of preservation fluid to displace acid. Stopped for acid soak period.

10/31/18   Stopped for acid soak period and performed offline pump maintenance. Cleaned-up well to production facility. Pumped preservation fluid over-flush at max rate to displace any remaining acid from umbilical. Final Report.


"},{"   ":234,"WELL_NAME":"PS002","API12":608124011400,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-12-16","TEXT_REMARK":"Note: On 12/13/2016 at 10:01 hrs; Mr. Shane Young (Chevron) provided Mr. Josh Ladner and Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email with a 72-hour notice to begin BOP stump testing. Testing is scheduled to begin on December 16; 2016; utilizing IPT testing.

Note: On 12/14/2016; a clear bottom survey was performed by the ROV from Juan-C. Also; conducted pre-spud with Drill Crew A.

Note: On 12/15/2016; conducted pre-spud with Drill Crew F.

12/16/2016: Make up (M/U) and run in hole (RIH) with 36" conductor casing. M/U and run 26" jetting assembly inside of 36" conductor casing. M/U Cam Actuated Drill Ahead (CADA) tool to BHA and lowered into the low pressure wellhead housing (LPWH). RIH with 36" conductor casing with 26" jetting assembly and CADA tool from surface to 2;022' in 8.6 ppg seawater.

Note: On 12/16/2016 at 15:13 hrs; Mr. Ian Nott (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Justin Ledet (BSEE) to proceed with the procedure through step 8; BOP latch-up.

12/17/2016: Continue RIH with 36" conductor casing with 26" jetting assembly and CADA tool from 2;022' to 6;577'. Transit rig to well center and contine RIH from 6;577' to 7;140' in 8.6 ppg seawater. Begin jetting from 7;140' to 7;453'; placing shoe at 7;452' MD/TVD. Allow 36" conductor to soak for 3 hours and perform slump test with 215 klbs down; confirmed no movement. Release from CADA tool and begin drilling 26" hole section from 7;453' to 7;653'.
"},{"   ":235,"WELL_NAME":"PS002","API12":608124011400,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-12-18","TEXT_REMARK":"12/18/2016: Drill 26" hole section with jetting BHA from 7;643' MD to 8;313' MD. Displace well from 8.6 ppg seawater to 11.0 ppg pump and dump (PAD) mud. Trip out of hole (TOH) with 26" jetting BHA from 8;313' MD to 6;845' MD. Retrieve cam actuated drill ahead (CADA) tool and continue TOH from 6;842' MD to surface with 26" jetting BHA. Trip in hole (TIH) with 26" directional BHA from surface to 523' MD.

12/19/2016: TIH with 26" directional BHA from 523' MD to 6;770' MD. Stab 26" bit into low pressure wellhead (LPWH) at 7;130' MD and continue TIH to 7;452' MD. Displace drill string volume from 8.6 ppg seawater to 10.1 MD ppg PAD mud. TIH with 26" directional BHA from 7;452' MD to 8;313' MD. Encountered WB_Flt_5 at 7;987' MD/TVD (estimated). Drill 26" hole section from 8;313' MD to 9;200' MD. 
  
12/20/2016: Drill 26" hole section from 9;200' MD to 10;026' MD with 10.1 ppg PAD mud.  

12/21/2016: Drill 26" hole section from 10;026' MD to section total depth (TD) of 10;560' MD/TVD with 10.1 ppg PAD mud. TOH with 26" directional BHA from 10;560' MD to 10;518' MD. Displace wellbore from 10.1 ppg PAD mud to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continue TOH with 26" directional BHA from 10;500' MD to 6;904' MD on main rotary. Move vessel to dropped object zone (DOZ). Pick up (P/U) 22" casing on auxillary rotary and TIH from surface to 1;578' MD. 

12/22/2016: RIH with 22" x 23" casing from 1;578' MD to 3;314' MD. Make up (M/U) high pressure wellhead (HPWH) and TIH from 3;314' MD to 3;385' MD. Run 5-7/8" inner string from surface to 3;164' MD. M/U mechanical rigid lockdown (MRLD) tool and TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 3;314' MD to 5;914' MD. 

12/23/2016: TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string to 7;125' MD. Stab 22" casing shoe into LPWH and slack off to 7;155' MD. Displace landing string; inner string; and casing from 8.6 ppg seawater to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continue TIH with 22" x 23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 7;155' MD to 10;491' MD/TVD . Land and lock HPWH. Circulate 1.5x landing string; inner string; and casing volume to condition mud prior to cement job. Pump 100 bbls of 13.2 ppg spacer; 1;948 bbls (10;936 cu ft) of 13.8 ppg; Class H lead cement slurry; and 276 bbls (1;550 cu ft) of 16.2 ppg; Class H tail cement slurry. Displace cement with 302 bbls of 8.6 ppg seawater. Cement in place at the mudline (22:30 hrs) confirmed with 1;000 psi lift pressure. Confirm float holding. Preload HPWH to 2 MM ft/lbs. 

12/24/2016: TOH with landing string; MRLD; and inner string from 10;233' MD to 9;979' MD. Circulate 1.5x landing string and inner string volume. Continue TOH from 9;979' MD to 6;927' MD (200 ft above HPWH) on auxillary rotary. Move rig to DOZ. Troubleshoot / maintenance BOP for network connection issues.

Note: Mr. Jim Newby (Chevron) provided Mr. Josh Ladner (BSEE Houma District); via email on 12/24/2016 at 15:01 hrs; a 72 hour notification of planned initial BOP latch-up and testing on St. Malo PS002.
"},{"   ":236,"WELL_NAME":"PS002","API12":608124011400,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-12-25","TEXT_REMARK":"12/25/2016: Make up (M/U) riser double and splash BOP. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high with 8.6 ppg seawater for 5 minutes - good tests. Pressure test boost and rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes - good tests. All pressure tests conducted utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater. Run in hole (RIH) with BOP on riser from 209' to 284'.

12/26/2016: Continued RIH with BOP on riser from 284' MD to 959' MD. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes - good tests. Pressure test boost and rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes - good tests. Continue RIH with BOP on riser from 959' to 4;109'. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes - good tests. Pressure test boost and rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes - good tests. All pressure tests conducted utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater. Continue RIH with BOP on riser from 4;109' MD to 5;009' MD. 

Note: Mr. Jim Newby (Chevron) provided Mr. Josh Ladner (BSEE) via email on 12/26/2016 at 10:38 hours an update predicting planned initial BOP latch-up and testing on St. Malo PS002 to be 12/28/2016 at 17:00 hours.
  
12/27/2016: Continue to RIH with BOP/Riser from 5;009' MD to 6;985' MD. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Pressure test boost and rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes each - good tests. All pressure tests conducted utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater. P/U termination and landing joint. Move from safe handling zone (SHZ) to PS002 well center and confirm space out. Move out to SHZ. Begin installing drape hoses.

Note: Mr. Jim Newby provided Mr. Josh Ladner via email on 12/27/2016 at 10:38 hours an update predicting planned initial BOP latch-up and testing on St. Malo PS002 to be 12/28/2016 at 09:00 hours.

12/28/2016: Continue installing drape hoses to termination joint. Pressure test choke and kill lines to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good tests. Pressure test rigid conduit lines to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes - good test. Pressure test boost line to 4;500 psi for 5 minutes - good test. Install storm loops while flushing conduit lines. Lock tensioner ring to termination joint and release tensioner ring from diverter housing. Move to SM PS002 well center; land and latch BOP WellHead Connector at 18:30 hrs and perform slump test - good test. Performed weight down non-shear EDS - good test. Transfer riser weight from block to riser tensioners and scope out termination joint. Pressure test Wellhead Connector to 2;000 psi - good test. Pressure test 22" casing to 2;700 psi for 30 minutes with 8.6 ppg seawater; utilizing IPT SureTec - good test.

12/29/2016: Installed diverter and energized seals. Installed packer housing.  Performed full lift off emergency disconnect system (EDS). Reposition rig over High Pressure Wellhead (HPWH) and then land and re-latch LMRP to BOP at 15:40 hrs. TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA and BOP test plug from surface to 648' MD. Performed diverter function test from Driller's panel - good test.

12/30/2016: Continue TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 648' MD to 7;714' MD in 8.6 ppg seawater. Landed Dril-Quip test plug in HPWH profile at 7;126' MD. Released from Nu-Tec Blind Shear Ram (BSR) test tool. Pulled above BOP. Performed acoustic function of upper blind shear rams (UBSRs); and pressure tested UBSRs and Wellhead Connector against Dril-Quip test plug to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Opened USBRs from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod. Functioned UBSRs in 42.86 seconds with 50.66 gals using ROV intervention capabilities - good test. Pressure tested UBSR to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Performed Autoshear/Deadman system test- good test. Functioned USBRs closed from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; and pressure tested UBSRs to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Functioned LSBRs from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; and pressure tested LSBRs to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Function tested BSRs from Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod - good test. M/U Nu-tec tool and pressure tested variable bore rams (VBRs) and failsafe valves from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; to 300 psi low/ 11;500 psi high for 5 minutes each - good test. Pressure test annulars from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; to 300 psi/ 6;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. Function tested BOP rams and annulars on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod. Tested surface equipment to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each - good test. All pressure tests were conducted on 6-5/8" drill pipe utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater. 

Note: Mr. Robert Naumann (Chevron) provided notification to Mr. Josh Ladner (BSEE) via email on 12/30/2016 at 19:50 hours of one of two acoustic pod receivers not functioning.

12/31/2016: Performed accumulator drawdown test - good test. Completed BOP pressure testint. Unseat BOPTT; TOH with BOPTT and Nu-Tec tool to surface. TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from surface to 9;990' MD. Pressure test BOP test rams to 300 psi/ 11;500 psi for 5 minutes each utilizing IPT SureTec software with 8.6 ppg seawater - good test.

Note: Mr. Justin Ledet (BSEE) provided Mr. Robert Naumann (Chevron) via email on 12/31/2016 at 9:26 hours permission to proceed with operations on SM PS002.
"},{"   ":237,"WELL_NAME":"PS002","API12":608124011400,"WAR_START_DT":"2017-01-01","TEXT_REMARK":"01/01/2017: Performed choke drill. Washed down with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 9;990' MD and tagged Top Of Cement (TOC) at 10;401' MD with 20 kips down in 8.6 ppg seawater. Picked up from 10;401' MD to 10;305' MD and displaced wellbore from 12.5 ppg Pump And Dump (PAD) mud to 11.5 ppg SBM. Washed down from 10;305' MD to 10;401' MD and drilled 22" shoe track and float equipment from 10;401' MD to 10;488' MD. 
 
01/02/2017: Washed and reamed from 10;488' MD to 10;560' MD and continued to drill 10' of new formation to 10;570' MD. Tripped out of hole (TOH) from 10;570' MD to 10;477' MD. Performed flow check - well static. Performed FIT to an Equivalent Mud Weight (EMW) of 13.0 ppg; 819 psi. Pumped up Equivalent Static Density (ESD) data - Min ESD: 11.73 ppg. Performed 2nd FIT to 13.0 ppg EMW; 822 psi. Pumped up Equivalent Static Density (ESD) data - Min ESD: 11.71 ppg. Both FITs were conducted with 11.5 ppg (surface)/ 11.7 ppg (downhole) SBM. Drilled ahead from 10;570' MD to 11;213' MD.

01/03/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 11;213' MD to 13;290' MD. Kicked off at 12;872' MD; building at 1.2 degrees/ 100' to planned inclination of 31.2 degrees at 152.6 Azimuth. Increased mud weight from 11.5 ppg (surface)/ 11.7 ppg (downhole) to 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole). 

01/04/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 13;290' MD to 15;454' MD while continuing to build at 1.2 degrees/ 100' at 152.6 Azimuth to planned tangent of 31.2 degrees inclination at 152.6 Azimuth. Increased mud weight from 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) to 12.3 ppg (surface)/ 12.5 ppg (downhole).

01/05/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 15;454' MD to 17;621' MD with 12.3 ppg (surface)/ 12.5 ppg (downhole) SBM while holding 31.2 degrees at 152.6 Azimuth. Performed Diverter function test on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's Panel - good test.

01/06/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 17;621' MD to 18;464' MD with 12.3 ppg (surface)/ 12.5 ppg (downhole) SBM. Performed flow check - observed 4.5 bph loss rate. Performed function tests of BOP rams and annulars on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; and from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod - good tests. Performed Diverter function test on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's Panel - good test. Tripped in hole (TIH) from 18;044' MD to 18;464' MD and continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole to 19;100' MD.

01/07/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 19;100' MD to 19;269' MD with 12.3 ppg (surface)/ 12.5 ppg (downhole) SBM. Performed flow check - observed 5 bph loss rate. Controlled drilled from 19;269' MD to 19;740' MD while cutting mud weight back from 12.3 ppg (surface)/ 12.5 ppg (downhole) to 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole). Ensured 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) SBM in and out of wellbore and control drilled from 19;740' MD to 19;867' MD/ 19;131' TVD and observed drilling parameters change along with confirmation from near-bit PowerDrive GAMMA of exiting Base Of Salt (BOS). Continued drilling ahead from 19;867' MD to 20;630' MD/ 19;783 TVD with 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) SBM.
"},{"   ":238,"WELL_NAME":"PS002","API12":608124011400,"WAR_START_DT":"2017-01-08","TEXT_REMARK":"01/08/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 20;630' MD to 22;540' MD in 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) SBM. Encountered PLcorr8 at 21;211' MD/ 20;281' TVD. Encountered ML10 at 21;567' MD/ 20;587' TVD. Kicked off at 21;967' MD dropping at 1.5 degrees/ 100' to planned inclination of 0.0 degrees at 152.6 Azimuth. Encountered Ash Bed at 22;190' MD/ 21;127' TVD. Observed 5 - 6 bph loss rate throughout section.

01/09/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 22;540' MD to 24;140' MD in 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) SBM. Encountered ML9 at 22;690' MD/ 21;581' TVD. Completed directional work of dropping at 1.5 degrees/ 100' to planned inclination of 0.0 degrees at 152.6 Azimuth. Observed 3 - 5 bph losses throughout section. Encountered Flt_Mio_049_Grn at 22;888' MD/ 21;769' TVD.
	
01/10/2017: Continued to drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 24;140' MD to hole section Total Depth (TD) of 24;599' MD/ 23;463' TVD in 11.8 ppg (surface)/ 12.0 ppg (downhole) SBM.
