"},{"   ":273,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-03-18","TEXT_REMARK":"03/18/2012: Continued to POOH with 12-1/4" Drilling Assembly. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod and from Driller's panel on Blue Pod while R/U Schlumberger wireline equipment. Picked up Quad Combo tool string (ZAIT/ HLDS/QCNT/ECS/HNGS/CMR/GPIT). RIH and log from 25;520' to 28;275'; POOH. P/U SLB DUAL-OBMI/DSI/PPC (2)/GPIT tool string for second run.

03/19/2012: RIH with DUAL-OBMI/DSI/PPC (2)/GPIT tool string. RIH and log from 25;400' to 28;263'; POOH. Logged over the 13-3/4" PBR and Tieback seal assy while POOH from 22;800' to 22;400'. POOH with DUAL-OBMI/DSI/PPC (2)/GPIT and laid down the same. P/U and RIH with HTGC/MDT tool string to evaluate the Wilcox 1 & 2 pay zones. 

03/20/2012: Ran in hole with wireline MDT; conducted 76 pressure tests down to 27;914' (49 good; 27 tight). 

03/21/2012: Continued with MDT evaluation of Wilcox 1 & 2 pay zones. Completed MDT pressure sampling. (108 samples: 74 good; 34 tight or aborted). Collected 4 Oil samples from 27;765' to 28;045'. 

03/22/2012: The final oil and water samples were collected from 27;611' to 28;164' MD. POOH with MDT logging assembly and pick up MSCT sidewall coring assembly and TIH. POOH with MSCT sidewall coring assembly; 36 successful cores cut out of the planned 50 total.

03/23/2012: POOH with MSCT sidewall coring assembly; final 14 cores cut of planned 50 successfully. The wireline unit was rigged down followed by TIH for a wiper trip cleanout prior to 9-7/8" liner run. Depth of wiper trip was 15;133' at midnight.

03/24/2012: Function tested BOPs on Blue Pod from Driller's panel and on Yellow Pod from Toolpusher's panel and continued to TIH. After washing down the last 174 ft; bottom was tagged at 28;276' (TD). No fill observed. Pumped a 100-bbl high-vis weighted sweep and circulated it out.

"},{"   ":274,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-03-25","TEXT_REMARK":"03/25/2012: POOH with Clean out Assembly from 28;276' to surface. Conducted unannounced EDS drill with both crews while pulling out of the hole. 

03/26/2012: R/U casing handling tools and ran 3;574' of 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 20;788'. ROV inspected riser and BOP.

03/27/2012: Continued running 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 28;270'. Circulated and conditioned 14.1 SBM and cement 9-7/8" liner. ROV inspected riser and BOP. Performed well control drill while tripping.

03/28/2012: Circulate bottoms up after cement job. POOH with 9-7/8" Running Tool. TIH with Seat Protector Retrieval Tool to 1;991'. Performed pit drill while circulating.

03/29/2012: TIH with Seat Protector Retrieval Tool to 7;014'. Pressure tested manifold. Rig trouble time: troubleshot and corrected Hydril screens (inconsistent display). Continue to TIH with Seat Protector to 7;180'. Tested BOP rams on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod. Rams and associated valves: 250 psi/ 6500 psi. Annular and associated valves: 250 psi/ 4800 psi. Mud weight: 14.1 ppg. Performed Trip Drill.

03/30/2012: Tested BOPs on 6-5/8" DP from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod. Rams and associated valves: 250 psi/ 6500 psi. Functioned BOPs from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod. Functioned diverter from Toolpusher's Panel. Performed casing and blind shear rams function and pressure test from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod (250 psi/ 1700 psi). Functioned BSRs/CSRs from Driller's Panel Blue Pod. Performed casing negative test. Continued TIH with Seat Protector Retrieval Tool and retrieve seat protector. POOH. TIH with Lock Down Sleeve Retrieval tool. 

03/31/2012: TIH with lockdown sleeve retrieval tool. Unsuccessful attempt to retrieve lockdown sleeve. RIH with Dril-Quip mill & flush accessory to mill lockdown sleeve.
"},{"   ":275,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-01","TEXT_REMARK":"04/01/2012: Continue POOH with lockdown sleeve retrieval tool. TIH with Dril-Quip Mill & Flush Assembly; wash lockdown sleeve; POOH with Mill & Flush Assembly. M/U lockdown sleeve retrieval tool; TIH and successfully retrieve 14" lockdown sleeve. POOH. 

04/02/2012: Continue to POOH with 14" lockdown sleeve. Performed trip drill. Functioned BSRs/CSRs from Driller's Panel Yellow Pod and from Toolpusher's Panel Blue Pod. R/U and run 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" production tieback to 8;747'.

04/03/2012: Continue running 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" production tieback from 8;747' to 17;681'. M/U 10-3/4" casing hanger and continue running to 21;437' on landing string. ROV inspected riser and BOP. 

04/04/2012: Continue running 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" production tieback on landing string from 21;437' to 24;614'. Confirm tieback spaceout. Circulated and conditioned 14.1 SBM and cement 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback. Set and test seal assembly. Pressure test hanger to 9;300 psi with 14.1 ppg SBM.  

04/05/2012: Functioned BOPs from Driller's Panel Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's Panel Blue Pod. Functioned diverter from Driller's Panel. Circulate & condition mud and POOH with landing string. TIH with Dril-Quip lead impression tool assembly to 153'.

04/06/2012: RIH and take lead impression of lockdown sleeve profile and POOH. RIH with Dril-Quip 10-3/4" lockdown sleeve and attempt to set lockdown sleeve w/o success. POOH. 

04/07/2012: Continue POOH wtih lead impression tool. Pressure test BSR x Production Tieback to 250/7750 psi for 30 minutes and test BSR to 250/7714 psi for 5 minutes. Functioned BSRs/CSRs from Driller's Panel Blue Pod and Toolpusher's Panel Yellow Pod. TIH with jet sub; wash lockdown sleeve profile and POOH. M/U lead impression tool and begin TIH.
"},{"   ":276,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-08","TEXT_REMARK":"04/08/2012: TIH with DQ lead impression tool. Set down weight on tool on the 10-3/4" casing landing shoulder. POOH with DQ lead impression tool and inspect tool. Rebuild lead impression tool and rerun into the well. Set down weight again on 10-3/4" casing landing shoulder and begin POOH. 

04/09/2012: POOH with DQ lead impression tool to surface and inspect tool. TIH with 13-3/4" lockdown sleeve and land on 10-3/4" casing landing shoulder. POOH with DQ lockdown sleeve running tool and inspect tool.

04/10/2012: TIH with Halliburton 10-3/4" RTTS and SSCII assembly to 7;631' and set tool. POOH with Halliburton overshot assembly. Perform negative test on the RTTS. Displace riser to sea water.

04/11/2012: Clean riser; boost; choke; and kill lines with Deep Clean riser wash. POOH to surface with Halliburton overshot assembly. Rig up to pull riser and BOP.

04/12/2012: Pull riser and remove choke; kill; boost; and rigid conduit lines from termination joint. Pulled and lay out riser on deck.

04/13/2012: Continue to pull riser and BOP stack from 6;044' to surface. Recover BOP stack.

04/14/2012: Clean and jet BOP with BOP cleaning tool. Stow BOP."},{"   ":277,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-15","TEXT_REMARK":"04/15/12: Continue POOH w/ Subsea Tree Running Tool from 3;351 to surface and lay tool down. Continue planned rig maintenance.

04/16/12: Continue planned rig maintenance.

04/17/12: Continue planned rig maintenance.

04/18/12: Continue planned rig maintenance.

04/19/12: Continue planned rig maintenance.

04/20/12: Continue planned rig maintenance. 

04/21/12: Continue planned rig maintenance.

"},{"   ":278,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-22","TEXT_REMARK":"04/22/2012: Continue planned rig maintenance. Perform H2S Drill.

04/23/2012: Continued planned rig maintenance. 

04/24/2012: Continue planned rig maintenance. 

04/25/2012: Finish planned rig maintenance at 16:30 hrs. Rig up riser handling equipment. 

04/26/2012: Splash BOP and run riser from 92' to 1;469'. 

04/27/2012: Continue running riser from 1;469' to 6;044'.

04/28/2012: Finish running riser; termination joint and slip joint. P/U landing joint and land fluid bearing in SDC ring. Land and latch BOP stack. Transfer weight to tensioners. Perform ROV function test on UBSR; 09:20 mm:ss to close. Pressure tested to 250/2;500 psi for 5 minutes with seawater.

"},{"   ":279,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-04-29","TEXT_REMARK":"04/29/2012: Pressure test LBSR to 250/2;500 psi with seawater for 5 minutes. Function test UBSR and LBSR. Install diverter. R/D riser handling equipment and R/U drill pipe handling equipment. Perform Deadman Test as per TOI/CVX procedure and verify LBSR closed with 1;000 psi test. Install 5-7/8" CTM-57 saver sub. Test Kelly hose and #1 standpipe valve to 250/6;500 psi with seawater for 5 minutes. Test MDDM IBOP valves and 5-7/8" CTM-57 FOSV's to 250/10;300 psi with seawater for 5 minutes.

04/30/2012: TIH with Cameron BOP Weight Set Test Tool to 528'. Function test diverter and flow test diverter lines. Wash through Subsea Production Tree with jet sub. Perform accumulator drawdown and function test. Test ram BOPs and associated valves on 5-7/8" drill pipe to 250/9;900 psi with seawater for 5 minutes each. Test annular BOP and associated valves on 5-7/8" drill pipe to 250/6;900 psi for 5 minutes each. POOH to surface.

05/01/2012: TIH with Halliburton RTTS overshot assembly to 7;180'. Displace riser and choke / kill / boost lines from seawater to 14.1 ppg SBM. Unseat RTTS packer with annular closed. Open annular and monitor well ¿ well static. Circulate bottoms up.

05/02/2012: POOH to surface. TIH to 3;317' with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback and 9-7/8" production liner cleanout assembly. Function test UBSR and LBSR. Continue TIH with cleanout assembly to 12;854'.

05/03/2012: TIH to 24;002' with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback and 9-7/8" production liner cleanout assembly. Perform choke drill and acquire SCRs/CLFs. Establish baseline drilling parameters; wash down to TOC in tieback shoetrack at 24;511'. Drill cement to 24;683'.

05/04/2012: Continue drilling cement in 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback shoetrack from 24;683' to 24;698'. RIH with cleanout assembly to 27;500'. Establish baseline drilling parameters and wash down to top of 9-7/8" liner wiper plug at 28;084'. Drill top of wiper plug and circulate bottoms up. Drill 9-7/8" liner shoetrack to plugback TD of 28;170'. Circulate bottoms up.

05/05/2012: Test 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback and 9-7/8" production liner to 7;700 psi with 14.1 ppg SBM for 30 minutes. POOH to 20;834'. Pick up riser cleanout tools and RIH with cleanout assembly to 28;170'. Circulate bottoms up.

"},{"   ":280,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-05-06","TEXT_REMARK":"05/06/2012: Circulate and condition 14.1 ppg SBM. Begin pumping wash spacers and transition spacer before displacing SBM in hole with 14.1 ppg CaBr2.

05/07/2012: Function test BOP from Driller's panel Blue Pod; Toolpusher's Panel Yellow Pod. Function test diverter from Driller's panel. Flush surface equipment with 14.1 ppg CaBr2 and filter fluid. Transfer 14.1 ppg SBM from reserve pits to M/V Brimstone.

05/08/2012: Continue transferring 14.1 ppg SBM from reserve pits to M/V Brimstone. Rig up side entry stand and chicksan to reverse-out line. Reverse out casing and workstring volume with 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Start jetting BOP with Halliburton Cleanwell Equipment.

05/09/2012: Continue washing BOP with Halliburton Jet Tech tool. Finish washing BOP and circulate bottoms up. POOH with Halliburton Cleanwell Assemblies for BSR testing.

05/10/2012: Continue to POOH with Halliburton Cleanwell Assemblies. Function Upper & Lower Blind Shear Rams from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Function Upper & Lower Blind Shear Rams from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. TIH to 14;084' and locate annular and space-out for BOP test. Test BOP utilizing test rams on 5-7/8" 28 ppf drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Function test BOP from Yellow Pod on Driller's panel. Function test BOP from Blue Pod on Toolpusher's panel. Function Diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Test Top Drive IBOP valves using SLB cement unit.

05/11/2012: Finish POOH with Halliburton Cleanwell Assemblies. R/U SLB wireline and M/U tool string with gauge ring; junk basket; CCL; and GR and RIH. SLB wireline tagged up at 24;715'. POOH with 8.37" gauge ring tool string to change gauge ring to 8.25" and rerun wireline run.

05/12/2012: SLB wireline change 8.37" gauge ring for an 8.25" gauge ring and RIH tool string from previous day to PBTD. POOH with this wireline assembly and M/U SLB Isolation Scanner; CCL; and GR tool string to confirm cement placement at top of 9-7/8" production liner; tieback PBR gap in the 9-7/8" tieback base; and TOC of 10-3/4" tieback. Problems with SLB wireline tool string after reaching 24;900'. POOH to redress tool. RIH with SLB Isolation Scanner; CCL; and GR tool string to confirm cement placement as before.
"},{"   ":281,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-05-13","TEXT_REMARK":"05/13/2012: Continue RIH with SLB wireline IBC/GPIT/MSIP cement evaluation tools. Log up with CBL from PBTD across top of 9-7/8" production liner; tieback PBR gap in the 9-7/8" tieback base; and TOC of 10-3/4" tieback. L/D cement evaluation tools and M/U and RIH AWV Sump Packer/Mirage/GR/CCL assembly. SLB wireline set Halliburton sump packer at 28;028' ELM. POOH with SLB Mirage/GR/CCL wireline tools to surface. Test 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" casing to 250/2500 psi for 30 min against Lower Blind Shear Rams from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. Test Upper Blind Shear Rams 250/2500 psi from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. 

05/14/2012: Function Upper and Lower BSRs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. P/U 61 SLB TCP guns and RIH on 5-7/8" DP.

05/15/2012: Continue RIH with TCP guns on 5-7/8" DP and locate sump packer. Begin flushing choke; kill; and boosting the riser.

05/16/2012: P/U TCP gun assembly to perforating depth and fire TCP guns. Perforation depths - Zone 4: 26;727' to 26;921'; Zone 3: 27;131' to 27;325'; Zone 2: 27;502' to 27;696'; and Zone 1: 27;819' to 28;013'. Monitor fluid losses to the formation to establish loss rate and reverse out. Begin POOH with TCP gun assembly.

05/17/2012: Continue to POOH with TCP gun assembly. Function BOPs from Driller's panel on Blue Pod and from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod. Functioned diverter from Driller's panel.

05/18/2012: Finish POOH with TCP gun assembly and L/O on Deck. M/U and P/U Deburr Assembly and RIH. Pressure test well test line. Function upper and lower BSRs from Drillers's panel on Blue Pod and from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod.

05/19/2012: Continue to RIH with Deburr Assembly and wash and ream perforations.
"},{"   ":282,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-05-20","TEXT_REMARK":"05/20/2012: Continue to wash and ream from 27;888' to tag sump packer with No-Go. Pick up and circulate bottoms up. Tag sump packer and POOH with Deburr Assembly from 28;141' to 15;008'. Function BOPs on 5-7/8" workstring from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Circulate and condition fluid. ROV inspected riser and BOP. Performed Fire and Abandon Drill.

05/21/2012: Continue to circulate and condition fluid. Function diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Pressure test BOPs to 250/8;000 psi on 5-7/8" and 6-5/8" workstring from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod. Tested annular to 250/4;800 psi and Kelly hose to 250/6;500 psi. Surface valves and choke manifold tested to 250/11;300 psi. Performed BOP function from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. 

05/22/2012: Continue to POOH with Deburr Assembly to surface. TIH with second Cleanout Assembly. Slip and cut drill line. ROV inspected riser and BOP. Performed well control trip drill.

05/23/2012: Function tested UBSRs/LBSRs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod and from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. While functioning the UBSRs from the Driller's panel on Yellow Pod; observed improper gallon count on the close function. Jumped ROV and performed visual inspection; finding a leak in the main 1" supply line to the close shuttle for the UBSRs. Risk assessed the situation and bypassed damaged 1" supply line utilizing the flying lead hot stab in the UBSR CLOSE receptacle on the ROV intervention panel (closing time: 2 minutes 08 seconds). Continued to TIH; jetted BOPs and pumped spike fluid. Continued to TIH. 

05/24/2012: Continued to TIH with second Cleanout Assembly. Tag sump packer; pick up; close annular and reverse circulate to clean up well. 

05/25/2012: Continue reverse circulating. Flow checked the well and POOH to space out to test BOPs. Pressure tested BOPs to 250/8;000 psi on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" workstring from Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod. Tested annular to 250/4;800 psi and Kelly hose to 250/6;500 psi. Surface valves and choke manifold tested to 250/11;300 psi. 

05/26/2012: Complete BOP pressure tests. Function BOPs from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod. Function test diverter from Driller's Panel. Continue to POOH with second Cleanout Assembly. 
"},{"   ":283,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-05-27","TEXT_REMARK":"05/27/2012: POOH to surface with second cleanout assembly. Slipped and cut drill line. Function tested UBSR and LBSR from Toolpusher's Panel on Yellow Pod and Driller's Panel on Blue Pod. TIH with third cleanout assembly to 15;819'. Performed weekly Fire and Abandon Drill. ROV inspected BOP system and riser.

05/28/2012: Continue to TIH with third cleanout assembly to 28;025'. Stung in sump packer and tagged No-Go at 28;140'. P/U; flushed choke and kill lines; closed annular BOP and reversed out. Conducted Well Control Trip drill.

05/29/2012: Tagged sump packer and TOH to 14;605'. Located tool joint and tested BOP on 5-7/8" DP and 6-5/8" StimTech Joint. Tested surface lines to 9;000 psi; Annular to 250/4;800 psi; Rams and associated valves to 250/8;000 psi; Choke Manifold valves to 250/10;300 psi; Kelly hose and Stand pipe #1 to 250/6500 psi. Tests performed from Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod. ROV inspected BOP system and riser.

05/30/2012: Continued to pressure test BOPs. Function tested BOP on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's Panel on Blue Pod. Function tested diverter from Toolpusher's panel.
TOH with third cleanout assembly to surface. Off line tested FOSV/IBOPs to 250/10;300 psi. Slipped and cut drill line. Conducted Well Control Trip drill.

05/31/2012: Performed function test on shear rams from Toolpusher's Panel on Blue Pod and Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod. P/U gravel pack inner string and TIH to 1;730'. P/U gravel pack assembly. ROV inspected BOP system and riser.

06/01/2012: Continued to P/U gravel pack assembly; pressure tested zones one; two and three to 250 psi for 5 minutes. Well Control drill while drilling. 

06/02/2012: Finished P/U gravel pack assembly and tested it to 250 psi for 5 minutes. RIH gravel pack assembly on 5-7/8" DP to 10;078'. Function tested BSRs from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod and from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod.
"},{"   ":284,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-03","TEXT_REMARK":"06/03/2012: Continued to TIH with ESTMZ gravel pack assembly to 28;032'. Performed well control drill while tripping. Performed fire and abandon drill. Inspected BOP and riser with ROV.
 
06/04/2012: R/U and set VCH Packer with SLB CMT unit. Put ESTMZ tool into WDC position with all other zones closed. R/U Frac Head and Baker High Pressure filter unit. Put ESTMZ tool into final reverse position and pump DP pickle fluid. Line up to reverse circulate to remove pickle fluid from DP.

06/05/2012: Pressure test frac lines to 13;500 psi. Put ESTMZ tool into reverse out position to remove seawater from frac lines. Pump Zone 1 pre frac acid treatment at 10 bpm with ESTMZ tool in full reverse position. Perform mini frac; step rate test; and main frac in the WDC position. Reverse out proppant after frac job in full reverse position. Close and pressure test MCS and FCS sleeves. POOH to Zone 2. 

06/06/2012: Position tool in WDC position for frac pac zone 2. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod and Driller's panel on the Blue Pod. Function diverter from Driller's panel. Close annular and establish injection and circulation rates using SLB CMT unit. Perform strip test. Pressure test frac lines to 13;500 psi. Put ESTMZ tool into reverse out position to remove seawater from frac lines. Pump Zone 2 pre frac acid treatment with ESTMZ tool in WDC position. Perform mini frac in the WDC position. 

06/07/2012: Perform main frac on Zone 2 with ESTMZ tool in WDC position. Reverse out proppant after frac job in full reverse position. Prepare for Re-Stress Diagnostics of Zone 2. Close annular and establish injection and circulation rates using SLB CMT unit.

06/08/2012: Perform re-stress on Zone 2 with ESTMZ tool in WDC position. Treatment ended early due to higher than expected pressures. Put ESTMZ tool into full reverse position to circulate 14.1 CaBr2 around. POOH with ESTMZ service tool to re-dress and install back up service tool. 

06/09/2012: Continue to POOH with ESTMZ service tool. Function test upper and lower BSRs from Toolpusher's panel Blue Pod and Driller's panel Yellow Pod.
"},{"   ":285,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-10","TEXT_REMARK":"06/10/2012: TIH with ESTMZ service tool assembly; taking losses at 8 bbl/hr. Pressure test choke manifold valves and 5-7/8" CTM-57 TIWs and IBOPs to 250/10;300 psi.
 
06/11/2012: Continue to TIH with ESTMZ service tool assembly; taking losses at 8 bbl/hr.  Test BOPs on 6-5/8" and 5-7/8" from Toolpusher's panel Blue Pod. Rams and associated valves to 250/8;000 psi and annular and associated valves to 250/4;000 psi. 

06/12/2012: Continue to test BOPs on 5-7/8" from Toolpusher's panel Blue Pod. Rams and associated valves to 250/8;000 psi and annular and associated valves to 150/4;000 psi. Function test diverter from Toolpusher's panel and BOPs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. TIH with ESTMZ service tool assembly; taking losses at 8-10 bbl/hr. Obtain Zone 3 injection rates. Flush seawater from frac lines and pressure test lines to 13;500 psi. Pump Zone 3 pre-frac acid treatment with ESTMZ tool in squeeze position. Perform mini-frac treatment witj ESTMZ tool in squeeze position and monitor pressure. 

06/13/2012: Perform Zone 3 main frac with ESTMZ tool in the squeeze position. Reverse out proppant after frac job with ESTMZ tool in full reverse position. Position ESTMZ tool in squeeze position in preparation to frac Zone 4. Obtain Zone 4 injection rates. Flush seawater from frac lines and pressure test lines to 13;500 psi. Begin Zone 4 pre-frac acid treatment with ESTMZ tool in squeeze position.

06/14/2012: Continue Zone 4 pre-frac acid treatment with ESTMZ tool in squeeze position.Perform mini-frac treatment with ESTMZ tool in squeeze position and monitor pressure. Perform Zone 4 main frac with ESTMZ tool in the squeeze position. Reverse out proppant after frac job with ESTMZ tool in full reverse position. Monitor well ¿ taking losses at 3 bbl/hr. POOH with ESTMZ service tool assembly.

06/15/2012: POOH with ESTMZ service tool assembly.

06/16/2012: P/U Production Isolation Assembly and RIH; taking losses at 3.25 bbl/hr.  Function test BSRs from Driller's panel on Blue Pod and from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod.
"},{"   ":286,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-17","TEXT_REMARK":"06/17/2012: Continued TIH with Production Isolation Assembly from 16;590' to 26;566' and set the same and POOH with running tool. Performed Trip Drill and Weekly Fire and Abandon Drill.

06/18/2012: Continued to POOH with Production Isolation Assembly running tool. Function tested BOPs from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod and from Toolpusher's Panel on Yellow Pod. Function tested Diverter from Driller's Panel. Pressure tested UBSR and LBSR from Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod and function tested them from Toolpusher's Panel on Blue Pod. Test pressures: 250 / 2;500 psi. TIH with Production Packer Assembly.

06/19/2012: Continued to TIH with Production Packer to 26;510'; set and pressure tested the same to 4;500 psi from above and 5;000 psi from below. POOH above the stack with running tool. ROV inspected riser and BOP stack.

06/20/2012: Continued to POOH with running tool. TIH with Bore Protector Running and Retrieving Tool and BOP Test Assembly. POOH to space out. Performed Trip Drill.

06/21/2012: Continued to POOH. TIH with Bore Protector Running and Retrieving Tool and BOP Test Assembly. Washed BOP stack and landed BPRRT in Subsea Production Tree. Started to perform BOP test; unsuccessful due to a leak in cementing unit. Repaired leak on cementing unit. Decided to suspend BOP test due to weather forecast (Tropical Disturbance Advisory #11) and prepare to secure the well. Performed negative test on FS-2 valve to seawater equivalent. Performed Pit Drill.

06/22/2012: Successful negative test. POOH and started to secure equipment on decks due to weather forecast.

06/23/2012: Waited on weather; continued to secure equipment on decks. L/D drill pipe from derrick. ROV inspected riser and BOP stack.
"},{"   ":287,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-06-24","TEXT_REMARK":"06/24/2012: Waited on weather; monitored Tropical Storm Debby; continued to secure equipment on decks. L/D drill pipe from derrick. Performed weekly fire and abandon drill.

06/25/2012: RIH with BOP test assembly. Function tested BSRs from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod and Toolpusher's Panel on Yellow Pod. Landed out BOP test plug. Function tested Diverter from Toolpusher's Panel and BOPs from Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's Panel on Blue Pod. Pressure tested BOPs on 5-7/8" and 9-5/8" test subs from Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod. Rams and associated valves: 250/8000 psi; Annular and associated valves: 250/4800 psi. Brine weight: 14.1 ppg. ROV inspected riser and BOP stack.

06/26/2012: Continued pressure testing BOPs on 5-7/8" and 9-5/8" test subs. Function tested BOPs and failsafe valves from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod and Toolpusher's Panel on Yellow Pod. POOH to 6;458' and function tested diverter from Driller's Panel. Tested MDDM IBOPS (250/10;300 psi). Performed well control drill while pumping.

06/27/2012: POOH with BOP test assembly. Rigged up to run production tubing. RIH with Chemical Injection Mandrel (CIM) and Downhole Pressure and Temperature Gauge (DPTG) on 4-1/2" production tubing.

06/28/2012: Pressure tested CIM and DPTG terminations and continue TIH with 4-1/2" production tubing to 7;557'. Function tested BSRs from Driller's Panel on Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's Panel on Blue Pod. ROV inspected riser and BOP stack.

06/29/2012: Continued to TIH with 4-1/2" production tubing to 16;745'. Picked up SCSSV and LDHI CIM.

06/30/2012: Pressure tested SCSSV terminations and control lines successfully. Attempted to pressure test LDHI CIM not being able to build up pressure due to the absence of a rupture disc. POOH SCSSV - LDHI CIM assembly and M/U back up assembly. Pressure tested SCSSV - LDHI CIM assembly termination and control lines successfully.
Performed well control drill while tripping. ROV inspected riser and BOP stack.
"},{"   ":288,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-01","TEXT_REMARK":"07/01/2012: TIH with 4-1/2" production tubing to 17;637'. TIH with 6" VIT tubing to 19;208'. M/U 6" x 5-1/2" tubing crossover and 5-1/2" pup joints. M/U tubing hanger assembly. Begin termination of control lines to tubing hanger.

07/02/2012: Terminate control lines to tubing hanger and test all terminations and lines. Transfer subsea test tree (SSTT) to Fwd rotary and M/U to tubing hanger. Pressure test SSTT and tubing hanger via SSTT umbilical. Rig up and begin to run tubing on 7-5/8" landing string.

07/03/2012: Run tubing on 7-5/8" landing string and sting seals into PBR at 26;255'. P/U 20' and displace tubing x casing annulus with packer fluid. Re-sting seals into PBR at 26;254'. Soft land tubing hanger in SSPT to confirm tubing spaceout. Tag at mule shoe guide depth of 26;287'. 

07/04/2012: Layout top 7-5/8" single for landing string spaceout. R/U compensated coiled tubing lift frame (CCTLF) in the derrick. Pressure test and confirm functionality of CCTLF. Transfer surface flow tree (SFT) to FWD rotary. 

07/05/2012: M/U SFT to 7-5/8" landing string. Install 26' of torpedo packer and end caps. Land and lock tubing hanger into subsea production tree (SSPT). On land out; insufficient seal engagement was found in PBR. Unlock tubing hanger from SSPT. Remove 26' of torpedo packer and end caps. 

07/06/2012: Transfer SFT to center mousehole. L/D CCTLF. M/U single on top of 7-5/8" landing string. Land tubing hanger in SSPT due to yellow advisory status. Unseat tubing hanger from SSPT when green advisory status recovered. POOH tubing on 7-5/8" landing string to 25;631'.

07/07/2012: Continue to POOH tubing on 7-5/8" landing string. Remove SSTT from tubing hanger and transfer SSTT to the center mousehole. 
"},{"   ":289,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-08","TEXT_REMARK":"07/08/2012: Land subsea test tree (SSTT) in center mousehole. Cut control lines at tubing hanger. Lay out tubing hanger. Splice control lines on tubing to control line on spoolers. Conduct internal and external tests on spliced control lines.

07/09/2012: Complete splicing and testing of control lines. P/U 5-1/2" tubing pup joints as required to adjust the tubing spaceout. M/U tubing hanger. Terminate control lines to tubing hanger and test all terminations and lines. 

07/10/2012: Transfer SSTT to Fwd rotary and M/U to tubing hanger. Pressure test SSTT and tubing hanger via SSTT umbilical. Rig up and run tubing on 7-5/8" landing string to 26;203'. 

07/11/2012: TIH with tubing on 7-5/8" landing string and sting seals into PBR at 26;258'. Soft land tubing hanger in subsea production tree (SSPT). Tag at mule shoe guide depth of 26;316'. Layout top 7-5/8" single for landing string spaceout. R/U compensated coiled tubing lift frame (CCTLF) in the derrick. Pressure test and confirm functionality of CCTLF. Transfer surface flow tree (SFT) to Fwd rotary. Install 26' of torpedo packer and end caps. Soft land tubing hanger in SSPT at 26;319'.

07/12/2012: Land and lock tubing hanger into SSPT. Connect production and kill lines and hydraulic control lines to SFT. Test tubing hanger per Cameron procedure. R/U slickline on Aft rig floor.

07/13/2012: RIH with running/pulling tool on slickline. Retrieve isolation sleeve from tubing hanger and POOH. RIH with bore protector on running/pulling tool and slickline. Set bore protector in tubing hanger and POOH with slickline. R/D lubricator and install night cap on top of slickline equipment. Test SFT; SSTT; and Production Equipment in preparation for flowback. Tether barge to rig and line up barge to take returns from base oil displacement. Function test ESD system.

07/14/2012: Pump base oil down kill line and up landing string. Apply 20 pressure cycles on FS-2 valve (2;700 psi low / 7;700 psi high); unsuccessful in opening valve. Cycle FS-2 valves 20 additional times (2;700 psi low / 7;700 psi high); unsuccessful in opening valve. Cycle FS-2 valves 20 additional times (2;200 psi low / 7;700 psi high); unsuccessful in opening valve.
"},{"   ":290,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-15","TEXT_REMARK":"07/15/2012: Rig up slickline. Make 2.5" gauge ring run on slickline; tag at 26;574' slickline depth. Make 2.5" bailer run on slickline; tag at 26;575' slickline depth. Make second 2.5" bailer run on slickline; tag at 26;575'. 

07/16/2012: Complete second bailer run. Make third 2.25" bailer run on slickine; tag at 26;575' slickline depth. Attempt to cycle open FS-2 valve with pressure. 

07/17/2012: Attempt to cycle open FS-2 valve. Make forth 2.25" bailer run on slickine; tagging at 26;584' slickline depth. R/D slickline and R/U wireline.

07/18/2012: Finish R/U wireline. Run correlation log (Gamma Ray/ CCL). R/U e-line to high expansion shifter assembly. Attempt to function test tool with no success. Troubleshoot high expansion shifter assembly. 

07/19/2012:  Continue troubleshooting. RIH with high expansion shifter assembly.

07/20/2012:  Continue to RIH with high expansion shifter assembly. Tag at 26;484'. Troubleshot CCL. POOH and P/U new assembly.

07/21/2012:  RIH with new high expansion shifter assembly. Make multiple attempts tagging at depths ranging from 26;512' to 26;517'. POOH with high expansion shifter assembly. Wait on smaller OD high expansion shifter assembly.
"},{"   ":291,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-22","TEXT_REMARK":"07/22/2012: Waited on smaller OD high expansion shifter assembly. RIH with small OD assembly on wireline to 8560'. Surface Flow Head electrical supply switch was inadvertently switched off closing Swab Valve and Upper Master Valve; cutting wireline. R/D power hoses and lubricator. 

07/23/2012: Continued to R/D lubricator and removed cut wireline. Pressure tested Flow Head and performed 1000 psi underbalance negative test.

07/24/2012: Displaced base oil on landing string to 14;1 ppg brine. R/U slickline equipment and RIH with 5.9" wire finder. Tagged at 185' and POOH. No indications of tagging on wire were seen.

07/25/2012: RIH with 5.9" wire finder from surface to 7;113' and POOH. RIH with 3.4" wire finder; tagging fish at 18;156'. POOH. R/D 0.125" slickline unit and R/U 5/16" braided slickline unit. RIH with 3.4" wire finder on 5/16" braided line.  

07/26/2012: RIH with 3.4" wire finder on braided slickline. Tagged top of fish at 18;155'. POOH and RIH with wireline fishing assembly (wire finder and spear) on braided slickline. Made 3 attempts to fish with no success. POOH.

07/27/2012: Verify sheared pin on Shear Sub. Reconfigure jars and RIH. Fished wireline and pulled same to surface.

07/28/2012: Worked fish through surface equipment. RIH with 2.7" magnet on slickline. POOH; recovered debris on magnet and RIH with same magnet on slickline.
"},{"   ":292,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-07-29","TEXT_REMARK":"07/29/2012: Finished POOH with 2.7" OD magnet on slickline (Run #2). Performed bailer run. RIH with 2.7" OD magnet on slickline (Run #3). POOH; inspected debris and RIH again with 2.7" magnet on slickline (Run #4). Function tested diverter from Toolpusher's panel.

07/30/2012: Continued to RIH with 2.7" magnet. POOH. Inspected flow head with 360 degrees camera. R/U wireline valves and lubricator.

07/31/2012: Tested wireline valves and lubricator. R/U and RIH with Lead Impression Block; GR; CCL Assembly. 

08/01/2012: Replaced E-line power pack. POOH with LIB; GR; CCL assembly. 

08/02/2012: Began executing Storm Suspension Plan: RIH to retrieve bore protector; then to set upper crown plug on slickline.

08/03/2012: Performed positive test (250/7780 psi for 5/15 mins) and inflow test (2080 psi for 30 min) on crown plug. Performed inflow test on SCSSV (2180 psi for 30 mins). R/D slickline; unlatched THRT; and R/D SFT and CCTLF.

08/04/2012: L/O SFT and CCTLF; R/U and POOH with landing string; SSTT; and THRT. Held well control drill while tripping.
"},{"   ":293,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-05","TEXT_REMARK":"08/05/2012: POOH with Expro subsea test tree. RIH with Cameron jetting tool.

08/06/2012: Jet tubing hanger and production tree with Cameron jetting tool; POOH. M/U Cameron tubing hanger running tool and Expro subsea test tree; RIH on 7-5/8" landing string.

08/07/2012: Continue TIH with Cameron tubing hanger running tool and Expro subsea test tree; soft land on tubing hanger. Pick up compensated coiled tubing lift frame. 

08/08/2012: Make up Expro Flowhead. Function test diverter. Latch tubing hanger running tool in tubing hanger. Close 9-5/8" rams and pressure test to 250/8;000 psi for 5 mins. Rig up slickline lubricator and RIH to retrieve crown plug. 

08/09/2012: Retrieve crown plug and set tubing hanger wireline protection sleeve in tubing hanger on slickline. Pressure test Expro Flowhead.

08/10/2012: Continue pressure testing Flowhead and Expro subsea test tree. Perform fishing operations with slickline. 

08/11/2012: Continue fishing operations with slickline; POOH. Rig down slickline lubricator. Rig up e-line lubricator. 
"},{"   ":294,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-12","TEXT_REMARK":"08/12/2012: Perform fishing run with 2.7" OD flat bottom magnet on e-line (Run #1). Re-run 2.7" OD flat bottom magnet on e-line (Run #2).
	
08/13/2012:  Run 3.00" lead impression block on e-line. RIH with WellTec Assembly and Halliburton High Expansion Shifter to mechanically shift FS-2 valve. Displace landing string from 14.1 ppg CaBr2 to 6.6 ppg base oil. Mechanically shift open FS-2 valve. POOH with shifter assembly.
	
08/14/2012: POOH with WellTec Assembly and Halliburton High Expansion Shifter. Run 2.70" gauge run on e-line to confirm FS-2 valve fully opened. Rig down e-line and pressure control equipment. Wait on daylight.
	
08/15/2012:  Wait on daylight. Begin well test. Maximum H2S concentration measured: 10 ppm; inside the high pressure separator. 
	
08/16/2012:  Conduct well test. Maximum H2S concentration measured: 10 ppm; inside the high pressure separator. No H2S detected on the barge.
	
08/17/2012: Conduct well test. Maximum H2S concentration measured: 10 ppm; inside the high pressure separator; 20 ppm inside the low pressure separator. Maximum H2S concentration measured in barge tanks: 90 ppm.
	
08/18/2012: Conduct well test. Maximum H2S concentration measured: 7 ppm; inside the high pressure separator; 18 ppm inside the low pressure separator. Maximum H2S concentration measured in barge tanks: 37 ppm.
"},{"   ":295,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-19","TEXT_REMARK":"08/19/2012: Conduct well test. Maximum H2S concentration measured: 7 ppm; inside the high pressure separator; 18 ppm inside the low pressure separator. Maximum H2S concentration measured in the barge tanks: 27 ppm. Shut in well due to weather. Monitor well for pressure build-up.

08/20/2012: Continue monitoring well for pressure build-up.

08/21/2012: Continue monitoring well for pressure buildup. Close SCSSV. Inflow test SCSSV to a 6;175 psi differential.

08/22/2012: Conclude inflow test on SCSSV. Displace hydrocarbons from landing string with 6.6 ppg base oil. Pull tubing hanger bore protector with slickline. Set lower crown plug on slickline.

08/23/2012: Test lower crown plug from above to 10;560 psi for 30 min. Run and set upper crown plug. Attempt to pressure test between upper and lower crown plugs - unsuccessful. Begin preparations for Tropical Storm Isaac. R/D slickline equipment.

08/24/2012: Continue preparations for Tropical Storm Isaac. Unlatch THRT. Displace 6.6 ppg base oil from kill line and landing string with 14.1 ppg CaBr2. Remove torpedo packers. R/D surface flow tree. R/D CCTLF. R/U equipment to pull 7-5/8" landing string.

08/25/2012: Continue preparations for Tropical Storm Isaac. Pull out of hole with 7-5/8" landing string and SSTT. Transfer SSTT to center mousehole. Displace choke line with drill water. Pressure test lower BSR to 250/8;000 psi for 5 minutes each with 14.1 ppg CaBr2.
"},{"   ":296,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-08-26","TEXT_REMARK":"08/26/2012: Displace riser from 14.1 ppg CaBr2 to seawater. Clean and L/O diverter. Unlatch LMRP. Pull riser pup joints.
	
08/27/2012: R/D drape hoses. Pull riser and IWOC's clamps. Suspend pulling riser while waiting for T.S. Isaac to pass. 
	
08/28/2012: Wait on Weather due to T.S. Isaac with LMRP at 5;852'. Hold position at 1;500' off location. 
	
08/29/2012: Wait on Weather due to T.S. with LMRP at 5;852'. Hold position at 1;500' off location.
	
08/30/2012: Wait on Weather due to Hurricane Isaac with LMRP at 5;852'. Move rig to 500' from wellhead; deploy ROV to latch LMRP. Run riser to re-latch.
	
08/31/2012: M/U Riser and drape hoses. Latch LMRP. 
	
09/01/2012: Test choke/kill lines. Install diverter. ROV install EFL and HFL. Function and pressure test UBSRs (250/10;000 psi) with saltwater for 5 min each. Function test diverter. Run side view camera to inspect BOPs and upper crown plug. R/U to run washout assembly.
"},{"   ":297,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2012-09-02","TEXT_REMARK":"09/02/2012: Run in hole with washout assembly. Test LMRP connector and Annular to 250 psi low/ 6800 psi high for 5 minutes each.
	
09/03/2012: Circulate with seawater to clean out tubing hanger; SSPT; and BOPs. Pull out of hole above BOPs with washout assembly. Circulate seawater down drill string. Flush down Choke; Kill; and Boost line with seawater. Run side view camera to inspect BOPs and SSPT. Bullhead base oil thru SSPT below SCSSV. Perform inflow test on lower crown plug to 8485 psi differential. Perform inflow test on SCSSV to 8440 psi differential. 
	
09/04/2012: Displace Kill line with seawater. Land tree cap in tubing hanger. 
	
09/05/2012: Complete internal tree cap installation. Perform inflow test on internal tree cap to 9890 psi differential. Pull out of hole with tree cap running tool. Pull diverter and begin unlatching BOPs.
	
09/06/2012:  Unlatch BOPs. Remove SDC ring. Pull and layout riser slip joint and termination joint. Begin pulling riser.
	
09/07/2012: Continue pulling riser. 
	
09/08/2012: Recover UTA. Finish pulling riser and surface BOPs. ROV survey of well site. Begin between well maintenance.
"},{"   ":298,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-15","TEXT_REMARK":"02/15/2019: Rig up.

02/16/2019: Pressure test temporary equipment to 11;300 psi. Begin pumping operations.
"},{"   ":299,"WELL_NAME":"PS003","API12":608124005600,"WAR_START_DT":"2019-02-17","TEXT_REMARK":"02/17/2019: Continue pumping acid into well.
02/18/2019: Continue pumping acid into well.
02/19/2019: Rig down temporary equipment and flow back well.
"},{"   ":300,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2011-12-04","TEXT_REMARK":"12/04/2011: Waiting on visibility to clear prior to moving rig over final location and spudding well. Went to offline from 13:00 hrs to 19:30 hrs to perform weight test on SM PS003 surface cement. Spudded well at 21:30 hrs and jetted from 7127' to 7232'.

12/05/2011: Jetted 36" conductor from 7232' to 7435'. Allowed 6 hours soak time on conductor. Released CADA. TOH with jetting assy to surface. Began preparations for rig move ¿ pulling compatts (4 out of 5 recovered to SS basket at midnight).

12/06/2011:  Recovered final compatt. Attempted to locate PS003 and PS004 wellheads - failed due to visibility. Recovered SS basket with compatts to surface. Pulled hydrophones. Moved off location at 09:00 hrs.

"},{"   ":301,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-04-12","TEXT_REMARK":"04/12/2015: Washed through 36" casing with 26" drilling assembly from 7;111' to 7;425'. Drilled ahead from 7;425' to 8;890'. Switched from seawater to 10.1 ppg water based mud (WBM) at 7;920'.

04/13/2015: Continue to drill 26" hole section to 10;324' MD with 10.1 ppg WBM.

04/14/2015: Drilled 26" hole section to TD at 10;546'. Pumped hi-vis sweep and displaced the well to 12.5 ppg WBM. POOH to surface with 26" drilling assembly. R/U and begin 22" casing run to 49'.

04/15/2015: Run 22"/23" casing from 49' to 3;379' and make up to the high pressure wellhead (HPWH). R/D casing running equipment and run 5-7/8" inner string to 773'.

04/16/2015: Continue running 5-7/8" inner string. Make up mechanical rigid lock down (MRLD) running tool to the HPWH. Continue running 22" casing on 6-5/8" landing string. 23"/22" casing shoe at 10;496' MD. Make up cement stand and land out the HPWH. Dredge with ROV around the LPWHH valves in attempt to improve visablity.

04/17/2015: Continue dredging operations. Slack off 570K lbs to check for subsidence. None observed. Circulate 12.5 ppg WBM in preparation for cementing operations. Commence cementing operations.

04/18/2015: Pumped 1;680 bbls of 13.8 ppg Class H lead cement followed by 279 bbls of 16.4 ppg Class H tail slurry. Total of 11;000 cu ft cement pumped. Displaced cement with seawater - final lift pressure 1200 psi. ROV confirmed cement to surface with PH meter. Sample taken at mudline with ROV and confirmed cement returns. Rigidly lock down the HPWH to the LPH. Release the MRLD running tool from the HPWH and trip out of hole. Make up jet assembly and trip in hole to 10;266' and tag TOC. Set down 30k on firm cement. Displace well to 12.5 ppg inhibited WBM and pull out of hole with assembly. Move to DOZ.
"},{"   ":302,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-08-09","TEXT_REMARK":"08/09/2015: Run BOP on marine riser from 193' to 5;773'. 

08/10/2015: Complete running BOP on marine riser. Move on location. Make up Telescopic Joint. Land out and latch BOP; over pull and slump test BOP. Rig down riser running tool. P/U and install diverter. Fill up annulus and rig up to pressure test diverter.

08/11/2015: Pressure test diverter flowline seals to 350 psi for 5 min; good test. Function test diverter from Driller's panel; good test. Function test BSR/CSR from Blue Pod on Driller's panel; good test. Rig down diverter running tool and riser handling equipment. ROV function BSR closed via subsea intervention panel. Pressure test 22" casing and BSR to 250 psi low and 2100 psi high for 30 minutes with 9.9 ppg EMW; good test. Perform BOP EHBS emergency draw down test; good test. Rig up drill pipe running equipment. Make up dual cam tool and BOP test tool. Run in hole with same. Land out BOP test tool and rig up to test BOP stack. Pressure test BOP and associated valves on dual cam isolation tool assembly with 8.6 ppg SW from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Monitor annulus on trip tank. Troubleshooting suspected poly pack seals on lower annular leaking test #25. Pressure increasing to 350 psi increments of 30 psi per minute on wellbore. Confirming operator poly pack seal is bad. Pressure test wellbore to 1;800 psi to verify wellbore poly pack is good; good test). Monitor annulus on trip tank.

08/12/2015: Continue pressure testing BOP and associated valves on dual cam isolation tool assembly with 8.6 ppg seawater from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod (see IPT version 3.1.7.24 execution summary for details; which was provided to Bobby Nelson and Josh Ladner). Rig down cement lines; disengage dual cam and POOH above BOPs. Monitor well on trip tank (proper displacement observed). Pressure test BOPs and associated valves on the blind shears to 250 psi low and 11;500 psi high for 5 min with 8.6 ppg seawater from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod; good test. Make up top drive; wash down with 8.6 ppg SW to top of BOP Test Tool dual cam assy with 450 gpm @ 150 PSI. Re-engage; unseat test assembly from wellhead and start to pull to surface.

08/13/2015: POOH with dual cam test tool and bop test tool; clean and clear rig floor. Make up 18-1/8" x 21" drilling BHA and RIH with same. Wash down and tag TOC 10;254' MD. Begin displacing choke kill and boost with 11.2 ppg SBM.

08/14/2015: Finish displacing well to 11.2 ppg SBM. Drill cement from 10;254' MD to 10;446' MD. Conduct choke drill. Continued drilling cement and 10' of new formation to 10;556' MD. Perform successful FIT to 13.0 ppg EMW (990 psi). Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;556' MD to 10;804' MD. Current mud weight in hole 11.2 ppg.

08/15/2015: Continue drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;804' MD to 12;750' MD. Current mud weight in hole 11.6 ppg.
"},{"   ":303,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-08-16","TEXT_REMARK":"08/16/2015: Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 12;750' MD to 13;200' MD with 12.0 ppg SBM. At 13;200' MD; begin weighting up from 12.0 ppg to 12.3 ppg and continue drilling to 14;371' MD. At 14;371' MD; begin weighting up from 12.3 ppg to 12.5 ppg and continue drilling to 14;588' MD.

08/17/2015: Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 14;588' MD to 17;288' MD with 12.5 ppg SBM.

08/18/2015: Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 17;288' MD to 19;100' MD with 12.5 ppg SBM. At 19;100' MD; while drilling ahead; draw works lost height calibration due to uncontrolled release of torque on main well Top Drive after BHA stalled out in salt. Lost communications with LWD tools during uncontrolled release of torque by Top Drive. Trip out of the hole from 19;100' MD to 18;695' MD. Current mud weight 12.5 ppg SBM.

08/19/2015: Pull out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from 18;695' MD to surface. Prepare TDX-1250 Top Drive for troubleshooting uncontrolled release of torque issue. Current mud weight 12.5 ppg SBM.

08/20/2015: Continue to work with equipment manufacturer to troubleshoot TDX Top Drive uncontrolled torque release issue. Current mud weight 12.5 ppg SBM.

08/21/2015: Continue to work with equipment manufacturer to troubleshoot TDX Top Drive uncontrolled torque release issue. Make up new 18-1/8" x 21" drilling BHA and run in hole. Function test BSR/CSR from Blue Pod/ Toolpusher's panel. Space out across stack and rig up to test BOPs. Begin testing BOPs per approved procedure at 250 psi low and 4000 psi high pressure for 5 min each using IPT version 3.1. Current mud weight 12.5 ppg SBM.

08/22/2015: Pressure test BOPs and associated valves on 6.625" DP; with 12.5 ppg SBM from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod: 250 psi low for 5 min and 4;000 psi high for 5 min. Perform successful diverter function test from Driller's panel on 6-5/8" DP. Good test. Run 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly back in hole from 8;581' MD to 19;100' MD. Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 19;100' MD to 19;287' MD with 12.5 ppg SBM. Troubleshooting Top Drive issue with equipment manufacturer onboard while drilling ahead. Prepare to cut mud weight from 12.5 ppg to 11.8 ppg SBM. 
"},{"   ":304,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-08-23","TEXT_REMARK":"08/23/2015: Cut MW from 12.5 ppg to 11.8 ppg. Perform flow check. Drill ahead from 19;287'MD to 20;102' MD. Exited salt at 19;642' MD/ 19;445' TVD. Pick up off bottom to circulate with 2 mud pumps down. 

08/24/2015: Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 20;102' MD to 21;432' MD with 11.8 ppg SBM. BHA stalled and encountered uncontrolled release of torque event with Top Drive. 

08/25/2015: Decision made to POOH to check connections after Top Drive stall event. POOH from 21;432' MD to surface; checking connection on the way out. Troubleshoot Top Drive with equipment manufacturers onboard. 

08/26/2015: Effect Top Drive repairs. TIH with 18-1/8" by 21" BHA from surface to 10;367' MD. Perform BOP function test from Driller's panel/ Yellow Pod.

08/27/2015: TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 10;367' MD to 21;432' MD. Drill from 21;432' MD to 22;330' MD with 11.8 ppg SBM.

08/28/2015: Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 22;330' MD to 23;326' MD - section TD - with 11.8 ppg SBM. Pump 200 bbl sweep and circulate hole clean.

08/29/2015: Circulate hole clean. POOH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 23;326' MD to 7;818' MD. Function tested BOPs from Driller's panel/ Blue Pod and functioned tested diverter from Driller's panel on the trip out.
"},{"   ":305,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-08-30","TEXT_REMARK":"08/30/2015: Continue to TOH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA to surface. Rig up casing running equipment and TIH with 16" casing to 2;037' MD. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.

08/31/2015: Continue to run 16" casing to 13;474' MD. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Toolpushers panel; Yellow Pod; prior to casing crossing the BOP. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.

09/01/2015; Continue to run 16" casing to 15;812' MD. Rig down casing running equipment and rig up drill pipe equipment. Run 16" casing on landing string to 19;500' MD. Convert surge reduction equipment and wash down to 22;293' MD. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.

09/02/2015: Continue to wash down the 16" casing to 23;157' MD. Rig up cement head and continue washing down. Land out 16" hanger in the supplemental adapter. Circulate and condition hole prior to performing cement job. Cement 16" liner with 6014 cu ft (1070 bbls) of 13.0 ppg Class H lead cement followed by 1630 cu ft (290 bbls) of 16.2 ppg Class H tail cement. Begin displacing cement with 11.8 ppg SBM. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.

09/03/2015: Continue displacing cement with 3457 bbls of 11.8 ppg SBM. Bumped plug with 500 psi over final circulating pressure. Bled back 17 bbls to cement unit with a positive indication that the floats were not holding. Shut in and monitor pressure until the cement reached 500 psi compressive strength. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM. 

09/04/2015: Once cement reached 500 psi compressive strength; bled off pressure to cement unit. Confirm well is static and set/tested 16" seal assembly to 5000 psi for 10 min. Shear out of casing hanger with running tool and circulate 1.5x drill string volume. POOH with 16" casing running tool on landing string. Perform BSR/casing test to 250 psi low/ 4000 psi high for 30 min; good test. TIH to 2;088' MD. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.

09/05/2015: Continue to TIH to 8;400' MD and set wear sleeve. TOH and rack back wear sleeve running tool. Function test BSR/CSR from Driller's panel; Yellow pod; good test. TIH and perform Diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel. Continue to TIH and perform BOP pressure test from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod to 250 psi low for 5 min and 6;800 psi high for 5 min; good test. Function tested BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod; good test. Current mud weight is 11.8 ppg SBM.
"},{"   ":306,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-09-06","TEXT_REMARK":"09/06/2015: Continue to TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA and tag top of cement at 22;716' MD. Displace well from 11.8 ppg SBM to 12.2 ppg SBM. Drill out cement and 10' of new formation to 23;336' MD. Pump weighted hi-vis sweep and circulate bottoms up. Began leak off test. Current mud weight is 12.2 ppg SBM.

09/07/2015: Completed leak off test without success. Achieved a leak off test of 13.2 ppg EMW with a minimum requirement off 13.5 ppg EMW. POOH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA. Made up cement diverter sub and TIH to 23;305' MD. Current mud weight is 12.2 ppg SBM.

Note: On 09/07/2015 @ 19:27 hrs; Ms Engehy Pacheco (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to proceed with cement squeeze of 16" casing shoe.

09/08/2015: RIH with diverter sub to 23;336' MD and tag bottom. Pick up 10' to 23;326' MD and circulate bottoms up. Perform cement squeeze with 685 cu ft (122 bbls) of 16.2 ppg Class H cement. Displace cement with 645 bbls of 12.2 ppg SBM. POOH to 22;365' MD. Close upper annular and squeeze cement at 1/2 bpm down drill string and kill line until 1;790 psi pump pressure met. Hold pressure between 1;690 psi to 1;790 psi for 10 hours for cement to achieve 500 psi compressive strength. Bled off pressure and POOH from 22;365' MD to 20;612' MD. Current mud weight is 12.2 ppg SBM.

09/09/2015: Continue TOH with diverter sub to surface. Slip and cut drill line. Make up and RIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 6;535' MD. Function test BSR/CSR from Driller's panel on Blue Pod; good test. Continue to TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 8;068' MD. Current mud weight is 12.2 ppg SBM.

09/10/2015: Continue to TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 9;174' MD. Function test BOP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod and function tested diverter from Driller's panel; good test. Continue to TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA and tag top of cement at 23;029' MD. Drill out cement and 10' of new formation to 23;346' MD. POOH inside 16" casing to 23;194' MD. Perform successful FIT to 1700 psi surface pressure; 13.6 ppg EMW. TIH with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" BHA to 23;317' MD. Current mud weight is 12.2 ppg SBM.

09/11/2015: At 23;317' MD; open reamer and perform pull test to confirm open. Drill ahead from 23;346' MD to 24;566' MD; weighting up to 12.5 ppg. Unable to break out connection from TDX saver sub; connection eventually broke out 120K ft-lbs. POOH to 16" shoe and change out saver sub. Continue to drill ahead to 24;445' MD; weighting up to a 12.8 ppg. At 20:00 hrs; wait on weather as the ADCP current was above 2.0 knots. Weight up to 13.0 ppg while circulating while waiting on current.

Note: On 09/11/2015 @ 16:37 hrs; Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to reduce the drilling margin to 0.3 ppg; provided no HC zones are anticipated or encountered. Downhole pressure measuring must be operational while drilling with reduced margin.

09/12/2015: Drill ahead to 24;976' MD while weighting up to 13.2 ppg. Shut down to wait on weather for 1h 30m at 02:30 hrs while current was above 2 knots. Drill ahead to 24;976' MD/ 24;602' TVD. Shut down to wait on weather from 09:00 to 15:00 hrs. Pump out of hole to the 16" shoe. Continue to wait on weather. Current mud weight is 13.2 ppg SBM.
"},{"   ":307,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-09-13","TEXT_REMARK":"09/13/2015: Wait on loop current above 2.0 knots. Trip in hole from 23;146' MD (22;832' TVD) to 24;979' MD (24;604' TVD). Drill 14.5" x 16.5" hole section to TD at 25;072' MD. Spot 16.5ppg SBM pill in rat hole. Begin to pull out of hole with 14.5" x 16.5" drilling assembly. Current MW: 13.2 ppg.

09/14/2015: Pull out of hole with 14.5" x 16.5 drilling assembly from 22;933' MD (22;626' TVD) to surface. Slip and cut drill line. Rig up to run 14" liner. Run 14" liner from surface to 2;541' MD/TVD. Current MW: 13.2 ppg.

09/15/2015: Run in hole with 14" casing from 2;541' MD/TVD to 3;388' MD/TVD. Function BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's panl; Blue Pod. Run in hole with 14" casing on landing string from 3;388' MD/TVD to 24;949' MD (24;575' TVD). Cement casing with 116 bbls (651 cu ft) 16.2 ppg cement and begin to displace. Current MW: 13.2 ppg.

09/16/2015: Continue to displace cement with 1501 bbls of 13.2 ppg SBM and bumped plug. Good cement lift pressure of 330 psi. Bled back and confirmed floats holding.  Drop 2-3/4" activation ball and set liner hanger with 4150 psi. Observe pressure increase on annulus to confirm liner hanger set. Circulate drill string to clean pipe; then pull out of hole to surface. Current MW: 13.2 ppg.

09/17/2015: Finish slip and cut on drill line. Test BSR and 14" casing to 250 psi low; 2700 psi high from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Good test. Function test BSR/CSR from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod. Trip in hole from surface to 13;243' MD/TVD with 12.25" drilling BHA. Function test diverter from Toolpusher's panel.  Function BOPs on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel on Yellow Pod. Begin pressure testing BOPs on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Current MW: 13.2 ppg.

09/18/2015: Finish BOP pressure test on 5-7/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod to 250 psi low for 5 min and 8;400 psi high for 5 min for pipe rams and 4800 psi on annular. Good test. Space out and perform BOP pressure test on 6-5/8" DP from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod to 250 psi low for 5 min and 8;400 psi high for 5 min. Good test. Trip in hole with 12.25" drilling BHA and tag cement at 24;775' MD (24;407' TVD).  Begin weighing up mud from 13.2 ppg to 13.6 ppg. Current MW: 13.6 ppg.

09/19/2015: Finish choke drills; weight up to 13.6 ppg and drill out shoe track and clean rathole from 24;775' MD (24;407' TVD) to 25;072' MD (24;694' TVD). Drill 10 feet of new hole from 25;072' MD (24;694' TVD) to 25;082' MD (24;703' TVD). Perform FIT with 13.6 ppg mud and 1060 psi to 14.4 ppg equivalent mud weight. Drill 12-1/4" hole section from 25;082' MD (24;703' TVD) to 25;360' MD (24;973 TVD). Current MW: 13.6 ppg.
"},{"   ":308,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-09-20","TEXT_REMARK":"09/20/2015: Drill ahead 12.25" hole from 25;360' MD (24;969' TVD) to 27;108' MD (26;651' TVD) with 13.6 ppg SBM. Weighted up to 13.9 ppg MW while drilling ahead.

09/21/2015: Drill ahead 12.25" hole from 27;108' MD (26;651' TVD) to well TD of 28;692' MD (28;195' TVD) with 13.9 ppg MW.

9/22/2015: Pump 200 bbl weighted sweep; and CBU displacing well to 14.0 ppg. Perform static influx test; and CBU. Pump out of the hole to top of 14" liner; reaming tight spots. Pump a slug. Pump out of the hole with 12.25" drilling assembly to 26;183' MD.

09/23/2015: Pump and pulled out of hole from 26;183' MD (25;743' TVD) to 21;433' MD (21;157' TVD) and flow checked at top of 14" liner. Continued to pull out of hole from 21;433' MD (21;157' TVD) to 19;310' MD (19;117' TVD) and then performed a BOP function test from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod. Spaced out and performed a diverter function test from Driller's Panel and then continued to pull out of hole to 341' MD. 

09/24/2015: Continue pulling out of hole with 12.25" drilling assembly and function tested the BSR/CSR from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod. Rigged up wireline equipment and performed XPT (pressureXpress)/Gamma Ray logging from 28;692' MD (28;195' TVD) to 24;750' MD (25;360' TVD). 

09/25/2015: Continue logging with XPT (pressureXpress)/Gamma Ray and obtaining pressures. Pulled out of the hole with wireline tools due to tool failure. Changed out XPT (pressureXpress)/Gamma Ray tool string and ran in hole with MDT tool string. Completed logging and pressure points from 28;692' MD (28;195' TVD) to 24;750' MD (25;360' TVD). Pulled out of hole with wireline and rigged down wireline.

09/26/2015: Rigged up 9-7/8" casing handling equipment and ran in hole with 9-7/8" casing to 4;171' MD/TVD. Made up the liner hanger and continue to run in hole from 4;171' MD/TVD to 4;259' MD/TVD. Rigged down the casing handling equipment and rigged up drill pipe running equipment. Run 9-/7/8" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 4;402' MD/TVD to 12;988' MD (12;987' TVD).
"},{"   ":309,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-09-27","TEXT_REMARK":"09/27/2015: Continued to run 9-7/8" liner on 6-5/8" landing string from 12;988' MD/TVD to 28;535' MD/ 28;043' TVD. Wash down from 28;535' to 28;620'. M/U cmt stand to string. Wash down from 28;620' MD/ 28;125' TVD to 28;692' MD/ 28;195' TVD; tagged bottom with 50k down. Positioned shoe at 28;690' MD/ 28;193' TVD. Commence pre-job circulation; losses encountered at 3 and 4 bpm; slowed pumps to 2 bpm with full returns. Pumped 65 bbls of 15.2 ppg lead spacer; mixed and pumped 281 cu ft (50 bbls) of 16.2 ppg cement slurry.

09/28/2015: Continued cementing 9-7/8" liner. Mixed and pumped an additional 623 cu ft (111 bbls) of 16.2 ppg cement slurry (total of 904 cu ft/ 161 bbls pumped). Pumped 20 bbls of tail spacer and displaced cement with 963 bbls of 14.0 ppg SBM at 2.25 bpm with full returns. Set liner hanger at 24;463' MD/ 24;105' TVD. POOH to 24;136' MD/ 23;789' TVD. POOH with hanger running tool to 11;836' MD/TVD. 

09/29/2015: Continued POOH with 9-7/8" hanger running tool to surface. Pressure tested 9-7/8" liner and BSR from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod; to 250/1645 psi for 30 min (good test). Function tested BSR/CSR from Driller's panel; Blue Pod (good test). Made up 9-7/8" EZSV assembly and TIH from surface to 12;457' MD/TVD.

09/30/2015: Continued TIH with 9-7/8" EZSV assembly to 24;460' MD/24;103' TVD. Washed down through 9-7/8" liner top from 24;460' MD/ 24;103' TVD to 24;490' MD/ 24;132' TVD. Continued TIH to 28;133' MD/ 27;654' TVD and set 9-7/8" EZSV. Stung into EZSV and pressure tested bottom of packer to 1;645 psi for 5 minutes (good test). Stung out of EZSV and POOH to 28;035' MD/ 27;560' TVD and circulated bottoms up. POOH to 27;816' MD/ 27;348' TVD and function tested diverter from Toolpusher's panel (good test). Spaced out across BOP and performed BOP function test from Driller's panel; Blue Pod. Positive tested top of EZSV to 1;645 psi for 30 minutes (good test). Rigged up to perform negative test. Displaced base oil down drill pipe until 2;900 psi pump pressure was reached and closed test rams.

10/01/2015: Continued with negative test procedure. Bled back base oil to cement unit in 5 bbl increments from 2;827 psi to 200 psi. Held 200 psi for 15 minutes; confirmed no pressure increase. Continued to bleed pressure to 0 psi and monitored well for 30 minutes on chart; confirmed no flow (good test). A total of 29.5 bbls bled back. Pumped base oil back down drill pipe until original shut-in drill pipe pressure of 2;940 psi was reached - 29.5 bbls pumped in. Opened test rams; reverse circulated base oil out of drill pipe. Tripped out of hole with EZSV running tool to 17;185' MD/ 17;065' TVD. Pressure tested BOP on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod; with 14.0 ppg to 250/8;450 psi on the rams and 250/4;450 psi on the annular; good test. TIH with EZSV running tool to 17;525' MD/ 17;393' TVD to put 6-5/8" 34# drill pipe across BOP stack and begin pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod; with 14.0 ppg.

10/02/2015: Continued to pressure test BOP on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod; with 14.0 ppg to 250/8;450 psi on the rams. Troubleshoot issue with cement unit not being able to maintain prime to pressure test BOP. Pulled screens on cement suction line and removed LCM. Broke circulation with cement unit and attempted to pressure test BOP with no success. Cleaned out and flushed cement unit while weighted up with clean 12.0 ppg SBM to 14.0 ppg SBM. Completed pressure testing BOP on 6-5/8" drill pipe without any issues; good test. Trip out of hole with EZSV running tool to 10;269' MD/TVD. Made up selectable wear sleeve retrieval tool assembly and TIH to 17;420' MD/ 17;292' TVD (7;100' MD/TVD DQ tool depth). Landed out with 30 kips as per Dril-Quip representative and picked up with no indication that wear sleeve was retrieved. Pulled selectable wear sleeve to surface (wear sleeve was not attached). Made up new Dril-Quip selectable wear sleeve retrieval tool assembly and TIH to 15;598' MD/ 15;577' TVD.

10/03/2015: Continued TIH with Dril-Quip selectable wear sleeve retrieval assembly from 15;598' MD/ 15;577' TVD to 17;391' MD/ 17;264 TVD. Landed out wear sleeve retrieval tool with 20 kips. POOH with selectable wear sleeve and EZSV running tool to 10;282' MD/TVD. Laid out wear sleeve and retrieval assembly. Continued TOH with EZSV running tool to surface. R/U to run 10-3/4" X 9-7/8" tieback. 
"},{"   ":310,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-10-04","TEXT_REMARK":"10/04/2015: R/U OES handling equipment. Function test BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. TIH with Versaflex seal stem and 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from surface to 10;913' MD/TVD. Due to excess weight set down on seal assembly at 16" hanger; decision was made to TOH and verify integrity of the seal stem assembly. 

10/05/2015: TOH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from 10;913' MD/TVD to 944' MD/TVD. Inspected sealing area on each joint. 29 of 31 doubles of the 10-3/4" casing had seal area damage. 2 of 82 doubles of the 9-7/8" casing had seal area damage.

10/06/2015: Continued TOH with the 9-7/8" casing to surface. Total 4 of 92 doubles of the 9-7/8" casing were damaged. Inspected the seal stem joint; no visible damage. P/U 6-5/8" DP and TIH same. Performed BOP function test from Driller's panel; Blue Pod; and Diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel. TOH with 6-5/8" DP; and R/U OES casing handling equipment. Wait on replacement tieback casing to arrive at the rig.

10/07/2015: Continued waiting on tieback casing to arrive at rig. Tieback casing arrived on location at 18:00 hrs; offloaded casing and prepare it to TIH. 

10/08/2015: TIH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from surface to 1;490' MD/TVD. Function tested BSR/CSR from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod. Continued TIH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from 1;490' MD/TVD to 4;185' MD/TVD.

10/09/2015: Continued TIH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from 4;185 MD/TVD to 8;486' MD/TVD. Obtained initial torque charts and sent to office for review. Troubleshooting connection make up.

10/10/2015: Laid out 2 joints of 10-3/4" casing due to failed torque charts; and found threads galled. Shut down operations to evaluate casing connections issue with office. After discussion; decision was made to TOH with the tieback string and begin temporary abandonment operation. TOH with 9-7/8" x 10-3/4" tieback string from 8;486' MD/TVD to 325' MD/TVD.
"},{"   ":311,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-10-11","TEXT_REMARK":"10/11/2015: Trip out of hole with 9-7/8" tieback from 325' to surface. Inspected seal stem assembly with no visible damage. TIH and set bore protector. TOH and laid out bore protector running tool. TIH to 17;500' MD with mule shoe cementing assembly and circulate bottoms up. 

Note: Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to commence with Temporary Abandonment operations. Mr. Dale Sanderson (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson via email that the Pacific Sharav is ready to begin stump testing of our second BOP stack; that will be used for our next well.

10/12/2015: Spotted balanced plug with 69 bbls (388 cu ft) of 15.8 ppg Class H cement from 17;200' MD to 17;500' MD. TOH from 17;500' MD to surface. 

10/13/2015: Function tested BSR/CSR from Yellow Pod; Driller's panel. Trip in hole and set EZSV assembly at 17;000' MD. Set down 40k to confirm EZSV set. Function Test Diverter from Toolpusher's panel. Performed positive pressure test to 1;000 psi for 15 minutes; good test. Begin negative test on EZSV; pumping calculated 226 bbls of base oil to achieve a 2;627 psi test pressure.

10/14/2015: Continued negative test. Pumped 214 bbls of base oil to achieve test pressure. Closed test rams and performed negative test at 16;992'. Bled back 18.75 bbls. Charted negative test holding 100 psi for 15 minutes; good test. Bled remaining pressure and monitored well for 30 minutes. No flow observed. Good test. Reversed out base oil. Circulated bottoms up prior to pumping cement plug. Spotted balanced plug with 63 bbls (354 cu ft) of 15.8 ppg Class H cement from 16;700' MD to 17;000' MD. TOH from 17;000' to 16;143' MD. Circulated B/U. TOH from 16;143' MD to 8;087' MD. Displaced choke; kill; booster and annulus from 14 ppg SBM to seawater. 

Note: BSEE arrived onboard to perform rig inspection. All results found to be acceptable. 

10/15/2015: Completed displacing well from 14 ppg SBM to seawater. Performed BOP function test on 5-7/8" drill pipe from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod; good test. Spotted balanced plug with 32 bbls (180 cu ft) of Class H cement from 8;100' MD to 7;950' MD. Trip out of hole from 8;100' MD to 7;900' MD. Spotted 219 bbls of treated drill water above cement plug. Trip in hole from 7;900' MD to surface.  Trip in hole with circulating sub and riser brushes to 7;242' MD. Trip out of hole while circulating to 7;115' to wash BOP. 

Note: On 10/15/2015; Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) granted Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) approval to delay BOP testing if weather delays unlatching BOP past 10/16/2015. Mr. Dale Sanderson with Chevron gave Mr. Bobby Nelson e-mail alerting him it will be after midnight before unlatching.

10/16/2015: Finish washing BOP's. Run in hole to retrieve NBP. PBL sub could not pass through 16' supplemental adapter. Pull out of hole and lay down PBL. Trip in hole to retrieve NBP and pull out of hole with same. Clean rig floor and pollution pan in rotary. Rig up to unlatch and pull riser.

Note: On 10/16/2015; Mr. Dale Sanderson with Chevron sent Mr. Bobby Nelson an email alerting him that it will be after midnight before unlatching.

10/17/2015: Completed rigging up riser running equipment. Unlatched BOP from PS004. Pulled riser to 6;853'. Moved rig to safe DOZ and continued pulling riser to 5;953'.
"},{"   ":312,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-01-25","TEXT_REMARK":"THIS OPERATION CONSISTS OF RETURNING TO THE WELL TO RUN AND SET THE 9.875" x 10.75" PRODUCTION TIEBACK CASING; AND THEN COMPLETE THE WELL.

01/25/2016: Landed and latched BOP onto HPHW. Performed pull and slump test. Transferred weight to tensioners. Installed diverter. Performed BOP connector test against LBSR and 16" casing during ROV hot-stab intervention test to 1;000 psi with 8.6 ppg seawater - good test. Performed deadman test per TOI procedure - good test. Performed diverter test on 6-5/8" drill pipe - good test. TIH with cleanout BHA and BOP test tool on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 5;280'.

01/26/2016: TIH with cleanout assembly from 5;280' to 7;474'. Performed accumulator drawdown test per TOI procedure - good test. TIH and landed Dril-Quip BOP test tool at 7;123'. Tested UBSRs and LBSRs; associated valves; and connector to 250/11;500 psi. TIH and engage Dual Cam tool. TOH and spaced out for 6-5/8" across BOP. Rigged up and tested annular and related equipment to 250/6;500 psi; BOP; related equipment; and surface equipment to 250/11;500' psi as per IPT test plan on 6-5/8" drill pipe against test rams - good tests. TOH to space out 5-7/8" DP across BOP. Rigged up and tested annular and related equipment to 250/6;500 psi; BOP; related equipment; and surface equipment to 250/11;500' psi as per IPT test plan on 5-7/8" against test rams - good tests. Function tested diverter from Toolpusher's panel - good test. TOH from 7;474' to 349' with cleanout assembly. TIH with 14-1/2" cleanout assembly from 349' to 605'. Function tested BOPs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod - good test. 

01/27/2016: Function tested LBSRs and UBSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod - good tests. TIH with 14-1/2" cleanout assy from 605' to 7;990'. 

01/28/2016: Displaced well from 8.6 ppg seawater to 14.0 ppg. Drilled cement plug from 7;990' to 8;097'. TIH from 8;097' to 12;997'.

01/29/2016: TIH from 12;997' to 16;720' MD on 5-7/8" drill pipe. Drilled cement plug from 16;720' to 17;003' MD. Drilled bridge plug from 17;003' to 17;007' MD. TIH from 17;007' to 17;182' MD. Drilled cement plug from 17;182' to 17;244' MD.

01/30/2016: Drilled cement from 17;244' to 17;565' MD.
"},{"   ":313,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-01-31","TEXT_REMARK":"01/31/2016: Drilled cement from 17;565' to 17;675' on 5-7/8" drill pipe - broke out of cement. Washed and reamed remainder of stand down to 17;772'. TIH 1 stand to 17;857'. Pumped 100 bbls weighted Hi-Vis and circulated surface to surface. Performed flow check. TIH from 17;857' to 18;740' - tagged obstruction with 30 Klbs. Washed and reamed from 18;740' to 20;156'. Washed down from 20;156' to 21;291'. TIH from 21;291' to 21;569'. Washed down from 21;569' and tagged top of 14" liner with 20 klbs. Verified TOL at 21;543' by tagging 4 times with 30 Klbs. Pumped 100 bbls weighted Hi-Vis sweep and circulated surface to surface. Performed flow check. Pumped slug and TOH with 14-1/2" cleanout assy from 21;543' to 3;004' on 5-7/8" drill pipe.

02/01/2016: TOH with 14-1/2" cleanout BHA from 3;004' to surface. (Offline: Tested casing to 1;600 psi for 30 mins against UBSRs and EZSV - good test. Function tested UBSRs and LBSRs from Driller's panel; Blue Pod - good test. TIH with 8-1/2" polish mill assy on 5-7/8" drill pipe from surface to 20;849'. 

02/02/2016: TIH from 20;849' to 24;560' (tag 9-7/8" TOL at 24;481' with polish mill). TOH from 24;560' to 24;470'. Function tested BOP from Toolpusher panel; blue pod - good test. Function tested BOP from Driller's panel; Yellow Pod - good test. Function tested diverter from Driller's panel - good test. TIH and tag TOL with polish mill.

02/03/2016: TOH on 5-7/8" drill pipe from 24;560' to 15;042'. TIH from 15;042' to 24;560'; tagging TOL at 24;481' with polish mill. TOH from 24;560' to 18;554'.

02/04/2016: TOH from 18;554' to surface. Slip and cut drill line. Service drill floor equipment. Change out saver sub on MDDM. Remove TOI elevators; bails and knuckle links. R/U casing handling equipment. 

02/05/2016: Continue R/U casing handling equipment. Function tested BSRs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod - good test. TIH with 9-7/8" casing from surface to 7;143'. 

02/06/2016: TIH with 9-7/8" casing from 7;143' to 8;330'. TIH with 10-3/4" casing from 8;330' to 17;051'."},{"   ":314,"WELL_NAME":"PS004","API12":608124005800,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-02-07","TEXT_REMARK":"02/07/2016: Ran in hole with 10-3/4" 85.30# C-110 SLSF tieback casing and casing hanger from 17;051' to 17;400'. Tripped in hole with 10-3/4" x 9-7/8" tieback on 6-5/8" LS from 17;400' to 24;464'. Made up cement stand and tripped in hole from 24;464' to 24;499'. Stung seal assembly into polished bore receptacle and slacked off to 24;509' with 15' seal engagement. Soft landed dummy hanger in wellhead. Tested stem seals down landing string to 1;300 psi for 5 mins; good test. Picked up to 24;464'; staged pumps up to 10 BPM with 1;300 psi circulating and conditioning mud for cementing.

02/08/2016: Pumped tieback cement job: total cement volume = 1;456 bbls/ 8;175 cu ft/ 5;103 sks of 15.5 ppg lead slurry and 146 bbls/ 819 cu ft/ 589 sks of 16.6 ppg tail slurry. Displaced cement with 1;493 bbls 14.0 ppg SBM. Landed 9 7/8" x 10 3/4" casing hanger at 7;123'. Pressure tested hanger to 8;000 psi for 5 min; good test. Pulled out of hole with landing string and casing hanger seal assembly running tool from 7;057' to surface. 

Note: On 02/08/2016 @ 19:19 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) received email approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to delay BOP pressure testing 48 hours to 02/11/2016; however; BOP function testing must still be performed as per schedule.

02/09/2016: Tripped in hole with Lead Impression Tool and 9-5/8" fixed ram test assembly. Landed Lead Impression Tool in wellhead at 7;121'. Pressured up down drill string to 2;500 psi; activating Lead Impression Tool. Pulled out of hole to 7;979' and spaced out for BOP function test. Function tested BOPs from Driller's Panel on Blue Pod; and from Toolpusher's Panel on Yellow Pod; good test. Function tested diverter from Toolpusher's Panel; good test. Pulled out of hole with LIT from 7;979' to 1;168'.

Note: On 02/9/2016 @ 07:24 hrs; Mr. Chris Gerlitz (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson and Mr. Josh Ladner (BSEE) that the Chevron Discoverer Clear Leader is currently finishing tieback operations on SM PS004. Chevron will be conducting the BOP wet verification and BOP connector tests on Saturday 02/13/2016 as per submitted APM. Please accept this as Chevron's 72 hour notice for initial BOP testing for St. Malo PS004 Completion.

02/10/2016: Pulled out of hole with Lead Impression Tool from 1;168' to 1;029'. Tripped in hole with BOP test tool and 9-5/8" test mandrel on 5-7/8" drill pipe. Tripped in hole and landed BOP test tool in wellhead at 7;120'. Tested 9-5/8" fixed rams to 250 psi/ 8;000 psi for 5 min; good test. Pulled out of hole with BOP test tool to surface. Made up Lock Down Sleeve setting tool and tripped in hole to 7;120'. Set Lock Down Sleeve; pressuring up to 5;000 psi. Confirmed Lock Down Sleeve locked with 60 klbs overpull.
